job_description:
**Ciena is committed to our people-first philosophy. Our teams enjoy a culture focused on prioritizing a personalized and flexible work environment that empowers an individual’s passions, growth, wellbeing and belonging. We’re a technology company that leads with our humanity—driving our business priorities alongside meaningful social, community, and societal impact.**  

  

**Not ready to apply? Join our****Talent Community****to get relevant job alerts straight to your inbox.**

**Why Ciena:**

* We are big proponents of **life-work integration** and provide the flexibility and tools to make it a reality with remote work and potentially, part-time work.
* We believe an **inclusive, diverse and barrier-free** work environment makes for empowered and committed employees.
* We recognize the importance of **well-being** and offer programs and benefits to support and sustain the mental and physical health of our employees and their families and offer a variety of paid family leave programs.
* We are committed to **employee development**, offering tuition reimbursement and a variety of in-house learning and mentorship opportunities.
* We know that **financial security** is important. We offer competitive salaries and incentive programs, RSU’s (job level specific) and an employee share option purchase program.
* We realize **time away** to recharge is non-negotiable. We offer flexible paid time off!
* Great work deserves **recognition.** We have a robust recognition program, with ongoing and enhanced awards for exemplary performance.

**How You Will Contribute:**

  

Ciena's customers run many of the largest telecommunication networks in the world connecting hundreds of millions of users. The Liquid Spectrum (LQS) team invents software applications and algorithms which empower owner operators to understand the state of their networks, plan for the future and recognize opportunities for improving network performance.


As a member of the LQS team you will collaborate with teams throughout the organization from optical engineering to software development infrastructure to architecture. You will help advance our workflows to further formalize connecting that varied expertise to create our world class products and play a pivotal role in defining these products and their evolution.

* You will develop a strong technical understanding of the Ciena’s modem technologies and photonic line systems and the optical performance of those in the context of metro, long haul and submarine deployment
* You will develop, document and evaluate photonic performance optimization algorithms and product workflows
* You will develop and understanding of how to provision and operate Ciena’s modems and photonic line system
* You will work with software designers in the team to design various LQS components and participate to development activities in all stages of product life cycle. This includes prototyping ideas, documenting, developing, testing, builds & automations and customer support.
* You will help translate design into development tasks, estimate those tasks and execute those tasks
* You will define test plans for the products and participate in the execution, the verification of the results and the automation of those tests. This includes software component testing but also lab testing

**What Does Ciena Expect of You?**

* **Customer First Mentality –** what’s important to the customer is also important to you.
* **Initiative –** You’re a self-starter who works with limited direction and is committed to delivering against aggressive deadlines.
* **Creative thinking –** you’re keen to understand technology and see opportunities to compartmentalize higher level requirements into design tasks.
* **Agility** – you are readily able to manage competing and ever-changing account priorities and maintain a balanced and methodical approach to problem solving.
* **Communication expertise** –can tailor your message and ideas to the audience to ensure understanding and agreement.
* **Leadership** – you exceed in collaborating with and leading multidisciplinary teams.
* The flexibility to **work independently** and as **part of a broader team** – you thrive in a team environment, but are comfortable working independently as required.
* **A commitment to learning** – you keep abreast of photonic and telecommunication industry developments and thought-leaders.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Physics (or Applied Physics) or equivalent
* Fundamentals of programming, data structure, algorithms and design patterns
* Experience developing software in Python
* Strong commitment to product excellence and quality
* Good Communication skills with strong analytical abilities
* Excellent team worker with strong interpersonal skills

**Assets:**

* Knowledge of fiber optics communication
* Distributed systems design patterns
* Experience developing software in C

**Why Ciena?**

* We are a company **rooted in people**—seeking to create a **vibrant and inclusive environment**, where everyone feels they can belong.
* Accelerate your career path by gaining **hands-on experience** and exposure to the latest technology. Our interns and graduates work on **real projects** in real time in world class labs. Be a part of tomorrow’s future – today.
* **Mentoring. Networking. Leadership Opportunities**. We recognize that learning does not stop when you leave school - we champion a team environment for development and provide the tools to achieve success.
* We are big proponents of **life-work integration.** Our people make a significant difference at Ciena, but we want to shine light on their differences outside of working hours too. CienaCares supports non-profit causes important to employees bymatching employee financial contributions and dedicating time for volunteering.

**The Opportunity:**


Work term of 4, 8, 12 or 16 months starting in January 2025.

**How You Will Contribute:**


We design, implement, and maintain real-time embedded platform and application software for several of Ciena’s flagship products. Functional areas in our scope range from low level bit flipping drivers to high level software state machines for interfacing with external applications:

* Linux and VxWorks kernels and base software components
* Drivers for proprietary and 3rd party ASICs, FPGAs, and other hardware components.
* Hardware/software interface to provide bridging of various abstraction layers.
* Fault and alarms subsystems to detect, report and maintain defects and manage their hysteresis and co-relations.
* System applications such as traffic/equipment protection, performance monitoring, etc.
* Software Development Kits that abstract the underlying low-level software and hardware to facility platform application developments and integration.

**What Does Ciena Expect of You?**

* **A sense of urgency** – what is important to the customer is equally important to you. You make getting things done a priority.
* **Integrity –** you hold yourself to the highest level of personal and professional standards of conduct.
* A commitment to **innovation** – you continually seek to learn, understand modern technologies and ever-changing market conditions, and endeavor to apply that knowledge to Ciena’s advantage.
* You **embrace change** – thriving in a diverse environment of ever-changing priorities and sometimes stressful situations.
* The flexibility to **work independently** with minimal supervision as well as **part of a broader team.**

**The Must Haves:**

* Enrolled in a bachelor’s or master's degree in computer or electrical engineering, computer science, or similar disciplines
* Experience with C or C++

**Assets:**

* Developing software for embedded systems or telecom products
* Understanding of CPU hardware architectures, hardware functional specifications, hardware timing diagrams, device data sheets
* Understanding of real-time operating systems and embedded systems
* Software development tools such as git, BitBucket, Gerrit, Jira, etc.
* Unit test frameworks such as Google Test, JUnit, Robot, PyTest, and the like
* Debuggers and tools (e.g., gdb), especially for troubleshooting embedded systems in user space and kernel space
* High-level programming and scripting languages such as Java, Python, Perl, Tcl, bash
* YANG modeling language and toolchains
* Software development methodologies such as Agile or Waterfall
* Familiarity with datacom and telecom concepts such as DWDM, SONET/SDH, OTN, Ethernet, OSI Model, TCP/IP, MPLS


The pay range for this position is $24.50-$33.00

**Spécialiste de stations de test – composants photoniques**


Ciena est peut-être l'entreprise technologique la plus importante dont vous n’avez jamais entendu parler. Les innovations qui nous épatent (les voitures autonomes), et celles que nous tenons désormais pour acquises (la possibilité de diffuser en continu votre émission préférée sur votre appareil mobile) sont les produits de l'ingéniosité de certaines entreprises brillantes et avant-gardistes. Mais ces entreprises comptent sur Ciena, une autre entreprise à l’avant-garde de l'innovation, pour créer et faire progresser les réseaux sous-jacents qui apportent leurs percées à nos portes. VR, AI, IOT, 5G… rien de tout cela ne serait possible sans la technologie époustouflante qui fait fonctionner Internet lui-même. Depuis plus de 25 ans, Ciena est le leader mondial de la stratégie de mise en réseau, et notre technologie fait partie de l'infrastructure critique des entreprises les plus avancées au monde.

**Aperçu du rôle**

* Le candidat joindra l’équipe de développement des stations de test qui est responsable de développer et de maintenir des stations de test complexes utilisées par les ingénieurs de validation et de fiabilité mandatés pour tester nos composants photoniques à haute vitesse.
* Le spécialiste de stations de test doit également participer au développement d’un pipeline de transfert de données efficace qui est vital à notre environnement en continuel changement. De courts délais entre la prise de mesures et des résultats actionnables permettent de rendre nos équipes de design plus performantes.

**Responsabilités**

* Design de stations de test : Sélection de l’instrumentation (photonique et électrique), schémas, câblage et circuits imprimés.
* Développer, tester et déployer des logiciels. Interfaces utilisateur, contrôle des équipements de test, automatisation des séquences de test, l'acquisition et l'analyse des données.
* Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les ingénieurs de validation et de fiabilité pour comprendre les besoins et définir les solutions optimales.
* Aider à augmenter la vélocité de l’équipe en favorisant la réutilisation des logiciels et du matériel.

**Compétences professionnelles et personnelles requises**

* Diplôme en génie (électrique, physique) et une expérience de travail de plus de 3 ans dans un rôle connexe.
* Excellente connaissance d'un ou de plusieurs des langages suivants: C#, Matlab, SQL, Python.
* Expérience démontrée dans le déploiement de solutions de test électro-optiques.
* Expérience dans un ou plusieurs des domaines suivants: composants photoniques, design de PCB, automatisation d’appareils de mesure, base de données, analyse de données, programmation embarquée, programmation de PLC.
* La capacité de travailler et de communiquer en français est requise.


Emplacement : **Ville de Québec - Canada**

Ciena may well be the most important technology company you’ve never heard of. Product Design

Customer Interaction

Cross-functional Support and Alignment

* Ensure the design teams are aligned with the proposed solution and understand the requirements to implement the design

* Ensure PLM are informed about any roadblocks that arise during product design and integration that may require changes to the product definition


Qualifications

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.

**Job description:**


Ciena’s Supply chain procurement organization is looking for a dynamic Senior Semiconductor component engineer that specialized in high end FPGA, cross-point switches and power devices. The successful candidate will be responsible for the full life cycle of the component within its commodity scope, starting from the component selection and coding process all the way to the archiving of the component record. The semiconductor component engineer is also responsible for the quality and reliability specifications/requirements for all procured hardware components within its commodity scope by working proactively with the Ciena development team and Ciena suppliers. The component engineer will work with the NPI Sourcing/Global Commodity Management team (GCM) as well as with the development teams to provide guidance/input into the selection of reliable technologies, process and components for new designs, life cycle management programs or cost reduction initiatives through commodity councils. The component engineer will also be responsible to evaluate the reliability impact of product change notifications (PCNs) received from our suppliers and coordinate review of these PCNs and Last Time Buy (LTB) notices internally to resolution as well as manage component life cycles and support business and technical issues. The component engineer needs to ensure the field reliability of Ciena products by performing risk assessment and establishing the corporate qualification status in the corporate component database.

**Key responsibilities**:


The component engineer is responsible for the following tasks in a timely & professional manner;

* Definition of qualification requirements based on industry standards.
* Coding of new components, including writing the technical procurement specifications.
* Reliability qualification of its component portfolio.
* Ensure supply security by multi-sourcing its component portfolio
* Supplier audits & development activities including documenting/resolving audits finding, process audited along with key parameters of the process/production capabilities and capacity.
* Managing the technical relationship with our supply base.
* Documenting the components in Ciena corporate database, including the components compliance to environmental regulations (RoHS, REACH, TSCA, others).
* Compliance/regulatory assessments (EU, FOC, Conflict Mineral, Nom, power supply safety, etc…) .
* Guidance for the selection of reliable components based on failure mechanisms.
* Participate in commodity councils to provide guidance to our design counter part of the technology of choice for future development.
* Ongoing maintenance of the database based upon product change notifications from our suppliers.
* Establish Ciena position on reliability issues, support the resolution of business critical delivery problems, cost reduction programs & supplier supply agreements/negotiations.
* Coordinate prompt resolution of component level issues. Leverage quality and failure analysis support at the CM, and work directly with the component manufacturers where needed. Issues include end of life notifications, product change notices (PCN), and component level test failures, etc…
* Coordinate component qualifications for new revision parts and/or replacement parts.

**Qualifications and Experience required:**

* M.S Degree or Ph.D (preferred) in physics or electronics engineering with at least 15 years of relevant experience.
* Proven track record and established subject matter expertise on reliability, quality and failure mechanisms for semiconductor communication components.
* Demonstrate extensive experience and knowledge/understanding of Semiconductor fabrication process for FPGA and power devices, transistors, linear/analog/digital logic, diodes, LEDs.
* Demonstrate extensive experience and knowledge/understanding of the fabrication process and the qualification process for integrated power modules.
* Knowledge of Silicon (28nm and below) process.
* Availability to travel 15-20% of time.
* Telecommunication knowledge with excellent command of relevant industry standards, Telcordia, IPC,JEDEC, etc.
* Extensive experience with technical and ‘hands-on’ component production line audit.
* Strong communication/team work skills to work with relevant departments within Ciena.
* Strong leadership skills and influence in order to drive root cause analysis and corrective actions implementation as required.
* Attention to details, organized and motivated to excel.
* Focused on completing assigned tasks in a timely manner.

**Why Ciena:**

* We are big proponents of **life-work integration** and provide the flexibility and tools to make it a reality with remote work and potentially, part-time work.
* We believe an **inclusive, diverse and barrier-free** work environment makes for empowered and committed employees.
* We recognize the importance of **well-being** and offer programs and benefits to support and sustain the mental and physical health of our employees and their families and also offer a variety of paid family leave programs.
* We are committed to **employee development**, offering tuition reimbursement and a variety of in-house learning and mentorship opportunities.
* We know that **financial security** is important. We offer competitive salaries and incentive programs, RSU’s (job level specific) and an employee share option purchase program.
* We realize **time away** to recharge is important. We offer flexible paid time off!
* Great work deserves **recognition.** We have a robust recognition program, with ongoing and enhanced awards for exemplary performance.

**How You Will Contribute:**


Reporting to the Senior Manager, Optical Engineering**,** as an Optical Systems Engineer, you will be part of the Optical Performance Team and will be involved in the development, modeling, testing, and customer support for current and next generation high speed optical line systems.

* You will collaborate with a multi-functional team of designers to develop MATLAB and/or Python models that simulate propagation physics through optical fibers, waveshapers, amplifiers, multiplexers, etc.
* You will research novel optical fiber and component technologies to develop next generation specifications that drive new hardware and system designs for very high bandwidth optical networks.
* You will apply some of your research to craft, develop, test, maintain, and improve algorithms used to control optical components and/or networks to achieve global performance optimization. Version control systems (like GIT) will be key enablers.
* You will push the boundaries of network automation, speed, and data processing of cutting-edge optical networks using RESTful and other similar application programming interfaces.
* You will develop big data and analytics frameworks to process optical performance metrics from data center interconnect networks to ultra-long haul submarine networks.
* You may review customer-reported issues and partner with design team and subject matter experts from other groups to determine the path forward and/or identify potential improvements.

We are currently looking for a skilled and dedicated Software Performance Engineer to join our team in the Optical Networks organization. As a member of the Photonic Product Assurance Team, your primary responsibility will be to ensure the quality and performance of the software developed for our Reconfigurable Line System (RLS) product.


RLS is a high-capacity networking platform with advanced software capabilities. It features an intelligent control plane for fast service activation and improved availability, ensuring rapid adaptation to problems, outages, and other issues that could impact network performance. The open APIs and micro-services architecture enable seamless integration and customization, enhancing operational efficiency and service velocity. These APIs facilitate seamless integration with existing management and back-office systems, allowing operators to leverage their current infrastructure investments. The openness of the platform also enables collaboration with third-party systems and applications, providing flexibility and choice for network operators.


As a leader within the team, one of your primary responsibilities will be to provide guidance and direction to a team of designers, ensuring they conduct effective performance investigations that align with current priorities. You will play a critical role in ensuring that designers have a thorough understanding of the use cases and performance targets, empowering them to effectively address any performance issues that may arise. Leveraging your deep understanding of customer use cases and requirements, you will play a pivotal role in shaping software design that consistently meets and surpasses high-performance standards.


In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing and optimizing software performance, with a specific focus on critical RLS use cases such as control plane traffic restoration following an outage, declarative config, streaming telemetry, zero-touch provisioning, span calibration, software upgrades and circuit pack restarts. You will collaborate with design teams to ensure efficient feature design, provide documentation and training on performance guidelines and best practices, automate performance analysis, and contribute to improving the software delivery pipeline to proactively detect performance issues before they impact the production environment.

**Responsibilities:**


The successful candidate will join the Photonic Product Assurance Team. Specific responsibilities include:

* Provide technical leadership and guidance to a team of designers, ensuring their effective participation in performance investigations.
* Foster a collaborative and innovative team environment, empowering designers to address performance issues and drive continuous improvements.
* Analyze and optimize the software performance of the RLS product, highlighting areas for improvement and proposing effective solutions.
* Work closely with the design teams to review and consult on feature design, ensuring efficiency and performance are prioritized.
* Develop comprehensive documentation on performance guidelines and best practices.
* Conduct training sessions to educate designers on performance considerations and best practices.
* Automate performance analysis processes to ensure consistent and efficient evaluations.
* Contribute to improving the software delivery pipeline to proactively detect and address performance issues before they impact the production environment.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand performance requirements and develop solutions accordingly.
* Stay updated with the latest software engineering trends, techniques, and technologies.
* Participating in code reviews and providing recommendations for performance improvements.
* Collaborating with customers and stakeholders to understand their performance requirements and address any performance-related concerns.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science/Engineering or a related field. Advanced degree is a plus.
* Proven experience as a Software Engineer, with a focus on performance analysis and optimization.
* Knowledge of performance profiling and optimization techniques for distributed systems.
* Experience with performance testing methodologies and tools, such as load testing and stress testing.
* Familiarity with the RLS product or similar networking devices.
* Proficient in C/C++, Python, or other programming languages.
* Good understanding of Linux operating system and computer architectures.
* Experience with performance analysis tools such as Linux perf, flame graphs, or other.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Ability to work effectively in a team environment.
* Experience in creating technical documentation and conducting training sessions.
* Familiarity with machine learning and data analytics techniques for performance analysis.

The Senior Analyst in IT Applications team will be both, a technical and a functional expert of Return to Repair process. The successful candidate will consult, configure and develop needed functionality within the Baxter Predict (Prophet & Lynx) platform and coordinate with a team of internal and external developers to support the growth and sustainability of Ciena’s Reverse logistics function. The candidate should demonstrate expert capability in building business relationships, gathering and clarifying business requirements, system analysis, translating requirements into low level design documents, system configuration, custom development, and partnering with other team members to carry forward system changes and enhancements through to production.

**Major Responsibilities**

* Sr. Analyst is responsible for high and low-level design, development, testing and implementation for application solution sets within the RMA tools planning platform and processes (Repair planning , Repair Operations , Reverse logistics & case management )
* Sr. Analyst is expected to assist in the design and configuration of Baxter’s Prophet & Lynx platform to meet client needs, including Forward stock location planning, spair parts planning , customizations/enhancements to tool sets, and integration with existing & external systems
* Designs, configures and develops (delivers) application changes and drives integrations, reports, etc.
* Provides technical guidance and business functional consultation to internal and external developers on the overall solution approach, introduce best practices including technical validation of the approach during solution fit-gap analysis.
* Works directly with the business team to identify business needs and requirements, scope work effort, develops and implements solutions, and supports business process changes
* Effectively builds and maintains internal customer and peer relationships to support effective implementations
* Ensures that the new functionalities and implementations, including configuration changes, are setup and migrated to production following established release management processes
* Applies expertise to develop and implement innovative business solutions
* Suggests improvements within internal IT processes (documentation, month/qtr. end support, etc.) and able to implement these suggestions
* Support the implementation and deployment of Repair and planning platform, including user training and change adoption.
 **Required Skills and Experience:**

* 7-10 years of experience as an SME in Return to repair operations with hands on experience of RMA tools
* Experienced in driving at least 2 Baxter implementations end to end
* Experienced in configuration of custom workflows , templates and events
* Proven skill set with Reverse logistics functions.
* Functional and technical experience of these processes: Repair planning , Repair operations & Case management
* Demonstrated competency in SQL query design and performance tuning
* Knowledge of Reverse logistics is a plus
* Integration design and development experience around applications using APIs and Open Interfaces.
* Experience of working on cross-functional multi-discipline (different technologies, platforms) complex and risky projects for a global company with a complex operation
* Able to identify functional/technical issues and takes ownership to close them or seeks escalation.
* Possesses a “track record” of successful completion of assignments with independence and creativity
* Ability to work and drive small to medium size project assignments (technical assessment, lead design sessions, effort estimates, work breakdown structures, Work packages, cutover plans) modules as a contractor, developer or business analyst.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills in English with ability to converse with business users/management and other technical and functional experts. Must be comfortable in managing these conversations using web conferencing tools and collaboration technology in multiple time zones and geographies, as majority of the users and team members will be outside India.
* Must be able to travel internationally to US, Canada and Mexico to participate in meetings, training, conferences, etc.
* Overall 8-10 years of industry work experience including business systems analysis, solution design, and deployment of Repair planning & operation solutions, 5+ years of experience with Baxter Platform is a plus
**Required Education:** Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or IT related fields from a four-year college or university with 5 to eight years related experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience

As Senior Marketing Data Analyst within the Marketing Strategy and Operations organization, you’ll be joining the Data and Technology team whose mission is to govern and leverage data, technology, and analysis to enable marketers to increase awareness, intent, and prioritization of records and accounts.


We are seeking a data-driven individual with a passion for translating marketing data into actionable insights.


This role will serve as the bridge between digital marketing strategy and insight delivery, leveraging analytical prowess to provide context to engagement metrics and offer recommendations to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of our marketing campaigns and digital engagement channels, including paid media, web, email, and social media. The Senior Marketing Data Analyst will ultimately enable our marketing team to make data-based decisions to improve campaign performance and inform future strategic program development. Additionally, this leader will facilitate and enable broader insights-driven decision-making by focusing on instantiating data literacy efforts within the organization.

**Responsibilities will include:**

* Act as the data and measurement subject matter expert (SME) for our Digital Engagement team, helping develop an overall strategy and consistent best-practices for measurement and reporting.
* Collaborate closely with program leaders and channel owners to pinpoint their data requirements, establish agreed-upon datasets and monitoring criteria for key performance indicators (KPIs), and verify accurate tracking configuration for reporting and optimization purposes.
* Develop a deep understanding of the data sources available and how these sources can be related to tell a story.
* Develop a short- and long-term strategy in collaboration with the Director of Data and Technology, with clear milestones documented
* Hands-on development of reporting dashboards and deep dive analysis of our campaign and digital channel data to develop actionable insights for the team.
* Implement a data literacy program for the marketing org, focused on bridging the gap between analytics and the business.
* Experimentation with data science related to digital engagement use cases
* Collaboration with relevant marketing stakeholders on data management, journey mapping, record prioritization, and personalization efforts

**Required Skills**

* Substantial experience identifying and analyzing data and producing reports/presentations to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* A thorough understanding of modern marketing metrics and KPIs, and how they relate to creating and measuring goals and objectives.
* Significant experience with data visualization tools (i.e. Power BI or Google Dashboards) and an understanding of how user experience can influence data literacy
* Solid experience in generating analysis from a variety of digital data sources such as email marketing, social insights and Google Analytics to guide development of campaign strategies.
* Strong analytical and critical thinking skills with a well-informed approach to problem solving and decision-making.
* Must be able to interact and work with cross-functional teams and communicate effectively with Marketing Leadership Team, as well as external service providers, vendors and agencies.
* Familiarity with CRM (Salesforce), Marketing Automation (Marketo), CMS (Squiz Matrix), paid media channels, social media channels and personalization tools
* Strong organizational and project management skills
* A team player with a collaborative approach to problem solving
* Personal commitment to customer service and building relationships

**Required Experience**

* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business or related field
* Minimum 10 years of applicable experience in marketing data analytics and/or data science, data engineering
* Understanding and experience with data integration, semantic models (transformations and calculations), and data unification (relationships)

Ciena’s Navigator Network Control Suite delivers an extensive suite of applications that offer AI-assisted, closed-loop automation to operate and optimize our customers’ multi-layer IP and optical networks.


We are looking for a **UX Designer** with 4+ years of professional experience to join our UX team. Do you have a track record of creating exceptional user experiences that make enterprise users successful? Are you excited to learn about and design for a complex domain? Are you an experienced practitioner of user research techniques and furthermore, are you passionate about using these to ensure you’re on track to drive user-centered experiences? If so, we have a great opportunity for you to develop your career with us!

**How you will contribute:**


In joining our team, you will play a pivotal role in creating powerful, yet easy-to-use enterprise products. You will:

* partner with Product managers, Solution architects, Developers, Subject Matter Experts and System engineers to understand and specify detailed requirements, design end user workflows, and produce detailed UX specifications that will delight users
* leverage your experience with research, analytics, and user validation techniques to help the team gather insights and validate design decisions
* create wireframes, interactive prototypes, and visual designs that effectively communicate your design concepts, based on user research insights
	+ work closely with developers to ensure the feasibility and successful implementation of your designs
	+ Advocate for user-centered design principles and ensure that the user remains at the center of all design decisions
* be comfortable working in a cross-functional team – not everyone will “speak” UX design – you’ll need to be an effective communicator with a variety of stakeholders
* promote UX consistency across different interfaces in our portfolio

**What Does Ciena Expect of You?**

* **Initiative –** You’re a self-starter who works with limited direction and is committed to delivering against aggressive deadlines.
* **Communication expertise** – you possess the ability to influence and tailor your message and ideas to the audience to ensure understanding and agreement, from internal stakeholders to external customers
* The flexibility to **work independently** and as **part of a broader team** – you thrive equally in a multi-disciplinary team environment and when working independently
* **Relationship builder** – with an ability to influence, you’re able to quickly develop trusted connections and get work done across multiple groups and sites
* **Agility** – you are readily able to make key decisions and manage competing and ever-changing priorities
* **A commitment to innovation** – you stay on top of the market and competitive developments and are always keen to formulate new ideas and problem solve

**The Must-Haves:**

* 4+ years professional experience working in the field of User Experience Design
* Degree in Interaction Design, Human-Computer Interaction, or a related field
* Proven experience as a UX Designer, with a strong portfolio showcasing your design process and the impact of your work on customer-facing enterprise products
* Proven track record of using user research, analytics, and user validation techniques to drive design decisions
* A solid grasp of user-centered design, planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability and designing for accessibility
* Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to effectively present and articulate design concepts to stakeholders
* Proven experience in UX design for enterprise applications (e.g. telecom, utilities, manufacturing, or health care)
* Proficiency in design and prototyping tools such as Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma, Axure, or similar
* Experience working in an Agile development environment is a plus
* Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and coding principles is a plus


If you are a talented UX Designer with experience in research, analytics, and user validation techniques, looking for an exciting opportunity to make an impact in the world of enterprise products, working with a talented cross-functional team in a fascinating domain, we would love to hear from you. Apply now!

You will be part of an industry-leading multi-disciplinary organization that develops high-baud rate modems for next-generation optical communication networks. The specific team to which you will report specializes in designing custom high-speed analog and radio-frequency integrated circuits in nano-scale CMOS and advanced BiCMOS technology.


As a senior member of the Analog/RF team, you will design critical high-speed circuits, starting with the primitive transistor level and progressing to major multi-functional blocks. To be eligible for this role, you must have prior experience in all aspects of the analog/RF design flow, including device-level investigations, architectural exploration, large-signal simulation, physical implementation, EM and reliability assessment, comprehensive verification, as well as excellent communication skills. This implies that you have extensive training in analog, RF, and/or high-speed analog mixed-signal design, as well as prior design experience and a proven track record of first-time design success.


In this role:

* You will be responsible for originating new circuit ideas and carrying them through to completion without the need for layout or verification support.
* You will be able to run entire nanoscale CMOS design flows at 10 nm process nodes and below.
* Report progress regularly, succinctly and accurately through participation in regular design review meetings.
* Interact closely and collaboratively with other members of your immediate team and the wider Ciena technical community.

**What Does Ciena Expect of You:**

* Sense of urgency and accountability – what’s important to the customer is important to you; you make getting things done a priority.
* Detail-oriented – you will deliver on objectives through meticulous, thorough, and comprehensive work.
* Problem solver – you possess the ability to analyze and methodically solve complex technical problems using engineering principles and approaches.
* Commitment to learning – you keep abreast of technology developments and are keen to share your knowledge with others.

**The Must Haves:**

* Electrical Engineering or Engineering Physics/Science with electrical sub-option at the MSc/MEng degree level or higher.
* Have at least 5 years post-graduate experience with a demonstrable track record of design success and innovation.
* Proficiency in RF design with CMOS, BiCMOS or III-V technology. Must have specific training in the fundamentals of RFIC/Microwave theory and understand the principles of RF circuit design.
* Deep understand of semiconductor technology, fabrication, non-linear device modeling, physical layout techniques and verification/analysis skills.
* Proficient in the use of computer-aided engineering tools from Cadence, Mentor and Synopsys for analog design (e.g. Virtuoso, Calibre, STAR-RC, MMSIM).
* Experience with ADS, Eldo, HFSS, and/or Microwave Office would also be very useful assets.
* A highly motivated self-starter, able to work both independently and in close coordination with other team members as circumstances dictate.

**Assets:**

+ Excellent oral and written communication skills.
+ Programming skills in Python, Matlab, C++ and Skill.
+ Lab skills and prior experience with VNAs, BERT, SpecA, and HS sampling or real-time scopes.

**How You Will Contribute:**


Reporting to Director, IT Cloud Services, as the Senior Analyst, IT Architecture, you will play the lead role in defining technology solutions to achieve this vision of greater efficiency and better experience. You will focus on people, processes, and technology and how to align them towards a better state.


This role will have expansive scope across the sales and marketing process, as well as touching on adjacent spaces in order management, accounting, and others. Example challenges:

* Determine IT architecture for digital marketing systems to automate delivery of the right marketing asset at the right time to prospective and existing customers.
* Architect data flow to ensure sales teams have a complete 360° view of customer data including services, orders and financials.
* Architect a system to determine sales deal win probability based on data signals
* Use metrics to identify bottlenecks in the sales process and advise on technology powered solutions to improve
* Leverage AI connected to our data to enable sellers to save time and make better decisions
* Partner with business stakeholders and implementation teams to determine the best technology for a customer collaboration portal.

**Your main responsibilities will be:**

* Partner with sales, marketing and IT leaders to gain alignment towards vision and goals
* Partner with sales and marketing individual contributors to understand ground truths
* Understand existing Ciena IT technology landscape and sales / marketing processes
* Propose, develop, and document new processes and system architectures to achieve greater sales and marketing efficiency and happier customers
* Share and sell future state to executives, leaders and individual contributors in various teams
* Partner with delivery teams to ensure execution against the architecture
* Mentor business analysts and help them to grow and learn from them to augment your own capabilities.
* Explore new technologies and capabilities, determine which are applicable (and when) for Ciena
* Collaborate with stakeholders to define requirements, deliverables, and set expectations on tasks.
* Partner with external vendors on solution proposal and development when appropriate
* Document all work and best practices for consumption by implementation teams and analysts
* Advise on build vs buy, custom vs out of the box, Salesforce vs other system for technology solution decisions

**What Does Ciena Expect of You?**

* **Initiative –** you’re a self-starter who works with limited direction and is committed to delivering against aggressive deadlines.

* **Agility** – with an ability to flex between the strategic and tactical, you manage competing and ever-changing priorities and maintain a balanced and methodical approach to problem solving.
* **Communication expertise** – you possess the ability to tailor your message and ideas to the audience to ensure understanding and consensus.
* The flexibility to **work independently** and as **part of a broader team** – you thrive in a team environment, are comfortable working independently, and know how to get things done in a virtual environment.

* **A commitment to innovation** – you keep abreast of competitive developments and are always keen to formulate new ideas and problem solve.

* 10+ years experience in IT or business, with 5+ focused on sales and marketing

As a core member of the High-Speed Photonics Operations group, the Photonics Components Program Manager role is a multi-faceted function encompassing vital internal engagement with R&D and product engineering groups as well as external facing into the Ciena supplier ecosystem. This role is fundamental to the successful evolution from product concept stage to full-fledged mass production phase. Ideal candidate has an innate ability to understand and bridge R&D program requirements into a ‘Production ready’ operations ecosystem while ensuring the entire product lifecycle management is well supported from product concept to sustaining production. Overall responsibilities of the role are divided as follows:

**NPI Program Operations liaison for R&D and Supplier ecosystem partners**

* Work closely with the R&D organization to ensure early and successful engagement with either existing or new suppliers to support Ciena’s plan of record (POR). This includes various responsibilities as outlined below:

**Product definition:**

* Be the ‘one neck to grab’ interface between R&D and new suppliers to enable a new supplier product development program, jointly with R&D. Key activities entail understanding and defining project deliverables and cost, construct of a SOW, ability to negotiate a development agreement and run weekly joint calls to discuss both technical and commercial issues.
* Ensure R&D demands for protos are understood and fulfilled by new or existing suppliers to meet Ciena’s Plan of Record. This requires close supplier collaboration via established working cadences with required parties to ensure all actions relating to early supply and commercial/ technical requirements are understood and dealt with efficiently.
* Ensure suppliers understand product objectives. Drive them to meet requirements for cost, output, capacity, quality, and weekly reporting expectations.
* Suppliers landscape could entail OEM suppliers, foundries, test equipment partners and/or EMS partners.

**Ramp preparation:**

* While ensuring the establishment of a robust supply chain and partner selection, this role also ensures that the operations ‘lens’ is a key factor for all decision criteria. Topics such as cost, BOM churn, product yield, test methods and coverage, factory capacity, supplier qualification, are all critical elements in the program development. Candidate must have a good understanding of operations elements to drive the right internal and external discussions with key stakeholders and partners.
* Define and communicate all elements required for Pilot and ramp; run regular cadence reviews pre pilot to steer the team to attain goals for a successful Pilot run.

* **Steady state production:**
* Facilitate weekly calls with core supplier partners to ensure successful product execution for KPIs such as cost, yields, output, capacity, quality, supply assurance, forecast compliance etc.
* Ensure any yield and quality issues are addressed in a timely manner through the engagement of the Product Engineering team or R&D as appropriate.
* Be able to translate detailed technical problems or opportunities into terms such as cost and schedule impact that are understood by senior management.

**Global Commodity Manager for EMS partners and Tier 1 component vendors**

* Given the direct dependencies of NPI program success with supplier execution, as a key member within the Operations team, managing a portfolio of critical commodities/supplier is expected. Key functions include:
	+ Pricing and contract negotiations where necessary to achieve Ciena total cost of ownership objectives.
	+ For supply assurance and cost competitiveness reasons, work with product engineering group to identify 2nd sourcing opportunities for key components/commodities. Work with EMS partner to establish a phase in timeline for 2nd source introduction.
	+ Understand global spend by supplier and ensure supply chain is well balanced.
	+ Establish operating cadences (weekly, monthly quarterly) as well as KPIs with vendors (component and EMS) to ensure best in class support and performance.
	+ Act as the ‘voice of Ciena’ to communicate performance needs to the supplier. Ensure escalation paths are well established to solve problems quickly.
* Be able to conduct complex RFQs on leading edge technology while being able to clearly communicate requirements, timelines etc. Candidate must have a solid understanding of the competitive landscape in various commodities while ensuring maximum partner engagement (internal and external) to drive a successful RFQ result.
* Ability to analyse and put forth a fact-based recommendation for supplier selection based on cost analysis and other critical variables for new and second sourcing partners evaluations is required.

* Candidate ideally must have 10 years of experience in high tech (telecommunications)
* Electrical Engineering degree + master’s in business administration is preferred.
* Strong collaborative skills are required for this role.
* Effective communication ability on both the technical and commercial fronts are required.
* proficiency in MS office and Power BI

The annual pay range for this position is $86,200 - $137,800 CAD

**What will you do at Ciena?**


At Ciena we are building more adaptive networks in response to the constantly changing world. This is an opportunity to impact the world by developing software and hardware technologies that impact Global Networks, Private and Public Cloud Solutions, 4G/5G communications, and SD-WAN.


Developing great networking technology takes more than desire: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who reach out to the world through their respective talents. At Ciena, we provide multiple avenues for you to make the world a better place. If you’re looking for more than just a job, we invite you to explore the opportunities available and apply today.

**Responsibilities**


We’re looking for a motivated and talented individual interested in progressing their career in advanced Routing and MPLS features, while learning to leverage the disruption taking place with SDN, NFV and virtualized routing systems.

* Develop advanced routing and service features and capabilities in Segment Routing, BGP, OSPF, IS-IS and MPLS in a virtualized routing system
* Author and contribute in software design, development, validation, and documentation to deliver high-quality, functionally excellent products

* Continuous learning and development of skills in system and network virtualization (Containers, SDN, NFV), advanced routing: IS-IS, BGP, OSPF

**General Activities**


You will be part of a talented team with an influential role contributing to advancing next generation IP/MPLS routing capabilities for a virtualized routing system focused on service provider, carrier grade capability, scale and reliability.

**Experience**

* Relevant software development experience including product deliveries of advanced networking software systems
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in computer science or a related discipline. Master’s preferred.
* Product design and delivery experience with Routers and/or MPLS switches designed for Service Provider deployments
* Requires knowledge in IP Routing Protocols (OSPF or ISIS, BGP) and MPLS Protocols (LDP), Multicast is a plus.
* Excellent C/Python programming, as well as troubleshooting skills.
* Exposure or experience with product cycles and deployment requirements for carrier-class products in Service Provider customer environments

WaveLogic Technologies Field Applications Engineer, a direct customer-facing role providing customers with strong technical support in Ciena’s optical module and components business. This role has regular, direct customer exposure & contact to tier-1 optical module providers, and all the major global content providers. Ciena’s WaveLogic Technologies modules and components business is an exciting opportunity to diversify and expand Ciena’s addressable market by making its industry-leading coherent optical module technology and components available to a wider range of industry participants, gaining greater access to new geographies and addressing new market segments.

* Drive regular working-level meetings with customer engineers, capturing new issues or questions, and ensure issue follow-up and resolution.

* Create and drive product demos or evaluation boards at industry trade-show events or customer labs.

* Work closely with Ciena R&D to develop, based on analysis of customer needs, requirements that enhance our modules and components.

* **A sense of urgency** – what’s important to the customer is equally important to you. You make getting things done a priority.

* Hands-on, roll-up-the-sleeves personality. Able and interested in the basics, the high level strategy, and everything in between.
* Action-Oriented. A proactive self-starter with a high degree of confidence and commitment.
* Flexibility. Responsibilities can change from time to time depending on the priority of the team and company.
* Effective team player. Able to collaborate cross-functionally and globally.

**The Must Haves (or really nice to haves):**

* 10+ years experience in optical module development (in any area, such as hardware, software, firmware, DSP, serdes), with direct experience in system integration.
* Strong knowledge of the underlying components used in the design of optical modules (lasers, DSPs, TIAs, optical receivers, etc).
* Experience with high-speed DSP-based electrical serdes architecture, design and/or applications.
* Strong knowledge of link equalization techniques, ie. Tx equalizers, Rx equalizers.
* Strong knowledge of high-speed digital circuits and signal integrity.

* Direct customer-facing experience, with a strong customer-oriented attitude and behavior. Our customers are essential to our business, and deserve to always be treated with respect, professionalism and responsiveness.

The Wavelogic family of products is widely used in Ciena's optical fiber transmission solutions and is one of the main contributors to Ciena's success in the telecommunications industry. To further strengthen our team, we are looking for a hardworking digital verification engineer who will be involved in the verification of these products, working within a team of digital design engineers, verification engineers and architects. Your role as a digital verification engineer will be required to propose and implement innovative verification strategies, in order to thoroughly simulate and validate functional blocks and subsystems for the Wavelogic family of products.

* The digital verification engineer is encouraged to read and understand the architecture and functional requirements specification document(s) and communicate and collaborate with systems engineers and architects.
* You are held responsible for the complete and detailed validation of one or more architectural functional blocks by using an appropriate combination of simulation, formal and coverage methods.
* You are encouraged to build the verification, functional coverage and formal verification test plans.
* You are accountable for the creation of the test bench environment and/or components, agents, scoreboard, and all test scenarios related to your architectural functional block using System Verilog UVM and/or C where applicable.
* You will perform coverage-driven verification, monitor regressions and debug resulting failures with the help of the function's designer.
* Reporting on status updates on a regular basis

**What Does Ciena Expect of You:**

* **Sense of urgency and accountability** – what’s important to the customer is important to you; you make getting things done a priority.
* **Diligence** – you will deliver on objectives through meticulous, thorough, and comprehensive work.
* **Problem solver** – you possess the ability to analyze and methodically solve complex technical problems using engineering principles and approaches.
* **Commitment to learning** – you keep abreast of technology developments and are keen to share your knowledge with others.

**The Must Haves:**

* **BEng/BSc, MEng/MSc or PhD. level degree in Electrical or computer engineering, computer science .**
* **Proficiency above the intermediate level with the use of System Verilog, UVM, SVA, and simulators from major vendors.**
* A highly motivated self-starter, able to work independently, while being a great teammate
* Ability to methodically address sophisticated technical problems.
* Excellent organization, written and oral (English) interpersonal skills.
* Validated ability to resolve appropriate and comprehensive **digital verification and coverage strategies.**

**Assets:**

* Experience with formal verification methods
* Experience with standards and protocols such as **OTN/FlexO/B100G, Ethernet (100GE+)**
* Experience with using **GIT for source code management and revision tracking**
* Experience with using **Jira for schedule planning, assignment tracking and bug reporting**
* Familiarity with programming languages such as Python, Make, bash, object-oriented programming, C, C++, System C

Ciena is seeking a ***Senior Product Engineer*** to work within the New Product Introduction group of the Optical Components R&D organization. Working closely with our Design team and manufacturing partners, who have responsibility for developing and maintaining manufacturing equipment and capability, the Product Engineer shall act as the lead for pulling new products from R&D and work with the various parties to plan and action the transfer to our contract manufacturer (CM) and then maintain them in production.


This position is specifically related to our PON transceiver family of products and requires a significant amount of travel to support Ciena’s products both with the design team in California, at our contract manufacturing partners, and through our supply chain. Specific responsibilities may include, but not limited to,

**Product Engineering**


As a key technical member of the project team, the ***Senior Product Engineer*** will be responsible for capturing and understanding the basic physics and design intent of the product design with a view to both maintaining and improving the product performance over time. In addition, this position will include working with the wider team to influence and ensure the development of a reliable product, transferred successfully to our CM partner and manufactured successfully at or better than cost objectives.


More generally, the role of the ***Senior Product Engineer*** includes,

* Design authority for products in manufacture
* Act as support for failure analysis and develop for local Ciena and CM engineers
* Work with R&D and the Operations team to define production requirements and specifications in terms of process and test
* Manage and track product yield and develop detail product cost reduction plan according to targets, and track performance to plan
* Work with the combined team to develop and deliver efficient test and screening algorithms
* Work with Test Engineering to create and manage automated analysis tools and key performance indicators (KPIs)
* BOM management of the products in mass production
* Responsible for the development of the packaging materials for products and associated recycling programs
* Work with PLM team on product customization
* Technical support to Quality and Sales organizations

**Lifecycle Management**

* Manage the product life cycle from product launch to mass production
* Review design for manufacturability (DFM)
* Review and update PFMEA
* Be responsible for the management and assessment of RMAs

**Cross-functional Communications**

* Interface with remote design teams and Application Engineering teams
* Support contract manufacturers
* Support sales teams and customers

**Production Testing and Planning**

* Define and verify production test requirements (DVT/PVT)
* Drive pilot builds and production forecasts into manufacturing line

**Required Qualifications**


This position requires a candidate with a strong, demonstrated record in the development and manufacture of advanced optoelectronic modules and devices in a Telecom or Datacom environment. This position will involve a higher than average level of travel (estimated at around 20%) to support the products during transfer to the CM and maintain the product in manufacture. Travel will initially be largely within North America but will involve some Asian travel as the product transfers to manufacture.

**Must Haves**

* A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in any of these specializations – Physics / Opto-Electronic / Electrical Engineering / Electronic Engineering.
* **5+ years of product experience in the design, manufacture, or test of optoelectronic products**
* Solid understanding of the **principles and test methods for optical devices such as lasers, modulators, detectors, optical sub-assemblies and transceivers**
* **Specific knowledge of the PON market and PON transceivers** would be a significant advantage
* Understanding of Product Lifecycle Management
* Demonstrated track record of launching complex optoelectronic module products to market

**Assets**

* Problem-solving and the ability to solve technical issues in a high-pressure environment and resolve issues locally and remotely
* Experience working in a global marketplace
* Experience interacting with multi-functional, multi-locational teams
* Good written and oral communication skills
* Strong computer and analytical skills, including database management and data analysis tools
* Knowledge and experience of the production processes related to the manufacture of optoelectronic devices
* Excellent organizational and project management skills

* Le candidat joindra l’équipe des stations de test qui est responsable de développer et de maintenir des stations de test complexes utilisées par les ingénieurs de validation et de fiabilité travaillant sur les composants photoniques à haute vitesse.
* Le spécialiste de stations de test doit également participer au développement d’un pipeline de transfert de données efficace qui est vital à notre environnement en continuel changement. De courts délais entre la prise de mesures et des résultats actionnables permet de rendre nos équipes de design plus performantes.

* Aider à augmenter la vélocité de l’équipe en favorisant la réutilisation des logiciels et du matériel.

* Diplôme en génie (électrique, physique) et une expérience de travail de plus de 10 ans dans un rôle connexe.

* Expérience démontrée dans le déploiement de solutions de test électro-optiques.
* Expérience dans un ou plusieurs des domaines suivants: composants photoniques, design de PCB, automatisation d’appareils de mesure, base de données, analyse de données, programmation embarquée, programmation de PLC.
* La capacité de travailler et de communiquer en français est requise.

Ce rôle exige une compréhension approfondie de la technologie des composants photoniques pour une technologie modem cohérente et l’évolution de la communication optique.

* **Planification stratégique** : Vous élaborerez et mettrez en œuvre des plans stratégiques alignés sur les buts et objectifs commerciaux de Ciena, y compris l’élaboration de feuilles de route pour les composants photoniques et l’identification des composants clés de prochaine génération qui seront développés par l’équipe.
* **Direction d’équipe :** Vous dirigerez une équipe d’ingénieurs, de scientifiques et d’autres professionnels de Québec qui travaillent à la conception, au développement et à la production de composants photoniques haute vitesse. Vos responsabilités comprendront l’embauche, la formation et le mentorat des membres de l’équipe, ainsi que la promotion d’un environnement de travail productif, inclusif et axé sur le client.
* **Gestion opérationnelle :** Vous superviserez les activités quotidiennes du site de Québec, y compris la gestion des ressources, la budgétisation et la planification afin d’assurer l’efficience et l’efficacité.
* **Développement de produits :** En utilisant votre connaissance des plus récentes avancées en photonique et des technologies connexes, vous fournirez une orientation à l’équipe Photoniques, en faisant la promotion du développement, de la conception et de la mise en œuvre de composants photoniques novateurs à grande vitesse, tout en veillant à ce que nos produits répondent aux exigences des clients et soient concurrentiels sur le marché.

Vous superviserez également les processus d’assurance qualité pour vous assurer que nos produits répondent aux normes élevées pour lesquelles Ciena est reconnue.
* **Relations avec les clients internes :** Vous établirez et entretiendrez des relations de confiance avec des clients internes situés dans le monde entier, en comprenant leurs besoins et en vous assurant que les produits répondent à ces besoins. Cela demande une communication et une collaboration régulières avec les clients, ainsi que le traitement des problèmes ou des préoccupations qui surviennent.
* **Partenariat et collaboration :** Vous établirez et maintiendrez des partenariats avec d’autres entreprises, des établissements de recherche et des organismes gouvernementaux pour faire avancer nos objectifs d’affaires et contribuer à l’industrie de la photonique à Québec.
* **Gestion des intervenants :** Vous serez responsable de l’établissement et de l’entretien de relations solides avec les parties prenantes internes du monde entier.

* **Mentalité axée sur leclient d’abord** – ce qui est important pour le client est tout aussi important pour vous. Vous faites de la compréhension de leurs besoins, attentes et circonstances une priorité.

* **Expertise en communication** – vous adaptez votre message et vos idées au public pour assurer la compréhension et l’accord.
* Un **engagement à apprendre** – vous vous tenez au courant des développements du marché, de la concurrence et de la technologie et utilisez cette information à l’avantage de Ciena.

**Exigences :**

* Baccalauréat en ingénierie, en physique ou dans un domaine connexe, associé à une vaste expérience dans l’industrie de la photonique axée sur les composants haute vitesse.
* Capacité démontrée à diriger du personnel et des opérations.
* Compréhension approfondie du marché et des tendances technologiques dans l’industrie de la photonique.

**Atouts**

* Maîtrise ou doctorat

* **Partnership and Collaboration:** You will establish and maintain partnerships with other companies, research institutions, and government agencies to further our business objectives and contribute to the broader photonics industry in Quebec City.

Reporting to the Custom Solutions Delivery senior manager as a Network Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting complex telecommunications network data to support our customers in making informed decisions. You will apply machine learning techniques, data mining, statistical modeling, and create advanced data visualizations. The ideal candidate should possess a solid understanding of Python and popular data science libraries. Experience with graph databases like neo4j and visualization software such as Tableau is highly desirable. * A commitment **to ongoing learning** – you have the ability to rapidly learn new, sophisticated technological concepts and apply that knowledge in your daily activities.

**The Must Haves:**

* Bachelor of Science degree in in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or similar technical field of study or experience in related field in lieu of a degree.
* Proven working experience as a Data Scientist or Data Analyst.
* Strong knowledge of Python and common data science libraries.
* Experience in data visualization and software, particularly Tableau.
* Experience in machine learning.
* Willingness and ability to travel up to 10% of the time.
* Must be ready to work in a very collaborative yet remote environment, with colleagues and customers in different time zones.

**Assets:**

* Knowledge and experience with databases, more specifically graph database (neo4j) is a plus.
* Knowledge of telecommunication networks is a plus.
* Knowledge and experience of internet service provider operation and planning processes is a plus.

* Knowledge and experience with graphical data analytics software (such as Lavastorm, Data360) is a plus.

Sous la responsabilité du directeur principal de Custom Solutions Delivery, en tant qu’analyste de réseau, vous serez chargé(e) d’analyser et d’interpréter des données complexes sur les réseaux de télécommunications afin d’aider nos clients à prendre des décisions éclairées. Vous appliquerez des techniques d’apprentissage automatique, d’exploration de données et de modélisation statistique et vous créerez des visualisations de données avancées. * Expérience en visualisation de données et des logiciels, en particulier Tableau.

* Prêt(e) à travailler dans un environnement très collaboratif, mais à distance, avec des collègues et des clients situés dans des fuseaux horaires différents.

**Atouts**

* La connaissance et l’expérience des bases de données, plus particulièrement les bases de données orientées graphe (neo4j), sont un atout.

* La connaissance et l’expérience des logiciels d’analyse des données de graphes (tels que Lavastorm, Data360) sont un atout**.**

* Understanding of CPU hardware architectures, hardware functional specifications, hardware timing diagrams, device data sheets
* Understanding of real-time operating systems and embedded systems

**Qui est Ciena?**

* Nous sommes très attachés à la **conciliation travail-famille** et nous offrons des conditions propices au télétravail et, éventuellement, au travail à temps partiel grâce à une flexibilité opérationnelle et à des outils appropriés.
* Nous pensons qu’un environnement de travail **inclusif, ouvert à la diversité et sans obstacles** favorise l’autonomie et renforce la motivation des employés.
* Nous sommes conscients de l’importance du **bien-être** et offrons des programmes et des avantages qui permettent d’assurer la santé mentale et physique de nos employés et de leurs familles. Nous offrons également divers programmes de congés familiaux payés.
* Nous entendons favoriser l’**évolution des employés**, grâce au remboursement des frais de scolarité et d’un éventail de formations, ainsi que d’un programme de mentorat, en interne.
* Nous savons à quel point la **sécurité financière** est importante. Nous offrons des salaires concurrentiels et des programmes de motivation du personnel, des régimes d’unités d’actions incessibles (propres à chaque type de poste) et un programme d’option d’achat d’actions pour les employés.
* Il ne fait aucun doute pour nous que chacun a besoin de **temps pour se ressourcer**. Nous offrons ainsi des congés payés illimités!
* À travail remarquable, **récompense** méritée. Nous disposons d’un excellent programme de reconnaissance, offrant des récompenses régulières et de plus importantes récompenses pour les performances exemplaires.

**Description**


Relevant du directeur du groupe de Conception RF et de Validation de Composantes, vous serez un acteur clé de l'équipe de composants photoniques à haute vitesse (HSPC). Travaillant sur des produits complexes, vous serez amené à converger sur des solutions prenant en compte les limitations de fabrication, les propriétés des matériaux ainsi que les principaux critères de performance.


Dans ce rôle, vous devrez interagir étroitement avec les autres membres du groupe HSPC et d'autres groupes R&D internes. Cet environnement à la fine pointe de la technologie et œuvrant à concevoir les produits optiques les plus performants au monde saura vous motiver et vous garder à l’avant plan.


En tant que concepteur, vous serez impliqué dans la réalisation de PCB, substrat et autres solutions d’encapsulation pour composantes optoélectroniques à large bande. Ces solutions seront déployées pour le test et la mise en production de récepteur et transmetteur opto-électronique destinée à nos modems. Vous concevrez des solutions pour diverses plates-formes photoniques telles que silicium, phosphure d’indium et autres technologies prometteuses.  



  

**Rôles et Responsabilités:**


Concevoir et analyser en RF/micro-onde de structures passives sur diverses plateformes telle que PCB, hybride et circuit intégré. Assurer la qualité des mesures hautes-fréquences sous-pointes et connectorisées. Vous appliquerez vos connaissances RF à la conception de composantes opto-électroniques haute-vitesse Concevoir en utilisant des logiciels de simulation de circuits et de simulation électromagnétique par éléments finis Participer et organiser les revues de conception, assurer la documentation et le suivi de projet. Faire la caractérisation RF de composants photoniques novateurs ainsi que développer de nouvelles méthodes de caractérisation Vous serez un participant actif des opérations en laboratoire

job_description:
**Ciena is committed to our people-first philosophy. Our teams enjoy a culture focused on prioritizing a personalized and flexible work environment that empowers an individual’s passions, growth, wellbeing and belonging.
