We are looking for a versatile junior (new graduate) engineer to join our Solutions Engineering & Introduction team within the Product Line Management organization to support Ciena’s Optical Systems portfolio.


As a key technical contributor on this customer-facing, engineering team, you will work directly with Product Development, Product Management, Sales Engineering and Services organizations to ensure the engineering readiness in bringing our innovative optical products and solutions to market.


You will develop, test, document and present a series of technical deliverables that enable the introduction of new product features and solutions in the context of product development cycle and technical customer activities such as demonstrations and trials.


As this role requires you to work extensively in a lab, you must reside in the greater metropolitan area of Montreal, Canada.

**Key responsibilities and accountabilities:**

* Help manage lab assets and upkeep the optical lab systems in pristine condition meeting requirements of team members.
* Define, create, and validate customer-facing deliverables such as customer technical presentations, test plans, release notes, and engineering guides. All deliverables are vital technical documents to facilitate the introduction of Ciena’s Optical Systems portfolio with our customers.
* As a technical prime, deliver customer engagements which include product demonstrations, lab or field trials, deployments, and tests for varying solutions. In the process, capture any product issues and feed them into R&D processes for resolution. Capture any customer requests for incremental enhancements that could potentially be rolled into upcoming releases.
* Support global sales community with pre- and post-sales activities that include customer bids, technical support and consultation, solution evaluation and design, market trials and other engineering Q&A support.
* Assist with complex and/or urgent field issues that have been escalated from the Global Technical Support organization.

**Specific Job Skills:**

* Must be an organized and meticulous team player with excellent English communication skills (verbal and written).
* Exceptional presentation skills for both technical and non-technical audiences.
* An articulate communicator, with excellent writing and social skills and an analytical approach to provide appropriate solutions to whichever tasks are presented.
* Ability to operate in a fast-paced, evolving environment and appropriately prioritize tasks, and keep abreast of the latest technology.
* Capability to work with people in different time zones and cultures.
* Familiarity with telecommunications transport systems. Knowledge of optical transmission and coherent optics are assets.
* Familiarity with instrumentation / lab environments / test methodologies. Lab experience with optical measurements (e.g. OSA) is an asset.
* Experience coding (e.g. Python), WebUI (e.g. JSON), northbound interfaces (e.g. NETCONF) are assets.

**Education:**

* Bachelor’s degree in applied science, Physics, Electrical Engineering, Communications Engineering, or a related discipline

**Location:**

* Must be based in Montreal, Canada because the candidate will be expected to spend a significant amount of time in the lab.
* Ability for travel varying from a few days to a few weeks at a time to other Ciena facilities or Customer.


\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*


Nous cherchons un nouveau gradué en Génie pour se joindre à l’équipe d’Ingénierie & Introduction de Solutions au sein de l’organisation de la gestion de la ligne de produits pour supporter le portfolio de systèmes optiques de Ciena.


Dans ce rôle clé de notre équipe de développement, vous interagirez directement avec les organisations de développement technique, de gestion de produits, d’ingénieurs de vente et de services ainsi que les clients de Ciena, afin d’assurer que nos solutions et produits innovateurs soient prêts à répondre aux besoins du marché.


Vous développerez, testerez, documenterez et présenterez une série de livrables techniques qui permettront l’introduction de nouvelles fonctions et de solutions dans un contexte d’un cycle de développement de produits et d’activités techniques incluant des démonstrations et d’essais devant les clients.


Puisque ce rôle exige de travailler dans un laboratoire, vous devez résider dans la grande région métropolitaine de Montréal, Canada.

**Responsabilités principales:**

* Aider à gérer et maintenir l’équipement de laboratoire des systèmes optiques dans un état impeccable pour rencontrer les demandes des autres membres de l’équipe.
* Définir, créer et valider les livrables pour les clients tels que les présentations techniques, plans de test, notes de version et les guides d’ingénierie. Toutes ces livrables sont vitales à la facilitation de l’introduction du portfolio de systèmes optiques de Ciena auprès de nos clients.
* Livrer et gérer les interactions avec les clients incluant des démonstrations de produits, les essais en laboratoire, le déploiement et la validation de diverses solutions. Durant ce processus, documenter les problèmes avec les produits afin de les relayer aux groupes de recherche et développement dans le but de les résoudre et de documenter les requêtes des clients pour améliorer les versions futures des produits.
* Supporter notre communauté globale dans les activités d’avant et après-vente telles que les offres aux clients, le support et consultation techniques, l’évaluation et la conceptualisation de solutions, les essais de marché et autres questions d’ingénierie.
* Assister à la résolution des problèmes urgents relayés par notre organisation de support technique global.

**Habiletés spécifiques :**

* Vous devez être un coéquipier méticuleux et organisé avec des excellentes aptitudes de communications orales et écrites.
* Habiletés exceptionnelles à présenter à un auditoire technique et non-technique.
* Communicateur articulé avec des habiletés sociales et une approche analytique à fournir des solutions pertinentes aux tâches qui vous seront présentées.
* Habileté à opérer dans un environnement en constante évolution technologique en sachant prioritiser les tâches tout en restant à jour avec les plus récentes technologies.
* Capacité à travailler avec des coéquipiers de diverses culture qui travaillent dans différents fuseaux horaires
* Familiarité avec des systèmes de télécommunications. Des connaissances de transmission optique est un atout.
* Familiarité avec l’instrumentation, les environnements de laboratoires, la méthodologie de tests, et de l’expérience avec les mesures transmission optique (eg. OSA) sont des atouts.
* L’expérience de codage (e.g. Python), WebUI (e.g. JSON), interfaces machines (NETCONF) est un atout.

**Education**


Diplôme de Bachelier en Science Appliquées, Physique, Génie Électrique, Génie des Communications ou discipline connexe.

**Lieu de Travail**

* Situé à Montréal, Canada puisque le candidat devra passer une partie appréciable de son temps dans les laboratoires de Ciena.
* Habileté à voyager pendant une durée pouvant varier de que quelques jours à quelques semaines dans d’autres emplacements de Ciena ou sur les sites des clients.

The Senior Analyst will be responsible for the management, administration, communication, and compliance of Ciena’s Health & Welfare programs in the US and Canada (NA). This position will develop and recommend the NA benefits strategy and plan design changes that are in line with the Total Rewards strategy and corporate objectives. Ensure the Health & Welfare benefit package supports organizational goals, is cost effective, and provides high quality value to the employee population and the organization. Review company benefit programs against current trends, market practices and ensures cost effectiveness.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

* Manage the development, procurement, implementation and management of all aspects of NA’s Health & Welfare benefit programs, including administration, communication, and regulatory compliance
* Serve as team lead for the Americas Region
* Serve as an escalation point between employees and vendors to ensure enrollments, claims and transactions are processed in accordance with plan documents.
* Evaluate and compare existing benefit plans, trends and utilization with those of other employers through use of market surveys, libraries, trade magazines, networks and other sources and summarizes and presents results and recommendations of the same to management team
* Develop and implement COMMs strategy for employees, former employees and dependents to help educate them regarding benefit programs, procedures, changes and government-mandated disclosures
* Act as Project Manager for annual open enrollment and subsequent implementation of any plan or rate changes
* Lead the planning, organization, communication and facilitation of annual Benefit Enrollment Meetings.
* Lead recommendations, development, implementation and on-going administration of NA Wellbeing Strategy, partnering with Global Wellbeing lead to ensure alignment with global strategy.
* Monitor the external environment to identify changes to legislation, demographic, social trends, or competitive practices that affect benefits programs and recommend appropriate action for Ciena to take in response
* Develop and implement automation strategies across function to drive greater efficiencies
* Ensure compliance with all SOX and internal controls; review and revise as needed
* Ensure compliance with all US & Canada state/provincial and federal regulations to include but not limited to ERISA, HCR, COBRA, HIPAA
* Submit government mandated reports monthly, quarterly and annually
* Analyze and report quarterly IBNR and Reserves to Finance and act as a point person with Accounting/Finance Team
* Analyze benefits experience for cost-control and risk-assessment factors
* Prepare NA renewal materials and recommendations for Benefit Committee
* Report Benefits exceptions and appeals to the Benefits Administration Committee and record the outcome
* Evaluate services, coverage and options available through consultants and insurance providers to determine the best and most cost-efficient solution to meet our organization’s needs
* Own Benefits Administration vendor relationship
* Develop and update benefit policies to include but not limited to HIPAA, NA Leaves of Absence and Paid Time Off
* Serve as escalation point for NA Leave Administration
* Own on-line benefit web portal system, enrollment and administration system
* Design and deliver benefit new hire orientation
* Responsible for benefits termination process and maintenance of termination documents
* Review, develop and implement processes and controls to ensure data integrity across Ben Admin, Payroll and Workday

**Education and Experience:**

* Bachelors Degree in Business or Human Resources
* Professional certification a plus (CEBS, CCP, etc.)
* 5-7 years’ experience working with US Health and Welfare Plans
* Strong vendor management experience
* Working knowledge of Canadian Health & Welfare Plans preferred but not required
* Experience automating and improving processes

**Required Skills:**

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Project Management skills
* Ability to perform financial analysis and experience reconciling accounts/statements
* Strong PC skills (excel, access, ORACLE, ADP, Workday or other HRIS systems)
* In-depth knowledge of Health & Welfare benefit plan regulations (ERISA, IRS)
* HRIS or Benefits Administration skills

**Desired Characteristics**
---------------------------

* Ability to work as part of a team or independently
* Initiative
* Ownership of responsibilities
* Ability to interact effectively with all levels of employees and management
* Strong negotiation skills
* Strong organization skills
* Process oriented
* Flexibility and the ability to work in a changing environment
* Team Player

**Ingénieur procédé senior, assemblage Photonique sur Silicium**

**Description de l’emploi**


En tant que membre du groupe Procédés d'assemblage de composants photoniques, le candidat retenu sera responsable du développement, de la configuration et de l'optimisation des procédés et des systèmes d'assemblage industriel depuis la création jusqu'au démarrage et à la certification, en mettant l'accent sur l'automatisation et l'outillage. Ce rôle visera à améliorer la qualité et l'efficacité de la production.

**Rôles et Responsabilités**

* Aider les équipes de conception à développer de nouveaux systèmes d'assemblage pour permettre la fabrication de composants photoniques de nouvelle génération.
* S'approprier les processus et équipements d'assemblage optique pendant tout le cycle de développement du produit.
* Développer et rédiger des spécifications d'équipement, des exigences de performance et des propositions d'intégration de machines et d'équipements.
* Collaborer avec d'autres ingénieurs, fournisseurs et sous-traitants pour intégrer des solutions d'automatisation spécifiques à l'industrie optique.
* Planifier et exécuter des tests expérimentaux en salle blanche pour acquérir une compréhension pratique des processus d'assemblage optique et évaluer l'adéquation/l'amélioration des besoins de l'équipement d'ingénierie.
* Superviser l'installation, les tests d'acceptation sur site (SAT) et le transfert vers le partenaire manufacturier de l'équipement sur le site du fabricant sous contrat.
* Fournir la documentation du processus et les instructions d'utilisation.
* Soutenir et posséder le flux complet du processus d'assemblage du produit :
	+ Processus d'alignements optique actifs
	+ Séquences d'assemblage optique et mécanique passives
		- Placement des pièces, distribution d'adhésif, paramètres de durcissement des adhésifs, métrologie.
* Développer, améliorer et optimiser les processus actuels (travail pratique en laboratoire attendu);
* Participer au processus de sélection, d'acceptation et de mise en service de la future machine de micro-assemblage pour soutenir la montée en puissance du produit.
* Analyser, suivre et fournir des idées d'amélioration sur les assemblages provenant de notre partenaire manufacturier.

**Profil et Qualifications Requises**

* Baccalauréat dans un domaine d'ingénierie pertinent.
* + 5 ans d'expérience dans un domaine connexe.
* Forte capacité pratique de résolution de problèmes et souci du détail.
* Excellente capacité à résoudre des problèmes techniques, scientifiques et expérimentaux.
* Expérience en programmation d'équipement de fabrication.
* Excellentes compétences techniques avec connaissance des logiciels de CAO.
* Excellent travail d'équipe et compétences en communication.
* Expérience dans la gestion de projets avec des délais serrés.
* Vous devez parler couramment l'anglais et le français.
* Vous devez être prêt à voyager occasionnellement à l'étranger.

**Localisation**


Québec, Québec, Canada


Le groupe dans lequel vous travaillerez est localisé dans la ville de Québec.

**Type de Position**


Temps complet/régulier (40hrs/semaine)  

  

**\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\***  

  

**Senior Optical Assembly Process Engineer**


Working in the Photonic Components Assembly Processes group, the successful candidate will be responsible for developing, configuring, and optimizing industrial assembly processes and systems from inception through to start-up and certification, with a focus on automation and tooling. This role will aim to enhance production quality and efficiency.

**Roles and Responsibilities**

* Support design teams to develop novel assembly systems to enable manufacturing of next generation photonics component products.
* Take ownership of the optical assembly processes and equipment during the whole product development cycle.
* Develop and write equipment specifications, performance requirements and proposal for integrating machinery and equipment.
* Collaborate with other engineers, suppliers, and contractors to integrate automation solutions specific to the optical industry.
* Plan and execute experimental tests in clean room to gain hands-on understanding of optical assembly processes and assess adequacy/improvement needs of engineering equipment.
* Oversee installation, site acceptance test (SAT) and transfer to operation of equipment at contract manufacturer site.
* Provide process documentation and operating instructions.
* Support and own the complete assembly process flow of the product:
	+ Active optical alignment processes
	+ Passive optical and mechanical assembly sequences
		- part placement, adhesive dispense, adhesives curing parameters, metrology.
* Develop, improve and optimize current processes (hands-on lab work expected);
* Participate in selection, acceptance, and commissioning process of future micro assembly machine to support product ramp up.


Analyze, track, and provide improvement ideas on assemblies coming from our Contract Manufacturing partner.

**Required Qualifications / Profile**

* Bachelor’s degree in a relevant Engineering field.
* + 5 years of experience in a related field.
* Strong hands-on problem-solving ability and attention to details.
* Excellent ability to solve technical, scientific, and experimental problems.
* Experience programing manufacturing equipment.
* Excellent technical skills with knowledge of CAD software.
* Excellent teamwork, and communication skills.
* Experience managing projects with tight timelines.
* You must be fluent in English and French.
* You must be willing to travel internationally occasionally.

**Location**


Québec, Québec, Canada


The Group you would be part of is located in Québec City.

**Position Type**


Full-time/regular (40hrs/week)

Reporting to Director, Services Project/Program Management, as the Leader, Services Quality, you will be responsible for being the primary point of contact for all field quality issues. You will provide technical expertise and leadership for every aspects of the Field Quality issues. You are required to be the expert in deployment activities to support subordinate engineers, installers, testers and deployment managers with all quality and workmanship issues. Lead the development, tracking and reporting of all quality KPI's. * Directly manage all Ciena Field Quality Engineers and contract auditors globally.
* Set the quality metrics and performance targets for the team in charge
* Ensure the necessary people, processes and controls are in place to assure all field installations are performed in accordance with Ciena and customer standards.

* Computer literate – MS Office / Visio / PowerBI (or similar)
* Strong team player
* Process oriented, keen attention to detail
* Must be able to maintain focus in a fast paced multi-task environment.

Reporting to the Director, Component Distribution, the Distribution Specialist is a key member of the Procurement team ensuring the organization is monitoring the areas most important to the overall Supply Chain organization. In addition, this role will support the management of the Distribution Partners and governance and performance of these partners.


This role represents an excellent career development opportunity for individuals interested in expanding their knowledge of supply chain, interacting across the supply chain, and driving projects related to Ciena’s supply chain business strategy.

* The flexibility to **work independently** with minimal supervision as well as **part of a broader team.**

**The Must Haves:**

* Completed a bachelor or masters degree in electrical/computing engineering, applied mathematics, or engineering physics.
* Thorough knowledge and understanding of modern electronics, electro-magnetic theory, numerical methods, digital signal processing, semiconductor physics, communications theory, and computer programming.
* Previous exposure to computer aided design tools such as ADS, Cadence Virtuoso, and/or HFSS
* Demonstrated proficiency with Python, Matlab, C++ and Cadence Skill.

**Assets:**

* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Confident working in both Windows and Linux environments

* Conducting comprehensive competitive analysis of software automation and network management systems, identifying key market players, their strategies, strengths, weaknesses, and competitive threats.

**Required Skills:**

* Excellent communications skills – written and verbal – to clearly articulate analysis
* Strong investigative skills to track down critical information
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to analyze, translate, and condense large data sets into actionable insights
* Strong technical knowledge in networking technologies
* Solid understanding of network equipment markets and their value chain, including typical network operator requirements
* Excellent project management and organizational skills
* Ability to build strong internal relationships and work collaboratively and effectively with cross-functional teams and internal customers on a global level
* Ability to translate complex technical concepts into concise competitive messaging suitable for execs, marketing programs teams, account managers, and sales engineers

The preference is for this position to be located remotely in North America (USA or Canada), although remote international locations may also be considered.

This is a dual role, with both Project Management and Software Development aspects.


The Project Manager (PM) is an integral part of the project team responsible for driving integrity, quality, and high predictability into the delivery of complex technical projects. The PM will provide a leadership role in the Integrated Project Team (IPT), with responsibility for one or more projects. The PM will facilitate communication between internal groups / functions, and external teams as necessary in support of the project planning and execution. The PM will be required to contribute to process management optimization efforts associated with project management.


Additionally, this specific role involves the ongoing delivery and enhancement of software solutions that bring additional insight into project status, reduce overhead associated with project planning and delivery, and/or facilitate project reporting consistency across Ciena’s product lines.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Lead the operation of the IPT, and successfully manage the project(s) through the Product Life Cycle (PLC) process phases, ensuring the necessary quality records are created and retained, with support from senior PLC colleagues.
* Manage, track and report project status (schedule, content, quality, product cost, and project cost). Proactively manage performance to project contract parameters, escalating to management when parameters are at risk of being exceeded.
* Document and communicate project status, obstacles and resolutions to management. Identify project Out-of-Bounds (OOB) conditions and work with the team to develop a recovery plan for review and approval by management.
* Proactively manage project risk through the development and execution of a risk management plan.
* Ensure adherence to the PLC process across the IPT, and that exceptions are documented and approved.
* Negotiate and obtain timing and deliverable commitments from IPT members; working with them individually as necessary on key project issues.
* Develop and maintain a central repository project site and ensure project status database is kept up to date.
* Manage key pre-GA customer engagements, ensuring deliverables and support are in place and that all customer issues raised are tracked and addressed.
* Ensure approvals are in place for any in-service, pre-GA customer deployments external customer shipments.
* Recommend, participate in, or lead, process improvement initiatives as identified/assigned.
* Enhance existing, and develop new, software applications as required to better track, manage and report project status, with the goal of improving the efficiency of project planning and execution across all Ciena product lines. Specifically:
	+ Work with members of the PLC Project Management and IPT teams to identify and prioritize new application needs and develop requirements.
	+ Recommend suitable technologies, then implement, test, and deliver key applications within a web framework, as appropriate.
	+ Hold frequent demos for users as the implementation is refined and incorporate feedback.
	+ Document applications from both user and developer perspectives and deliver training specific to those communities as required.
	+ Apply your knowledge of modern software development practices throughout the project.

### **SKILLS**

* Strong written and oral communication skills to interface effectively with peers and senior management. Ability to listen, persuade and achieve win-win negotiation results.
* Traditional project management skills, such as project organization and planning, establishing goals and monitoring performance, assessing risks, and anticipating and efficiently resolving problems.
* Team building skills – empower and motivate cross-functional team members, including suppliers, to achieve common goals.
* Leadership skills – display persistence, vision and positive attitude.
* Demonstrated skills in desktop applications such as Excel, Word, PowerPoint, database applications, and Microsoft Project.
* Demonstrated software skills in web frameworks and technologies (Angular, Django, HTML, CSS, Javascript, Typescript, etc.), general scripting (Python, Bash), and familiarity with Linux, Git.
* Experience working with Jira and Confluence APIs highly desired.

**DESIRED CHARACTERISTICS**
---------------------------

* Self-starter with positive attitude.
* Team orientation, organized, and capable of independent work.
* Multitasking: able to manage a small number of projects concurrently, with priorities appropriate to the business.
* Acumen for problem solving. Ability to lead in an environment of change – flexibility, creativity and patience.
* Ability to learn and grasp technical concepts related to products being developed.
* Self-motivated to follow industry trends in Project Management processes and tools, and software development practices.

**EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE**
--------------------------

* Bachelor’s degree in related field from a college or university.
* Practical experience in delivering web applications to an active user community

**What will you do at Ciena as an Analog Design Co-op?**


The Wavelogic family of products are widely used in Ciena's optical fiber transmission solutions and are one of the main contributors to Ciena's success in the telecommunications industry. Successful candidates will be joining a vibrant team with a proven track-record of success over 30-years of evolution and revolution in the advancement of high-speed circuits used in broadband fiber-optic modems. This team pioneered the introduction of the world’s first high-speed DAC and ADC analog macros that ushered in the era of coherent fiber-optic product solutions.


To further strengthen our team, we are looking for a hardworking analog design co-op who will participate in the design of advanced high-speed analog circuits in the latest deep-submicron CMOS and/or BiCMOS technologies. Your role as an analog design co-op will be to deliver advanced high-speed circuits under the oversight of a senior analog designer within a larger team who are responsible for a full mixed signal IP block solution that will be integrated into the Wavelogic family of products.


These analog macros include design and deliver of electrical interface-facing DAC and ADC based SERDES solutions for 112G and 224G, optical-line-facing high-speed DAC and ADC circuits interfacing with optical modulators and detectors, transimpedance amplifiers, modulator driver circuits, and critical precision analog circuits for control and monitoring functions, etc.

**In this role:**

+ You will be responsible for the design and/or verification of various analog blocks assigned to you under the guidance of a senior analog design engineer. You will interact with layout team members who may assist with some aspects of the overall implementation through to full GDSII delivery to Ciena’s integration partner.
+ Reporting on status updates on a regular basis, participation in team meetings and sharing of experience with the rest of the group.
+ Characterization in Ciena’s state-of-the art lab of the analog circuits from test-chips through to full product implementation working with members of our Analog Macro Integration team.

+ Experience leading designs in advanced BiCMOS and/or CMOS technology with a minimum of 2-years industrial experience.
+ A highly motivated self-starter, able to work independently, while being a great teammate

+ Proficiency with use of applicable design tools from Cadence, Mentor and Synopsys for analog design (eg Virtuoso, Calibre, STAR-RC, MMSIM). .

Ce qu’il sera attendu de vous

Ingénieurs support au sein de l'équipe Solution Engineering & Introduction (SE&I) spécialisée dans les systèmes optiques. SE&I est une équipe d'ingénierie orientée client, qui travaille directement avec les organisations de développement de produits, de gestion de produits, d'ingénierie commerciale et de services pour garantir la préparation technique nécessaire à la mise sur le marché de nos solutions de pointe.

En général, l'étudiant devra soutenir l'équipe SE&I Optical Systems pour les activités quotidiennes telles que la préparation et les tests en laboratoire, en plus de mettre en œuvre un environnement de laboratoire pour tester les interfaces nord et/ou les fonctionnalités de sécurité du réseau afin qu'il soit facilement disponible. pour les tests clients.

L'étudiant Devra

* apprendre les concepts des interfaces nord et/ou des fonctionnalités de sécurité réseau.
* concevoir, tester et mettre en œuvre un environnement Linux pour faciliter le test de ces concepts.
* documenter le travail et former l'équipe élargie.

How You Will Contribute

Support engineers in the Solution Engineering & Introduction (SE&I) team specialized in optical systems. SE&I is an engineering, customer-facing team, that works directly with Product Development, Product Management, Sales Engineering and Services organizations to ensure the engineering readiness in bringing our cutting-edge solutions to market.

In general, the student will need to support the SE&I Optical Systems team for day-to-day activities such as lab preparation and testing in addition to implementing a lab environment for testing of north bound interfaces and/or network security features to be readily available for customer testing.

Student Will Need To

* learn the concepts of northbound interfaces and/or network security features.
* design, test and implement a Linux environment to facilitate the testing of these concepts.
* document the work and train extended team.

job_title: Ingénieur Systèmes Sous-Marins (Nouveau Diplômé)/Submarine Systems Engineer - New Grad
job_description:
Ciena is committed to our people-first philosophy. Our teams enjoy a culture focused on prioritizing a personalized and flexible work environment that empowers an individual’s passions, growth, wellbeing and belonging. We’re a technology company that leads with our humanity—driving our business priorities alongside meaningful social, community, and societal impact.

Description du Poste

On est à la recherche d’un ingénieur junior qui réside à Ottawa ou Montréal, Canada pour se joindre à l’équipe SE&I sous-marin. Cette équipe technique, qui interagit directement avec les clients, a comme mission d’évaluer et de démontrer les performances des technologies de Ciena lorsque couplées aux câbles transocéaniques à grande capacité et déployés partout au monde.

En tant qu’ingénieur systèmes sous-marins, le candidat travaillera dans un groupe multidisciplinaire et dynamique qui met sur le marché les produits sous-marins de Ciena. À l’aide d’essais in situ et de démonstrations dans le laboratoire, le candidat aidera à maximiser la capacité / améliorer l’interaction avec les systèmes sous-marins des clients, à résoudre les problèmes inattendus, et à démontrer la fonctionnalité des produits du portfolio sous-marin de Ciena. Ce mandat requiert une interaction soutenue avec les équipes de gestion de la gamme de produits (PLM), recherche et développement (R&D), ventes (SE), et déploiement (Services).

En évoluant dans le rôle, le candidat sera capable à établir des liens de confiance avec des clients multiculturels, en leur démontrant les fonctionnalités des produits sous-marins de Ciena et leur facteurs différenciateurs. Le candidat doit être disponible à voyager aux stations des câbles sous-marins des clients, déployés partout dans le monde. Les déplacements sont d’environ 2 semaines (incluant weekends) et le taux annuel de voyagement est d’environ 15-25%. Les programmes des déplacements changent fréquemment avec peu d’avis préalable.

Responsabilités et Tâches

Aider à gérer le laboratoire sous-marin en le gardant dans un état impeccable.
Définir, créer et valider les documents visant à introduire le portfolio sous-marin aux clients, tels que: présentations des fonctionnalités, plans de test, addendas pour chaque version du produit et guides techniques détaillés.
Voyager aux stations des câbles sous-marins des clients et faire des essais in situ visant à maximiser la capacité / performance. La précision des mesures et leur documentation minutieuse sont indispensables.
Activités en laboratoire visant à démontrer les fonctionnalités des systèmes sous-marins de Ciena, preuves de concepts, vérifications d’applications personnalisées, et investigations des problèmes techniques.
Contribuer à l’évolution des outils d’automatisation pour les essais in situ (Python, WebUI, JavaScript).
Supporter l’équipe SE avec les activités pré- et après-vente qui incluent : des propositions d’offre aux clients, du support technique et des consultations, des évaluations / design d’applications personnalisées, et toutes autres questions techniques.

Compétences

Baccalauréat ou Maîtrise en Génie Électrique, Génie Physique ou domaine équivalent. Des études de 2e ou 3e cycle avec spécialisation optique sont des atouts.
Doit habiter à Montréal ou Ottawa, Canada. Travail dans le laboratoire (50% du temps).
Disponibilité à voyager dans le monde. Les déplacements sont d’environ 2 semaines, incluant week-ends (taux de voyagement annuel 15-25%).
Doit être organisé, méticuleux, apte à collaborer et ayant d’excellentes capacités de communication en anglais (verbales et écrites)
Connaissance des systèmes de transmission en télécommunications. Des connaissances approfondies de la transmission par fibre optique et la technologie optique cohérente sont des atouts.
Connaissance de l’instrumentation / des environnements de laboratoire / des méthodologies de test. De l’expérience avec des mesures optiques (e.g. analyseur de spectre optique, i.e. OSA) sont des atouts.
De l’expérience avec les langages de programmation (e.g. Python), WebUI (e.g. JSON), interfaces ascendantes « northbound » (e.g. NETCONF) sont des atouts

What we’re looking for

We are looking for a junior engineer residing in Ottawa or Montreal, Canada to join our Solution Engineering & Introduction (SE&I) team to specialize in submarine networks. This technical customer-facing team is focused on evaluating and demonstrating the performance of Ciena’s technologies for high-capacity trans-oceanic transmission over new and existing submarine cables worldwide.

As a Submarine Engineer, you will be working in a fast-paced multi-disciplinary group enabling Ciena products and configurations through technology trials/demos on live customer networks and lab environments. This includes leading activities for maximizing capacity, confirming expected performance, interoperating with foreign systems, resolving unanticipated issues and demonstrating Ciena product features. This mandate requires ongoing interaction with Product Line Management, R&D, Sales, and Deployment teams.

As you mature into your role, you are expected to be capable of establishing customer confidence and rapport across cultural lines, articulating product features, and differentiated characteristics. You must be available for worldwide travel to customer cable stations or labs for about 2 weeks per project including weekends (estimated average travel rate of 15-25%). Project schedules are subject to frequent changes with little forenotice.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Help manage lab assets and upkeep the submarine lab systems in pristine condition.
Define, create, and validate customer-facing deliverables such as customer technical presentations, test plans, release notes, and engineering guides. All vital technical documents to facilitate the understanding and introduction of Ciena’s submarine portfolio.
Travel to customer cable landing station to support field trials maximizing the customers’ submarine cables’ capacity/performance. Precise measurement and clear documentation of Ciena performance and issues for feedback into PLM and R&D is paramount.
Lead or support lab activities such as customer demos showcasing submarine systems’ features, proof of concepts, customized application testing and resolving technical issues.
Contribute to the evolution of software tools automating field trial measurements (Python, Web UI, JavaScript)
Support global sales community with pre- and post-sales activities that include customer bids, technical support and consultation, solution evaluation and design, market trials and other engineering Q&A support.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s or master’s degree in electrical engineering or equivalent field of discipline. Graduate degree in Optical Engineering an asset.
Must be based in Montreal or Ottawa, Canada. The candidate will be expected to spend a significant amount of time in the lab or office.
As required, must be available for worldwide travel. Typically, 2 weeks per project including weekends (estimated average travel rate of 15-25%).
Must be an organized and meticulous team player with excellent English communication skills (verbal and written).
Familiarity with telecommunications transport systems. Knowledge of optical transmission and coherent optics are assets.
Familiarity with instrumentation / lab environments / test methodologies. Lab experience with optical measurements (e.g. OSA) is an asset.Experience coding (e.g. Python), WebUI (e.g. JSON), northbound interfaces (e.g. NETCONF) are assets.

Accelerate your career path by gaining hands-on experience and exposure to the latest technology. You will be working with, and learning from, industry recognized experts. Our interns and graduates work on real projects in real time in world class labs. Be a part of tomorrow’s future – today.
We’re a company rooted in people—seeking to create a vibrant and inclusive environment, where everyone feels they can belong.
We are big proponents of life-work integration. Our people make a big difference at Ciena, but we want to shine light on their differences outside of working hours too. CienaCares supports non-profit causes important to employees by matching employee financial contributions and dedicating time for volunteering.
Great work deserves recognition. We have a robust recognition program, with ongoing and enhanced awards for exemplary performance.

How You Will Contribute:

The Ciena’s Wavelogic family of products are widely used in optical fiber transmission solutions and are one of the main contributors to Ciena's success in the telecommunications industry. Reporting to ASIC Senior Manager, as a Digital Verification Engineer, in conjunction with a team of Digital Design Engineers, Verification Engineers and Architects, you’ll play a key role in implementing innovative verification strategies, in order to thoroughly simulate and validate functional blocks and subsystems for the Wavelogic family of products.

You will read and understand the architecture and functional requirements specification document(s) and communicate and collaborate with systems engineers and architects.
You will be responsible for the completion and thorough validation of one or more functional blocks by using an appropriate combination of simulation, formal and coverage methods.
You will create the verification, functional coverage and formal verification test plans.
You will be accountable for the creation of testbench environment and/or components, agents, scoreboard, and all test scenarios related to your architectural functional block using System Verilog UVM and/or C, where applicable.
You will perform coverage driven verification, monitor regressions and debug resulting failures with the help of the function's designer and provide status updates on a regular basis.

What Does Ciena Expect of You?

A sense of urgency and accountability – what’s important to the customer is equally important to you. You make getting things done a priority.
Integrity – you hold yourself to the highest level of personal and professional standards of conduct.
A commitment to innovation – you continually seek to learn, understand new technologies and methods, and endeavour to apply that knowledge to Ciena’s advantage.
You embrace change – thriving in a diverse environment of ever-changing priorities and sometimes stressful situations.
Problem solver – you possess the ability to analyze and methodically solve complex technical problems using engineering principles and approaches.
The flexibility to work independently as well as part of a broader team.

The Must Haves:

Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering, Computer Science or other applicable scientific degree.
Demonstrated proficiency with System Verilog, UVM, SVA, and simulators from major vendors.
Proven ability in determining appropriate and comprehensive digital verification and coverage strategies.

Assets:

Experience or strong fundamental knowledge in
Formal verification methods
DSP and/or Forward Error Correction
Mixed-Signal
Using Jira for bug tracking and GIT for source code management and revision tracking
Familiarity with programming languages such as: Python, Make, bash, object-oriented programming, C, C++.

job_title: RLS Test Automation Software Technician - New Grad
job_description:
Ciena is committed to our people-first philosophy. Our teams enjoy a culture focused on prioritizing a personalized and flexible work environment that empowers an individual’s passions, growth, wellbeing and belonging. We’re a technology company that leads with our humanity—driving our business priorities alongside meaningful social, community, and societal impact.

How you will contribute:

As a global provider of intelligent network and service solutions, Ciena helps some of the world’s largest networks produce more – more data services for emerging market opportunities and more efficiency through network convergence and automation. Our team is looking for an energetic software engineering technician that is eager to participate in the design and development of software test automation and tools.

The successful candidate will work within the Agile and Programmable Optical Transport (APOT) organization as a member of the Photonic Product Assurance Team. This team is responsible for ensuring the quality and performance of the software and hardware being developed as it is integrated into a product solution in preparation for handoff to our Product Verification team as well as developing tools to automate various test suites. The focus of this position will be to assist in software instrumentation and to develop automation tools to capture various performance metrics from the product, perform off-box analysis and feed results to performance dashboards for visualization.

Responsibilities:

The successful candidate will join the Photonic Product Assurance Team to instrument the software to help gather better performance metrics and develop test automation to capture and analyze these metrics while the system is under test. Specific responsibilities may include:

Add instrumentation to the existing software.
Develop and maintain scripts to automate performance metric captures from a network while it’s under test.
Create and maintain performance dashboards to present performance data and test results.
Execute automated test scripts, interpret, and report results.
Assist in resolving problems reported by automation tools and contribute to improved product quality in functionality, performance, robustness, and hardening areas.
Work closely with test engineers, software designers and systems architects to understand the product capabilities and expected behaviour.
Support the product integration test team and the performance system design team on tools development.

The must haves:

Technology diploma in Software Engineering or equivalent.
Knowledge in scripting or other programming languages like Python, JavaScript, Shell script, HTML, C/C++, etc.
Software development and test process, including documentation and revision control systems like Git.
Experience working in a Linux environment.
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to troubleshoot software defects.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills to present ideas and coordinate troubleshooting.
Ability to work well within a team environment while still taking accountability and working independently as needed.
Excellent organization skills to manage time, resources, and priorities.
Enthusiastic and fast-learner, self-motivated, strong communicator, team player, problem solver, and ability to multi-task.

Skills which are an asset:

Experience in real-time embedded systems
Familiar with test automation tools and environments
Proven debugging skills
Familiar with test and network equipment command line languages such as vendor specific APIs, CLI, YANG, and OpenConfig
Familiar with protocols including REST, gRPC, and Netconf.
Familiar with the YANG modeling language and toolchains.
Familiar with data formats such as JSON.
Familiar with database management languages such as SQL.
Familiar with monitoring and visualization platforms such as Grafana.

Qui est Ciena?

Nous sommes une entreprise ancrée dans l’esprit des gens—cherchant à créer un environnement dynamique et inclusif, où tout le monde peut avoir un sentiment d’appartenance.
Accélérez votre parcours professionnel en acquérant une expérience pratique et en étant exposé à la technologie la plus récente. Nos stagiaires et diplômés travaillent sur de vrais projets en temps réel dans des laboratoires de classe mondiale. Faites partie de l’avenir de demain – aujourd’hui.
Mentorat. Réseautage. Possibilités de leadership. Nous reconnaissons que l’apprentissage se poursuit même après avoir terminé l’école – nous soutenons un environnement d’équipe pour le développement et fournissons les outils pour réussir.
Nous promouvons grandement la conciliation travail et vie personnelle. Nos employés font une grosse différence au sein de Ciena, mais nous voulons également mettre au jour leurs différences en dehors des heures de travail. CienaCares appuie des causes sans but lucratif qui importent aux employés en donnant l’équivalent des contributions financières des employés et en consacrant du temps au bénévolat.

La possibilité :

Summer 2024 Temps complet/régulier (40hrs/semaine)

Québec, Québec, Canada

Ce qu’il sera attendu de vous

Ciena est un leaders mondial dans le domaine des télécommunications par fibre optique à haut débit. Nous comptons plus de 7500 employés répartis dans 28 pays, dont une centaine dans nos installations de Québec. Les produits que nous développons sont destinés à être installés sur les cartes modem vendues aux plus grandes compagnies de transfert de données dans le monde.

Le bureau de Québec est en charge de la R&D, du prototypage ainsi que l’encapsulation des futures générations de composants d’optique intégrés. Par la suite nous participons au transfert en production à grande échelle en Asie.

Nos laboratoires, d’une superficie de 715 m2, sont à la fine pointe de la technologie. Ils sont constitués de salles blanches de classe ISO 7, d’un secteur dédié aux tests et mesures et à la fiabilité, ainsi qu’un atelier mécanique.

Les tâches et activités prises en charge par notre équipe multidisciplinaire d’ingénieurs et de technologues en génie physique sont très variées et axées sur le développement de procédé entourant la micro-encapsulation d’éléments électro-optiques. Ces tâches comportent des procédés d’alignement actif de microcomposants optiques, de caractérisation électro-optique de diverses pièces, d’installation automatisée de pièces discrètes (die bonding), de microcâblage par fil d’or (wire bonding), d’inspection automatisé, etc.

Un stage chez nous pourrait déboucher vers une carrière passionnante à la fin de tes études!

Supporter certains éléments du procédé d’assemblages.
Développer les séquences d’assemblages des composants passifs
Positionnement des pièces, dispense des adhésifs et métrologie
Établir les procédés d’alignement actifs.
Positionnement, routine d’alignement et collage des fibres
Développer, améliorer et optimiser les procédés actuels (du travail de laboratoire sera requis)
Analyser, suivre et proposer des idées d’amélioration surs assemblages à l’interne.

Ce que Ciena attend de vous

Un sentiment d’urgence – ce qui est important pour le client est tout aussi important pour vous. Vous faites de la réalisation de choses concrètes une priorité.
Intégrité – vous devez vous soumettre au niveau le plus élevé en matière de normes de conduite personnelle et professionnelle.
Un engagement envers l’innovation – vous cherchez continuellement à apprendre, à comprendre les nouvelles technologies et les conditions du marché en constante évolution, et vous vous efforcez de mettre en application ces connaissances à l’avantage de Ciena.
Vous adoptez le changement – vous épanouissant dans un environnement diversifié rempli de priorités en constante évolution et parfois de situations stressantes.
La souplesse de travailler de façon autonome avec une supervision minimale ainsi que de faire partie d’une équipe élargie.

Exigences :

Vous étudiez dans l’un des domaines suivants: Métallurgie, Électronique, optique, physique ou mécanique.
Excellente habileté à résoudre des problèmes techniques, scientifiques et expérimentaux;
Excellente aptitude au travail d’équipe et à la communication;

Maitrise des langues française et anglaise à l’écrit et à l’oral

R&D Silicon Photonics assembly Co-op

Summer 2024 (full time - 40h/week)

Québec, Québec, Canada

How You Will Contribute:

Ciena is a telecommunication world leader for high-speed optical fiber data transmission. Our organization count more than 7,500 employees located in 28 countries, including 100+ in our Quebec City site. The products we develop are intended to be installed on the modem card and our clients are biggest data transfer provider in the world.

The Quebec City office oversees the researched and development, prototyping and encapsulation of integrated optical components. Afterwards, we participate in the production transfer to high volume manufacturer in Asia.

Our laboratories, with an area of 715 m2, are the cutting edge of technology. They include a class ISO 7 clean room, a test & measurements, a reliability laboratory and a mechanical workshop.

The tasks and activities supported by our multidisciplinary team of engineers and physical engineering technologists are diverse and focused on the development of processes surrounding the micro-encapsulation of electro-optical elements. These tasks include processes for active alignment of optical micro-components, electro-optical characterization of various parts, automated installation of discrete parts (die bonding), wire bonding, automated inspection and more.

An internship with us could lead to an exciting career at the end of your studies!

Support elements of the assembly process flow of the product:
Passive optical and mechanical assembly sequences
Part placement, adhesive dispense, metrology, automatic visual inspection
Active optical alignment processes
Alignment routine, optical fiber bonding and lenses attach
Develop, improve and optimize current processes (Clean room work required);
Analyze, track and provide improvement ideas on prototype assemblies coming from our Contract Manufacturing partner and our internal assembly line.

A commitment to innovation – you continually seek to learn, understand new technologies and ever-changing market conditions, and endeavour to apply that knowledge to Ciena’s advantage.
You embrace change – thriving in a diverse environment of ever-changing priorities and sometimes stressful situations.
The flexibility to work independently with minimal supervision as well as part of a broader team.

You are studying in one of the relevant fields: Metallurgy, Electronics, Optics, Physics, Mechanics.
Excellent ability to solve technical, scientific and experimental problems;
Excellent team work and communication skills;
You must be fluent in English and French;

Great work deserves recognition. We have a robust recognition program, with ongoing and enhanced awards for exemplary performance.

How You Will Contribute:

Reporting to Senior Manager, Hardware Engineering as a Senior Power Hardware Engineer, you will be part of an experienced engineering team that develops product-level power systems, subcomponent power designs, and circuit pack power designs for Ciena’s leading Packet Optical Transport, Data Center Interconnect and Switching products.

You will be mentored by senior power specialists and work closely with system architects, electrical circuit pack, and mechanical design teams to develop designs from concept and introduction to manufacturing. This includes design, documentation, component and system testing, collaborating with software teams for performance issues, and to manufacturing teams for hardware build issues.

You will design high performance circuit pack level power solutions (schematics and layouts), and work with hardware design primes to implement on their circuit packs.

You will be responsible for designing DC power interface modules and cooling systems for platforms.

You will partner with hardware and mechanical design, as well as external supply partners to realize power hardware designs and with suppliers, corporate and manufacturing procurement organizations to deliver products and sub-systems into production.

Customer First Mentality – what’s important to the customer is also important to you.

A commitment to learning – you keep abreast of market, competitor and technology developments and use that information to Ciena’s advantage.

Bachelor of Engineering degree coupled with extensive experience in system power and grounding design, power component circuit pack design, and product development cycle experience.

Good communication, interpersonal, and teamwork skills across multiple disciplines in Hardware development, manufacturing, test engineering, and with external suppliers.

As a Systems Engineer focused on coherent pluggable transponders and components you will support the tail-end of a development cycle readying solutions across optical transport, routing & switching and cloud domains. You will help customers adopt these technologies into a variety of hosts (native and 3rd party) via technical consultancy, proof-of-concept (PoC) demos, and competitive demos and field trials demonstrating features and performance. You will also work with Ciena Product Line Management (PLM), R&D, Sales, and Services for evolving solutions and capturing customer feedback.

The Role Comprises

* Integration work for adopting Ciena transmitter technology into native and 3rd party platforms

* Software automation for lab/field work (Python, JavaScript)
* Lab/field activities maximizing capacity/performance, interoperating with foreign systems, resolving issues and demonstrating features

Education

* Bachelor of Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent “in progress”

Software Skills (primary)

* Python, JavaScript (Angular.js, Ember.js), C/C++, MATLAB
* Web UI (HTML5, CSS, YANG, XML, JSON) and/or northbound interfaces (REST API, NETCONF, gRPC)

Hardware Skills (secondary)

* Lab experience with optical technology. Familiarity with optical transmission, lab environments, instrumentation (e.g., OSA), coherent modems (e.g., BPSK, DPSK)
* Experience with either: optical networks, IP routing, hardware integration or software development
* Experience with routing/switching equipment (e.g., Ciena, Cisco, Juniper, Nokia, Arista, Huawei)

Soft Skills

* Ability to investigate, troubleshoot, determine root causes across teams
* Ability of establishing confidence/rapport across cultural lines

Our teams enjoy a culture focused on prioritizing a personalized and flexible work environment that empowers an individual’s passions, growth, wellbeing and belonging. We’re a technology company that leads with our humanity—driving our business priorities alongside meaningful social, community, and societal impact.

Ciena may well be the most important technology company you’ve never heard of. The innovations that wow us (driverless cars), and those we now take for granted (the ability to mobile-stream your favorite show) are the products of ingenuity from some brilliant and forward-thinking companies. But those companies rely on Ciena, another vanguard of innovation, to create and advance the underlying networks that bring their breakthroughs to our doorsteps. VR, AI, IOT, 5G … literally none of it would be possible without the mind-boggling technology that makes the internet itself work. For more than 25 years, Ciena has been the global leader in networking strategy, and our technology has been part of the critical infrastructure running within the most advanced companies in the world.

What we’re looking for:

An optical transceiver engineer with knowledge of the functionality and testing methods of optical transceivers. The successful candidate will join our Optical Transceiver team and be responsible for development activities related to Ciena’s Packet Optical Platforms pluggable optics portfolio. Responsibilities of the position include investigation of emerging pluggable optics solutions, leading the introduction of new pluggable modules, and managing the life cycle of these products.

What will you do at Ciena?

A key part of the role is to efficiently manage interactions with pluggable optic suppliers, test and qualify new modules added to the portfolio. Coordinate plug introduction activities and provide technical support required within Ciena’s cross functional teams throughout the life of the product. This role provides a candidate an opportunity to work with leading edge transceiver technology on Ciena’s world leading optical platforms.

Responsibilities

Creating and maintaining specifications in response to requirements from several different product platforms.
Understanding and aligning market place standards with product requirements.
Working with Ciena’s supply chain organization to select suitable pluggable optic suppliers.
Lab evaluation of pluggable optics modules, including optical and electrical interface performance, verifying compliance with specifications, driving resolution of issues.
Participation in early Ciena product design, helping architects understand pluggable optics and emerging capabilities
Support the broader Ciena team (HW, SW, FPGA, Product Verification, Project Managers) as modules are tested with circuit pack HW and SW.
Interact with Ciena design teams and suppliers to resolve any issues.
Provide design support over the lifecycle of the module for product changes (PCNs) issued by suppliers, field failure investigations, and sales support.
Interact with various teams outside design in Ciena (supply chain, customer reliability, component engineering, product line management)

Collaboration with stakeholders

Efficiently manage interactions with pluggable optic suppliers
Creating and maintaining specifications in response to requirements from several different Ciena product platforms.
Working with Ciena’s supply chain organization to select suitable pluggable optic suppliers
Providing technical expertise to Ciena support teams throughout the life of the product.

Areas of impact

Ensuring optical modules from suppliers meet general market and Ciena specific specifications.
Ensuring optical module performance on all supported Ciena platforms.
Providing technical support to leading edge optical solutions.
Assisting in Ciena financial success by implementing numerous cost reduction opportunities.

Experience

Bachelor’s degree in engineering
Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills
Experience with optical transceiver hardware, test measurements and lab skills

Strong Assets:

Experience with optical and electrical test methods and equipment
Knowledge of fibre optic communications
Experience with software lab tools (e.g. MATLAB) for the purposes of simulation and test automation

Rewarding experience. Meaningful outcomes.

Making a difference in people's lives through design and implementation of leading network technologies. That's what motivates us.

A distinct way to work

Free thinking, free discussion, and collaboration are the norm. Expect more satisfying outcomes - both personal and professional.

Ciena values the diversity of our workforce and respects its employees as individuals, regardless of race, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender or age.

Ciena is also committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. If contacted in relation to a job opportunity, you should advise Ciena in a timely fashion of the specific needs / accommodation measures which must be taken to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. Information received relating to any specific needs / accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.

What you can expect from us

You will receive notification of your successful application
Successful applicants will be contacted by Talent Acquisition for an initial discussion
If suitable you will be considered for the short list and our formal interview process

Ciena is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and protected veteran status.

This role is ideally based in Ottawa.

Why Ciena?

* We are a company rooted in people—seeking to create a vibrant and inclusive environment, where everyone feels they can belong.
* Accelerate your career path by gaining hands-on experience and exposure to the latest technology. Our interns and graduates work on real projects in real time in world class labs. Be a part of tomorrow’s future – today.
* Mentoring. Networking. Leadership Opportunities. We recognize that the learning doesn’t stop when you leave school - we champion a team environment for development and provide the tools to achieve success.
* We recognize the importance of well-being and offer programs and benefits to support and sustain the mental & physical health, and financial security, of our employees and their families.
* We are big proponents of life-work integration. Our people make a big difference at Ciena, but we want to shine light on their differences outside of working hours too. Ciena Cares supports non-profit causes important to employees by matching employee financial contributions and dedicating time for volunteering.

What will you do at Ciena as a Software Engineer?

Within Ciena’s Converged Packet Optical family of products, we are looking for newly graduated candidates who will be enthusiast to work on a highly dynamic environment on Ciena’s Agile and Next Generation Programmable Optical Platform.

The Responsibilities

* Develop embedded software on a next generation optical network platform.
* Participating in all stages of software development - requirements analysis, design and prototyping, implementation, testing, and eventually maintenance support.
* Troubleshoot hardware and software, as well as performance issues. Work with hardware, software, verification and system engineering teams to identify root causes for issues;
* Help to investigate and collect information to resolve process, design and field issues found on current or previous designs;
* Identifying software performance improvements through test driven development, automated unit testing, and comprehensive integration testing;
* Engage with Product Owners and System Architects to evolve software applications adopting new features and technologies without compromising performance
* Influence the software architecture, in order to improve resiliency, debuggability and maintainability. 

What technical experience and/or professional and personal skills are required for this role?

* A minimum of Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science / Engineering or equivalent degree
* Software development expertise, particularly large-scale embedded software development in C/C++ and Object-oriented design.
* Capable on delivering on multiple parallel priorities.
* Must be fast learner with excellent debugging skills.
* Excellent verbal and written communications skills.
* Familiarity with Linux development environment
* Familiarity with developing software on multi-processor, highly concurrent systems (good knowledge of mutual exclusion, synchronization, interrupt handling, inter-process communication, etc.)
* Knowledge of control theory, signal processing or optical networking will be a bonus
* Ideal candidate will have hands-on experience and be familiar with the following software / tools:
* Expertise in C++ & Python programming language
* Experience with building APIs and services using REST, SOAP, etc.
* Experience with automated test frameworks such as Jenkins
* Experience with Scrum/Agile development methodologies.
* Experience with design and development tools such as Git, Eclipse, JIRA, GDB, Yocto, etc.
* Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to troubleshoot and perform fault isolation and usage of source code debug tools.
* Excellent written and verbal communications skills to present ideas and coordinate troubleshooting.
* Excellent organization skills to manage time, resources, and priorities.
* Independent self-starter and committed to delivering on aggressive deadlines.
* Comfortable in a team environment while still taking accountability and working independently as needed. 

How do you get your chance to join?

Please submit your resume though the application process.

Job Summary

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Physics/Optical Engineering Co-Op to join the WaveLogic Science advanced testbed team. The successful candidate will be involved in experimental and theoretical work in the laboratory. Work will focus on assisting with development of DSP algorithms used in coherent optical transmission. Work will be performed under the guidance of experienced engineers and will have the opportunity to gain experience in the field of optical systems engineering.

The Opportunity

4 or 8 month Co-op term

4 month term: May - August 2024

8 month term: May - December 2024

Responsibilities

* Conduct laboratory experiments involving optical fiber propagation and characterization of electro-optic components.
* Development/refactoring/documentation of algorithms for the analysis of coherent optical transmission signals.
* Document and maintain code using Git version control system.
* Collaborate with other engineers and scientists to solve technical problems.

Requirements

* Currently pursuing an Engineering degree in Physics, Electrical, Systems or a related field. Strong candidates from science backgrounds will be considered on a case-by-case basis.
* Strong programming skills in MATLAB (optional: GNU Octave). Work must be readable, extensible, maintainable, documented, etc.
* Understanding of wave theory, FIR filters, Discrete-time Fourier Transforms (DTFT), linear algebra, and cost function-based optimization.
* Experience with basic electronic lab equipment: electrical/optical spectrum analyzers, oscilloscopes, power supplies, amplifiers, etc.
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Ability to work and learn independently.

Recommended Skills

* Theoretical knowledge of fiberoptic transmission and coherent optical communication.
* Familiarity with version control software (ie. Git).

This is a paid Co-Op position with a duration of 4 to 8 months. The position is based in our optical systems engineering laboratory in Ottawa. The Optical Systems Engineering Co-Op will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects and gain valuable experience in the field of optical systems engineering.

You will be a member of a successful team working on the forefront of technological innovation focused on leading edge technologies, flows and products. You will be working with, and learning from, industry recognized experts.

Our team supports an inclusive, diverse and barrier-free work environment making for empowered and committed employees.

We recognize the importance of well-being and offer programs and benefits to support and sustain the mental and physical health of our employees and their families.

Great work deserves recognition. We have a robust recognition program, with ongoing and enhanced awards for exemplary performance.

How You Will Contribute:

The Wavelogic family of products are widely used in Ciena's optical fiber transmission solutions, and are one of the main contributors to Ciena's success in the telecommunications industry. Reporting to Senior Manager, as a Senior Digital Verification Engineer, in conjunction with a team of Digital Design Engineers, Verification Engineers and Architects, you’ll play a key role in implementing innovative verification strategies, in order to thoroughly simulate and validate functional blocks and subsystems for the Wavelogic family of products.

You will read and understand the architecture and functional requirements specification document(s) and communicate and collaborate with systems engineers and architects.

You will be responsible for completing and thorough validation of one or more architectural functional blocks by using an appropriate combination of simulation, formal and coverage methods.

You will create the verification, functional coverage and formal verification test plans

You will be accountable for the creation of testbench environment and/or components, agents, scoreboard, and all test scenarios related to your architectural functional block using System Verilog UVM and/or C, where applicable.

You will perform coverage driven verification, monitor regressions and debug resulting failures with the help of the function's designer and provide status updates on a regular basis.

What Does Ciena Expect of You:

Sense of urgency and accountability – what’s important to the customer is important to you; you make getting things done a priority.

Detail-oriented – you will deliver on objectives through meticulous, thorough, and comprehensive work.

Problem solver – you possess the ability to analyze and methodically solve complex technical problems using engineering principles and approaches.

Commitment to learning – you keep abreast of technology developments and are keen to share your knowledge with others.

The Must Haves:

Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering, Computer Science or other applicable scientific degree coupled with significant experience in the use of System Verilog, UVM, SVA, and simulators from major vendors.

Proven ability in determining appropriate and comprehensive digital verification and coverage strategies

Assets:

Experience with

formal verification methods

DSP and/or Forward Error Correction

Using Jira for bug tracking and GIT for source code management and revision tracking

Familiarity with programming languages such as: Python, Make, bash, object-oriented programming, C, C++.

 Reporting to the Senior Director, Analog Engineering, you will play a key role as you will be responsible for the architecture, design and verification of high-speed serial interfaces for both electrical and optical links as part of a high-speed analog design team. Ciena is recognized as a leading supplier of state-of-the-art fiber optic transmission technology, and a key aspect of this development is assuring system performance at the optical layer. Support other Ciena teams using our performance models to solve custom design requests.

How You Will Contribute:

Ciena is the global market leader in optical networks. Our photonic systems are designed to deliver high capacity, flexibility, and value across a variety of network applications:

Key features of Ciena's photonic systems include:

1. Can scale to meet the needs of networks of all sizes, from metro to long-haul distances.

2. Flexible and programmable, allowing network operators to adapt to changing network conditions and demands. This includes the ability to tune and adjust capacity, reach, and spectral efficiency in real time.

3. Designed for simplicity, with intuitive management and control interfaces that simplify network operations. This includes features such as real-time network health indicators and proactive network management tools.

4. Open and interoperable, allowing network operators to integrate them with existing network infrastructure and management systems.

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Photonics Hardware Manager to join our team. This role will involve overseeing the design, development, and implementation of photonics hardware systems, including optical amplifiers, wavelength selective switching modules and other high-performance optical modules. The successful candidate will have a strong background in photonics or optical engineering and will be responsible for leading a team of engineers in the development of cutting-edge photonics technology.

Responsibilities:

Manage the design, development, and implementation of photonics hardware systems.

Lead a team of engineers, providing guidance and support as needed.

Collaborate with systems, software and optical performance teams to ensure the integration of photonics hardware with other system components.

Oversee the testing and analysis of photonics hardware and modules to ensure optimal performance.

Influence and drive advancements in the field of photonics across our suppliers and industry to ensure Ciena maintains a competitive edge.

Develop and manage project schedules, budgets, personnel and lab resources.

Ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.

Troubleshoot and resolve photonic hardware issues on time.

Prepare and present technical reports to management, PLM and other teams in Ciena.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Photonics, Optical Engineering, or a related field. A Master’s degree or Ph.D. is preferred.

Proven experience in managing photonics or optical hardware projects.

Strong understanding of photonics principles and technologies. Working knowledge of hardware and software design.

Excellent leadership and team management skills.

Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills.

Ability to communicate complex technical concepts effectively.

Familiarity with industry standards and regulations.

Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.

The role is based in Ottawa (preferably) working in conjunction with the photonics systems and card software product development teams as well as other teams within the broader Optical Networks product delivery team.
