Our team supports an inclusive, diverse and barrier-free work environment making for empowered and committed employees.

We recognize the importance of well-being and offer programs and benefits to support and sustain the mental and physical health of our employees and their families.

Great work deserves recognition. We have a robust recognition program, with ongoing and enhanced awards for exemplary performance.

How You Will Contribute:

The Wavelogic family of products is widely used in Ciena's optical fiber transmission solutions and is one of the main contributors to Ciena's success in the telecommunications industry. Successful candidates will be joining a vibrant team with a proven track-record of success over 30-years of evolution and revolution in the advancement of high-speed circuits used in broadband fiber-optic modems. This team pioneered the introduction of the world’s first high-speed DAC and ADC analog macros that ushered in the era of coherent fiber-optic product solutions.

To further strengthen our team, we are looking for a hardworking senior analog design engineer who will be involved in leading design of advanced high-speed analog circuits in the latest deep-submicron CMOS and/or BiCMOS technologies. Your role as a senior analog designer will be to architect and deliver advanced high-speed circuits within a larger team who are responsible for a full mixed signal IP block solution that will be integrated into the Wavelogic family of products. These analog macros include design and delivery of electrical interface-facing DAC and ADC based SERDES solutions for 112G and 224G, optical-line-facing high-speed DAC and ADC circuits interfacing with optical modulators and detectors, transimpedance amplifiers, modulator driver circuits, and critical precision analog circuits for control and monitoring functions, etc..

In this role:

You will be responsible to perform feasibility work with various circuit topologies to recommend the best solution to carry through implementation by weighing tradeoffs and discussing these with other members of the team including system groups to guide formation of a circuit requirement specification.

You will be responsible for the complete and detailed design of the analog blocks assigned to you including close collaboration with analog layout team members and more junior members of the design team as applicable who may assist with some aspects of the overall implementation through to full GDSII delivery to Ciena’s integration partner.

Reporting on status updates on a regular basis, participation in team meetings and sharing of experience with the rest of the group.

Characterization in Ciena’s state-of-the art lab of the analog circuits from test-chips through to full product implementation working with members of our Analog Macro Integration team.

The Must Haves

Electrical or computer engineering, computer science or other applicable scientific degrees at the BEng/BSc, MEng/MSc, or Ph.D level.

Experience leading designs in advanced BiCMOS and/or CMOS technology with a minimum of 7-years industrial experience.

A highly motivated self-starter, able to work independently, while being a great teammate

Ability to methodically address sophisticated technical problems

Excellent organization, written and oral (English) interpersonal skills

Proficiency above the intermediate level with use of applicable design tools from Cadence, Mentor and Synopsys for analog design (eg Virtuoso, Calibre, STAR-RC, MMSIM).

A history of successful analog circuit product deliveries.

Assets :

Experience with 2.5D or 3D E-M tools such as HFSS or EMX

Experience with team-leadership within an analog macro design group

Architect or System Design experience for complex analog macro IP solutions using tools such as MatLab and/or C++

Experience with mixed-signal design validation using state-of the art probing and test equipment

To further strengthen our team, we are looking for a hardworking analog layout engineer who will be working on advanced high-speed analog design circuits in the latest deep-submicron CMOS and/or BiCMOS technologies. Your role as an analog layout engineer will be to drive and implement best-in-class high-speed analog layouts that extract the highest performance from the world’s most advanced CMOS and BiCMOS technologies. These analog macros include electrical interface-facing DAC and ADC based SERDES solutions for 112G and 224G, optical-line-facing high-speed DAC and ADC circuits interfacing with optical modulators and detectors, transimpedance amplifiers, modulator driver circuits, and critical precision analog circuits for control and monitoring functions, etc.

Create layouts of assigned analog blocks by adhering to the steps of floor planning, placement and routing.
Conduct thorough verification checks such as DRC, LVS, EM, IR to ensure the final layout possesses the highest level of quality.
 Investigate new features within the layout tools and processes used for creating layouts with the aim of enhancing productivity.
Provide regular status updates, participate in team meetings and share experiences with the rest of the group.

The Must Haves:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering or related field.
Experience in custom analog and mixed signal layout design with a strong knowledge of deep sub-micron CMOS devices.
Highly motivated with strong team player skills, exhibits a positive can-do attitude and ability to seamlessly integrate into an existing team culture.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams.
Experience in custom layout design of Analog/Mixed Signal designs (e.g. Opamp, Current Mirror …)
Proficiency in using industry-standard layout tools (e.g., Cadence Virtuoso, Siemens Calibre).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and address layout-related issues efficiently.
Knowing layout techniques for Floor Planning, device matching, minimizing parasitics, RF shielding, EM, IR drop, ESD and high-frequency routing.
Meticulous attention to details, ensuring the highest level of accuracy and quality in all layout designs.
Familiarity with semiconductor manufacturing processes and foundry technologies.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment and adapt quickly to changing project requirements.
Solid understanding of RC delay, electromigration, and coupling effects.

Scripting skills in PERL or SKILL are a plus, but not required.

What will you do at Ciena as an Analog Design Co-op?

The Wavelogic family of products are widely used in Ciena's optical fiber transmission solutions and are one of the main contributors to Ciena's success in the telecommunications industry. Successful candidates will be joining a vibrant team with a proven track-record of success over 30-years of evolution and revolution in the advancement of high-speed circuits used in broadband fiber-optic modems. This team pioneered the introduction of the world’s first high-speed DAC and ADC analog macros that ushered in the era of coherent fiber-optic product solutions.

To further strengthen our team, we are looking for a hardworking analog design co-op who will participate in the design of advanced high-speed analog circuits in the latest deep-submicron CMOS and/or BiCMOS technologies. Your role as an analog design co-op will be to deliver advanced high-speed circuits under the oversight of a senior analog designer within a larger team who are responsible for a full mixed signal IP block solution that will be integrated into the Wavelogic family of products.

These analog macros include design and deliver of electrical interface-facing DAC and ADC based SERDES solutions for 112G and 224G, optical-line-facing high-speed DAC and ADC circuits interfacing with optical modulators and detectors, transimpedance amplifiers, modulator driver circuits, and critical precision analog circuits for control and monitoring functions, etc.

In this role:

You will be responsible for the design and/or verification of various analog blocks assigned to you under the guidance of a senior analog design engineer. You will interact with layout team members who may assist with some aspects of the overall implementation through to full GDSII delivery to Ciena’s integration partner.
Reporting on status updates on a regular basis, participation in team meetings and sharing of experience with the rest of the group.
Characterization in Ciena’s state-of-the art lab of the analog circuits from test-chips through to full product implementation working with members of our Analog Macro Integration team.

What technical experience and personal skills are required for this role?

Electrical or computer engineering, computer science or other applicable scientific degree at the BEng/BSc, MEng/MSc, or Ph.D level.
Experience leading designs in advanced BiCMOS and/or CMOS technology with a minimum of 2-years industrial experience.
A highly motivated self-starter, able to work independently, while being a great teammate

We are seeking a talented and experienced Agile Product Manager with a strong background in supply chain management to lead the development of cutting-edge solutions that optimize our supply chain operations. As an Agile Product Manager in the supply chain domain, you will play a pivotal role in defining, prioritizing, and delivering products that enhance our efficiency, visibility, and overall performance in the supply chain ecosystem

The Senior Lead, Product Manager is responsible for product discovery, vision, strategy, and roadmap development and delivery. They collaborate with stakeholders to develop business cases, identify potential solutions, prioritize features, and lead planning and life cycle management efforts. Additionally, they work with change management leads to create change enablement strategies and plans.

The Lead, Product Manager will report to the Senior Director, Digital Transformation.

Key Areas of Responsibility

Product Vision and Strategy: Develop and articulate a clear product vision and strategy for supply chain solutions, aligning them with the company's broader goals. Understand market dynamics, customer needs, and industry trends.

Product Discovery: Build business cases and ROI calculations. Identifying potential solutions through validation, learning, interviewing, and prototyping. Perform gap analyses through interviews and focus groups to determine areas that need to be addressed based on current versus future state.

Product Roadmap: Create and maintain a well-defined product roadmap that outlines key features, enhancements, and milestones. Continuously refine, prioritize, and adjust the roadmap based on market feedback and evolving business priorities.

Product Backlog: Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, to groom and prioritize the product backlog. Define user stories, acceptance criteria, and detailed specifications.

Agile Development: Implement Agile methodologies such as Scrum to guide the development process. Ensure efficient sprint planning, backlog refinement, and retrospectives to optimize team productivity.

Stakeholder Engagement: Engage with key stakeholders across the organization, including supply chain leaders, logistics teams, and technology partners. Gather input, provide updates, and manage expectations effectively.

Data-Driven Decision-Making: Leverage data and analytics to make informed decisions. Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success and impact of supply chain products.

Risk Management: Identify potential risks and challenges associated with supply chain product development and proactively work to mitigate them. Maintain a keen focus on project risk assessment and mitigation strategies.

Regulatory Compliance: Stay informed about relevant regulations and compliance requirements within the supply chain domain. Ensure that products adhere to all necessary industry standards and regulations.

Continuous Improvement: Encourage a culture of continuous improvement within the team. Facilitate retrospectives and feedback sessions to drive process enhancements and product innovation.

Change Management: In partnership with change management, create and implement change enablement strategies and plans, and conduct effective change impact and readiness assessments.

Education and Experience Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in a related field
Equivalent combination of education and experience
Proven experience as a Product Manager in supply chain management.
Strong understanding of Agile methodologies and principles.
Demonstrated understanding of the techniques and methods of modern product discovery and product delivery.

The Analog ASIC Integration Team has the mandate to develop algorithms and test methodologies to optimize the performance of high-speed circuitry at the front-end of Ciena’s Wavelogic ASIC’s.

State-of-the-art high-speed circuits for optical communications used in Ciena Wavelogic ASIC’s require complex algorithms and testing schemes in order to be provisioned for peak performance. These circuits have become ‘analog processors’ containing a great degree of tunability and digital assist functions.

Reporting to the , as an Analog Engineer, you will assist in the design and specification of high-performance fixturing, establish appropriate provisioning, control and screening algorithms, and measure performance using state-of-the art lab equipment and on-board ASIC test instruments. Post-processing of results using signal processing techniques will be required to determine circuit characteristics and performance as well as establishing root cause of impairments.

You will be a member of a team that works closely with high-speed circuit design, e/o, PCB, firmware, system and manufacturing teams to find solutions to achieve the best optical line performance for Ciena’s end customers. The optimal provisioning and control solutions are transferred as methodologies for ASIC and system level test and to the firmware that controls the system in the field.

Initiative – you’re a self-starter who works with limited direction and is committed to delivering against deadlines.

Degree in Electrical Engineering

Do you really enjoy paid time off?
Find out about our FLEX PTO and company shutdowns so you can rejuvenate and reenergize.

Bring your friends with you on this new career opportunity and get rewarded for referring great talent! The openings are limitless and YOU earn cash for every eligible referral we hire.

What will you do at Ciena as a Datapath - Software Engineer?

Optical networks continue to enthusiastically move towards Layer 0/1/2/3 converged infrastructures. Ciena’s Packet Optical Transport Switching (POTS) portfolio of Layer 2, Layer 3, and MPLS Packet networking products provide carrier grade packet networking services and aggregation tiers of the network.

The POTS Datapath software group is seeking multiple embedded software engineers with experience in designing and developing embedded carrier-grade software on custom hardware platforms. As a member of a larger team, the successful candidate will participate in all states of the software development process, including:

Craft and develop software written in C for Layer 2, 3 Datapath applications and the hardware abstraction layer. This includes improvements of existing software as well as development of new packet networking features.

Write software which runs on an embedded Linux/VxWorks platform.

Participate in backlog defect reduction.

Solve issues and work with hardware, software and system engineers to identify the root cause.

Help investigate and collect information to resolve process or design issues found in the codebase.

Identify software performance improvements through test driven development, automated unit testing, and comprehensive integration testing.

What technical experience and/or professional and personal skills are required for this role?

Bachelor’s degree in Electrical/Computer Engineering or Computer Science.

5 - 10+ years’ work experience (Dependent on level) and passionate about embedded software development.

Extensive C programming language experience.

Experience with real-time, embedded software development for some or all of the following data plane technologies:

End-to-end slow path forwarding with packet injection, extraction, data-plane packet exception handling,

Fastpath hardware (ASICs, NPUs, FPGAs, TCAMs) Layer 2, Layer 3 forwarding engines

MPLS, BGP and Segment Routing centric solutions

IPv4, IPv6 with embedded hierarchical fast protection mechanisms such as BFD, BGP-PIC and FRR

Data-plane services including traffic management, metering, ACLs.

Experience with Broadcom DNX/XGS packet processing chipsets is a strong asset;

Good knowledge of mutual exclusion, synchronization, interrupt handling, inter-process communication, etc.

Ability to seek out answers and work independently.

Positive work demeanour, highly motivated and an ability to seek out answers with a willingness to learn and work independently

Strong verbal and technical writing skills.

Ability to collaborate well in a team environment.

Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or Engineering Physics
Demonstrated hands-on hardware lab skills.
Experience with programming in a language such as Matlab or Python for the purposes of simulation, test automation, and data analysis.

Advanced degree (MSc or PhD) in the field of Electrical Engineering or Engineering Physics with exposure to electro-optics or optical communications.
Exposure to high-speed electro-optic hardware in a lab environment.
Experience with electro-optics/RF test methods and equipment.
Knowledge of fiber optic communications and/or DSP theory.
Experience with statistical analysis of large datasets.
Project management and/or technical leadership experience.

Key DSP technology to enable state-of-the-art coherent optical modem and DWDM systems.

Create innovative solutions for experimental issues.
Automate, analyze, and visualize experimental data in MATLAB.
Create and perform simulations of experiments then validate predictions via measurement.

Advanced technology demonstrations for customers.

Interface and collaborate on technical designs with DSP, hardware, firmware, electro-optic, and systems teams.

Key DSP technology to enable state-of-the-art coherent optical modem and DWDM systems.

Expand and improve knowledgebase (KCS).
Mentor, train and advance newly hired Technical Support Engineers.

Proficient with various types of test equipment for optical and protocol testing.
System level trouble shooting on fiber optic telecommunications transport and switching equipment.
Extensive Knowledge of OTN, SONET/SDH/DWDM, Carrier Ethernet with niche knowledge in some products and application of the technology.

Great teammate that is ready to assist in, or lead, troubleshooting.

Excellent Customer service skills and the ability to work with customers on both technical and management levels.

Excellent oral and written communication skills.

Experience with OTN technology and its application to Ciena equipment.

Experience as a technical lead on specific projects or issues
Problem solving experience.
Fundamental understanding of Telecommunications industry
Clear understanding of Technical Support industry and the application within Ciena.
CE-P (Carrier Ethernet-Professional) certification.

How You Will Contribute:

You will be part of a team of hardware designers working on the design, implementation, and validation of complex printed circuit boards for next generation networking and optical platforms.

Under the mentorship of a senior engineer, you will be accountable for co-developing the hardware design of circuit packs.
You will analyze and select design alternatives based on cost, power, space, and functional requirements.

You will ensure thorough validation of designs and interfaces against component and commercial requirements and participate in process change and improvement forums.

A sense of urgency – what’s important to the customer is equally important to you. You make getting things done and exceeding customer expectations a priority.
The flexibility to work independently and as part of a broader team where decision-making and evaluation of design options is concerned.
You embrace change – thriving in a diverse environment of ever-changing priorities and sometimes stressful situations.
Curiosity to understand new technologies, analyze, troubleshoot, and solve complex problems.
You are self-motivated – always seeking out and methodically tackling sophisticated technical issues.
The ability to effectively communicate – tailoring your message to the audience and presenting information in such a way that it is easily understood.
A dedication to ongoing learning – allowing you to acquire information and develop new skills to solve complex problems.

The Must Haves:

Bachelor’s degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering
Experience in hardware design implementing circuits involving microprocessors, ASIC’s, FPGA, memories and/or pluggable optics.
Knowledge of high-speed design and transmission line theory.
Demonstrated use of schematic capture and layout tools such as Cadence Concept and Allegro.
Experience with lab measurement techniques and test equipment.

Assets:

Telecommunications experience.
Familiarity with Ethernet and OTN technologies
Expertise in board level simulation and circuit simulation methodology.

Reporting to Senior Manager, Embedded Software Engineering as an Embedded Software Developer on the WaveLogic Software team, you’ll play a key role in the software development lifecycle, building platforms that support convergence of the WaveLogic Photonics, OTN and Ethernet packet layers of the global network.

You will work with a broader team of engineers, architects and other professional and technical personnel to create an evaluation software development kit that will enable customers to develop their products using Ciena components. You will be accountable for defining platform requirements, developing HAL layer drivers in an embedded environment, supporting API development and testing and crafting end user documentation.

You will support the implementation of cross-platform software and services, spanning multi-core embedded CPUs, SOCs, 10/100/1000BT Ethernet PHYs, FPGAs, and optics.

You will use your expertise in Bare Metal development, Linux Kernel, the TCP/IP stack, Forwarding Tables, IP Filters, VLANs, and memory management to develop software APIs and tools to enable a positive user experience.

You will design, code and support drivers, diagnostics and/or applications written in C/C++, Bash and Python and debug system defects, throughput and performance.

You will develop common operating system elements from and to other product families within Ciena and support other designers to troubleshoot hardware, software and system defects and performance issues.

You will create documentation and production of the artifacts of the software development process, participate in defect resolution and backlog defect reduction and develop scripts, test utilities, and other development aids to improve designer efficiency.

What Does Ciena Expect of You?

Initiative – you’re a self-starter who works with limited direction and is committed to delivering against aggressive deadlines.

Agility – you are readily able to make key decisions and manage competing and ever-changing account priorities and largely driven by the software development lifecycle.

Communication expertise – you have the ability to influence and tailor your message and ideas to the audience to ensure understanding and consensus.

The flexibility to work independently and as part of a broader team – you thrive in a multi-disciplinary team environment, but are comfortable working independently as required.

Relationship builder – with a proven ability to influence, you’re able to get work done with and through others.

A commitment to learning – you keep abreast of the market and competitive developments and are always keen to formulate new ideas and problem solve.

The Must Haves:

Minimum Bachelor’s Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent.

Embedded C, C++ programming language.

Hands on experience with Board support Package (BSP) development, Linux kernel drivers and user space drivers.

Experience with SPI and I2C driver development and testing, security and board bring-up.

Knowledge of the fundamentals of structured programming and design concepts.

Demonstrated experience with the Atlassian tool suite (Jira, Confluence).

Assets:

Real time operating systems concept knowledge.

Understanding of Common Management Interface Specification (CMIS).

Ability to understand CPU Hardware architectures, Hardware Functional Specifications and Hardware Timing Diagrams.

Exposure to software development tools such as Agile or Waterfall.

Familiarity with optical such as 100G/400G Ethernet interfaces, Coherent optical interfaces, DWDM, OTN, Ethernet, OSI Model, TCP/IP, MPLS

We are seeking a highly motivated and knowledgeable optical communications systems engineer to join the Solutions Engineering & Introduction team, passionate about Ciena’s Converged Packet Optical portfolio. As this role has a high level of lab work, you must be in Ottawa, Ontario, to have access to the state-of-the-art labs.

In this technical customer-facing role, you will be responsible for customer lab and field trials, solution integration and certification testing, and product interoperability scenarios. You will also act as an optical communications domain specialist for our customers!

You will partner closely with Product Engineering, Product Management, Sales Engineering and Customer Account teams to bring our Converged Packet Optical solutions to the global market, specifically focusing on the Global Cloud Networking segment. Occasional travel to customer sites is a requirement!

Responsibilities and Activities:

Support the Global Cloud Networking (GCN) account and sales engineering teams with pre and post-sales engineering activities such as responding to technical questions, leading customer trials, providing technical presentations, or sharing knowledge via training delivery.
Close engagement with GCN customers (Amazon, Facebook, Google, Microsoft etc.) and act as the technical prime for product and technical consultation, solution and application evaluation, feature improvements and other pre-sales engineering activities.
Drive customer engagement, including product demonstrations, lab and field trials, product certification and solution integration of Ciena products.
Develop and execute test plans or methods of procedure in Ciena labs, customer labs or field locations, with detailed documentation of results.
Lead troubleshooting and resolution by working with the Product Engineering team in addressing product issues during customer trials or certification.
Gather customer requests for incremental capabilities to be rolled into upcoming product releases. Bring observations and requirements to the Product Engineering team for product improvement.
Support developing and delivering customer technical presentations, acceptance test plans and engineering guidelines. Develop other vital technical documents to facilitate understanding and introducing new technology, product, or solution into customer networks.
Support deployment and post-sales support teams as the need arises.
Be passionate about learning and embracing new technologies and ideas that improve the team's day-to-day work and customer experience.

What technical experience and personal skills are required for this role?

Technical skills:

Knowledge of optical fiber communications systems, optical network engineering concepts and technologies (high-capacity coherent modems, fixed and flexible grid optical networks, layer 0 control plane), instrumentation and test methodologies in the context of the data center, cloud networking, service provider and enterprise networks is essential.
Hands-on experience in engineering, testing, or deploying networks on DWDM, Packet Optical and OTN platforms with Ciena solutions is vital.
Experience with API (REST, NETCONF, gRPC), streaming telemetry, and YANG data models (Ciena, OpenConfig) is an asset.
Proven debugging and troubleshooting skills in optical fiber communications systems.
Bachelor or Master of Engineering or equivalent degree with 5-7 years of experience in the telecommunication industry, emphasizing optical fiber communications systems.

Interpersonal skills:

Standout colleague with the ability to collaborate and be compatible with cross-functional organizations within Ciena, our customers and our partners in the face of significant challenges or ambiguity.
Ability to work as an individual contributor and supply as part of a team.
Work proactively with customers and account teams to understand requirements, priorities and execute on the project plan.
Gain the trust of the customer and account team as the subject matter expert on Ciena products.
Ability to multitask and adapt to changing projects, priorities, and business drivers.
Work calmly and efficiently in high-pressure situations during lab activities, technical issue resolution, and under tight schedules.
Availability for occasional domestic and international travel to customer sites or other Ciena locations. Travel varies from a few days to 1-2 weeks.

Communications skills:

Strong written and interpersonal communication, documentation, and presentation skills.
Experience in the development and presentation of informative materials.
Meticulous execution of test plans or method of procedure while thoroughly documenting results in a comprehensive matter.

Ciena is committed to our people-first philosophy. Ciena Corporation, the network specialist, offers leading network infrastructure solutions, intelligent software and a comprehensive services practice. Our portfolio of software-centric optical and Ethernet platforms combines network element programmability, operating system commonality and management unification, and Carrier Ethernet-based transformation to enable our customers to change the way they compete. Our solutions form the foundation of many of the largest, most reliable and sophisticated service provider, enterprise, government, and research and education networks across the globe.

Ciena currently has an exciting co-op/internship (4-8months) Hardware Design opportunity available.

Complex designs pushing all the boundaries. Great people. Diverse teams with which to interact. Tremendous growth and learning opportunities. This position could really catapult your career. Are you looking for a challenging co-op or internship that will stand out? Read on…

We are looking for an enthusiastic and innovative designer to join the hardware development team working on Ciena’s Switching products. The position will be tailored to the successful applicant and will involve working with senior designers to implement and validate leading edge circuit packs of a multi-terabyte switch.

Specific responsibilities include:

Assist in the detailed design and schematic capture of high speed digital and analog circuits
Work in the hardware lab with test equipment to support and assist in board bring-up, test and debug of new and existing circuit boards. Duties may include programming of boards, maintaining inventory of functioning prototype hardware and updating loads during the integration phase.
Assist in performing thorough verification of designs to validate functionality, performance, operating margins and robustness. Tests include DVT (Design Verification Testing), signal integrity measurements, thermal stress, and qualification of components.
Contribute to documentation such as Design Specification and Test Plans / Reports.
The candidate will get exposure to working in Cadence CAD tools (Concept/Allegro) or equivalent, Agile manufacturing database and learn how fiber optic transport equipment and associated test equipment function.

Required Skills:

Good communication, interpersonal, and teamwork skills are essential
The candidate must have initiative, enthusiasm and a desire to learn
Familiarity with lab test equipment (oscilloscopes, logic analyzers and test sets) and measurement techniques would be beneficial
Understanding of high speed signaling, transmission lines, digital and analog design
Experience designing and debugging hardware is an asset
Experience with PCB schematic capture and layout tools is an asset

To put it simply, we’re a technology company driven by our humanity.

How You Will Contribute:

The Wavelogic family of products is widely used in Ciena's optical fiber transmission solutions, and is one of the main contributors to Ciena's success in the telecommunications industry. To further strengthen our team, we are looking for a hardworking digital verification engineer who will be involved in the verification of these products, working within a team of digital design engineers, verification engineers and architects. Your role as a senior digital verification engineer will be to propose and implement innovative verification strategies, in order to thoroughly simulate and validate functional blocks and subsystems for the Wavelogic family of products.

The senior team member is encouraged to read and understand the architecture and functional requirements specification document(s) and communicate and collaborate with systems engineers and architects.

You are held responsible for the complete and detailed validation of one or more architectural functional blocks by using an appropriate combination of simulation, formal and coverage methods.

You are encouraged to build the verification, functional coverage and formal verification test plans.

You are accountable for the creation of the test bench environment and/or components, agents, scoreboard, and all test scenarios related to your architectural functional block using System Verilog UVM and/or C where applicable.

You will perform coverage-driven verification, monitor regressions and debug resulting failures with the help of the function's designer.

Reporting on status updates on a regular basis

What Does Ciena Expect of You:

Sense of urgency and accountability – what’s important to the customer is important to you; you make getting things done a priority.

Detail-oriented – you will deliver on objectives through meticulous, thorough, and comprehensive work.

Problem solver – you possess the ability to analyze and methodically solve complex technical problems using engineering principles and approaches.

Commitment to learning – you keep abreast of technology developments and are keen to share your knowledge with others.

The Must Haves:

Electrical or computer engineering, computer science or other applicable scientific degree at the BEng/BSc or MEng/MSc level

A highly motivated self-starter, able to work independently, while being a great teammate

Ability to methodically address sophisticated technical problems.

Excellent organization, written and oral (English) interpersonal skills.

Proficiency above the intermediate level with the use of System Verilog, UVM, SVA, and simulators from major vendors.

Validated ability in resolving appropriate and comprehensive digital verification and coverage strategies.

Assets:

Experience with formal verification methods

Experience with standards and protocols such as OTN/FlexO/B100G, Ethernet (100GE+)

Experience with using GIT for source code management and revision tracking

Experience with using Jira for schedule planning, assignment tracking and bug reporting

Familiarity with programming languages such as Python, Make, bash, object-oriented programming, C, C++, System C

We are looking for a senior assets management prime with a strong customer service and performance-oriented attitude. A successful candidate will be responsible for managing test equipment inventory within the Supply Chain(SC) Test Engineering and Manufacturing Operations at Ciena, Contract Manufactures and Repair Sites.

The role of the Assets Management prime is to plan, execute and manage the SC test engineering equipment inventory through its lifecycle in line with the procurement and operational processes, including financial policies. This role requires to closely work with the NPI Test Engineering teams and other supply chain functions to drive appropriate equipment procurement, inventory accuracy and data management while ensuring governance and alignment to policies within Ciena and Contract Manufacturing.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Responsible for maintaining inventory accuracy in Ciena Assets Tracking System(CATS) tool; including inventory location, equipment status and financial accuracy to successfully support business needs and accounting.

Works with test engineering teams and vendors on equipment purchases, evaluates current inventory available and provides information to users to support investment decisions.
Liaisons with vendors and suppliers on product availability, price changes, performance, and improvements to ensure drive timely product availability, product performance, cost reduction and evaluate vendor performance.

Identifies and recommends improvements to processes, systems and policies currently in place by evaluating technical and business capabilities of the various tools and applications.
Facilitates and engage directly with our contract manufactures and repair sites primes to ensure inventory updates, including annual cycle-count, spares equipment requirements and test stations health status in line with production requirements.
Performs analysis and reports on assets inventory and KPI, including financial data to identify and address any inaccuracies, performance, or process misalignment.
Ensures relevant asset management governance, policies, compliance and business continuity assurance plans. Maintain best practices.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

A bachelor degree/diploma in Mechanical/Electrical/Optical Engineering
5-7 years of experience in assets management within the telecommunication industry and/or manufacturing.
Autonomous, highly collaborative, good communicator with strong organizational skills and attention to details

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Experience with Agile, JIRA and Oracle, Power BI and understanding of SQL databases would be an asset

4 month work term: September - December 2023

How You Will Contribute

As part of the Silicon Photonics design team, you will turn raw data into valuable insights that will help the team improve designs and fabrication processes. Your responsibility will be to mine the large amount of data we gather through the life cycle of our products to uncover patterns, correlations and create models that will lead to design optimization and robustness.

The ideal candidate is a flexible, highly technical problem solver, with interdisciplinary knowledge of photonic, test & measurement and data science. You feel at home in a dynamic, multi-team engineering environment, acting as an interface between chip design, test engineering teams, new product introduction engineering and process engineering.

In this role, you will

Gather and prepare relevant data to use in analytics applications.
Use a combined knowledge of photonics, computer science, modelling, and maths to solve problems.
Explore how empirical data can be used to create device compact models.
Create clear reports that can be actioned by stakeholders.

Enrolled in a Ph.D., master’s or bachelor’s program in Optics, Physics, Physics Engineering, or related discipline with a focus on data science techniques.
Proficient in high-level programming languages (e.g. python, MATLAB).
Experience in a variety of advanced statistical and machine learning techniques (e.g., regression, distributions, clustering, etc.).
Commitment to work full-time (40 hrs/week).

Knowledge of Apache Spark, and Databricks.
Knowledge of cloud technologies (AWS).
Experience with JMP or similar products.

Contrat de travail d’une durée de 4 mois : de septembre à décembre 2023

Au sein de l’équipe de conception de Silicon Photonics, vous transformerez des données brutes en informations précieuses qui permettront à l’équipe d’améliorer les concepts et les processus de fabrication. Créer des rapports clairs qui peuvent être utilisés par les équipes concernées.

La souplesse de travailler de façon autonome avec une supervision minimale ainsi que de faire partie d’une équipe élargie.

Engagement à travailler à temps plein (40 heures par semaine).

Connaissance d’Apache Spark et de Databricks.
Connaissance des technologies de nuage informatique (AWS).
Expérience avec JMP ou des produits similaires.

La pensée critique et les compétences en matière de résolution de problèmes sont essentielles pour interpréter les données.

Motivation, organisation, rigueur et volonté d’apprendre.

How You Will Contribute:
Reporting to Sr. Director, Optical Engineering, as part of the R&D Silicon Photonics chip design team in the High-Speed Photonic Component (HSPC) organization, as a Silicon Photonics Chip Designer, you will design and validate silicon photonics chips for high-speed transmitters and receivers, taking into account performance, cost and reliability requirements. You will play a critical role in the product development cycle, including chip design, defining and supporting tests, module prototyping and transfer to high-volume production.

You will define the photonic circuit layout (GDS) and interact closely with our wafer fab partners for wafer design verification, production and delivery.
You will organize and participate in photonic circuit design review meetings before release to manufacturing.
You will support the transfer to production of photonic chip designs in collaboration with our operations team and manufacturing partners.
You will actively contribute to continuous improvements (performances, yields, etc), along the whole product life cycle.
You will partner with other functional teams for the design of prototypes and products based on the Silicon Photonics platform.
You will monitor, document and communicate advancements and raise potential issues that may have influence on target specs, schedule and budget.

Initiative – you’re a self-starter who works with limited direction and is committed to delivering against aggressive deadlines.
Agility – you are readily able to make key decisions and manage competing and ever-changing account priorities.
Communication expertise – you possess the ability to influence and tailor your message and ideas to ensure understanding and agreement.

Problem solver – you possess the ability to troubleshoot and identify solutions to complex problems.

The Must Haves:

Masters or Ph.D. in Optics, Physics, Physics Engineering, or related discipline.
Knowledge of passive and active photonic integration circuits design.
Experience with software simulation/CAD tools.
Written and oral fluency in both French and English.

Assets:

Hands-on experience related to the characterization of photonic integrated components and circuits including DC and RF test methods for active and passive devices.
Experience with Cadence Virtuoso and Ansys Lumerical.
Knowledge of Optical Communications Systems.

Relevant du directeur de l'ingénierie optique, vous travaillerez au sein de l'équipe R&D pour la conception de puces photoniques au silicium de l'unité administrative High-Speed Photonic Component (HSPC). Définir les dessins des circuits photoniques intégrés (GDS) et interagir étroitement avec les partenaires de fabrication de gaufres pour la vérification du design, la production et la livraison des gaufres;
Organiser et participer aux revues de conception des circuits photoniques intégrés préalablement à l’envoi en fabrication;
Supporter le transfert en production des designs des circuits photonique en collaboration avec notre équipe des opérations et nos partenaires manufacturiers;
Contribuer aux améliorations continues (performances, rendements, etc.) tout au long de la durée de vie du produit;
Travailler étroitement avec les autres équipes fonctionnelles pour la conception des prototypes et produits basés sur la plateforme de photonique sur silicium;
Suivre, documenter et communiquer les avancements et soulever les problèmes potentiels pouvant avoir des répercussions sur l’atteinte des requis, de la cédule et du budget.

Our teams enjoy a culture focused on prioritizing a personalized and flexible work environment that empowers an individual’s passions, growth, wellbeing and belonging. Ciena Corporation is a network strategy and technology company that translates best-in-class technology into value. Our passion is to continuously provide an experience that is as rewarding as the outcome. Our solutions form the foundation of many of the largest, most reliable and sophisticated service provider, enterprise, government, and research and education networks across the globe. Ciena has been recognized as having an outstanding workplace culture.

Summary:

As a member of the Product Verification team you will participate in the system level testing of next generation products. The position includes exposure to technologies including optical transport, packet OTN and ethernet switching.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Perform product operational test verification assessments as directed by the project verification leader and help resolve complex technical issues.
Develop and execute test strategies and test procedures to evaluate equipment performance against quality objectives.
Collaborate with hardware, software, and system engineering staff to resolve problems related to specifications and expected customer behavior.
Work with other test groups on all levels of testing groups including system and network management to ensure customer and product quality objectives are met.
Analyze test results and assist with investigations and issue resolution.

Desired Skills:

Be able to execute test procedures at a technical level and assess impact at system level.
Ability to develop and program test automation scripts for operation testing, Python programming language is a plus.
Knowledge of optical networking and associated network level concepts.
Knowledge of packet and network level protocols.
Ability to work in teams, to learn and have a good work ethic
Ability to communicate and document technical issues and to summarize information into formal test reports.
Ability to understand customer’ perspective with a strong commitment to product excellence.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.

Education/Experience

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent

As a member of the Global Procurement Organization, the position will be responsible for defining supplier sourcing definition and strategic supplier selection for Ciena largest cost portfolio of Photonics Optics. Understand cost management and reduction in line with cost erosion market trends and margin targets, supply security, and overall supplier relationship development and collaboration. Candidate will be responsible for supply security and supply chain agility.

Fully responsible for interpreting, organizing, executing, coordinating, and evaluating major optical projects within the Procurement interface into our stakeholders.
Collaborates with and/or directs others to achieve business results and contributes precedent-setting innovations within R&D/PLM driving solutions for the most complex or risky business situations to develop an approved and qualified supply base, develop strategic partnerships that address our needs.
Creates measurable stakeholder value by delivery of market/supplier roadmaps while being a credible expert advisor to peers and internal/external customers while demonstrating success in accomplishing results via teamwork and leadership.
Being able to leverage and influence organizational culture to drive behavior change and gain stakeholder confidence at all levels by being unbiased and balanced in their approach
Participate in defining the optical supply chain architecture model, and participate in partner selection while adding value to require a seat at the table
Involved in the developing of next level management skills to bring a stronger degree of strategy while learning to manage a team of commodity managers in establishing a Portfolio/Commodity strategies and execution plan for long-term supplier development approach focused on delivering world class Quality, delivery and cost.
Define and Drive Supplier development, consolidation and/or localization initiatives for key commodities / regions, enabling improvements in overall total cost of doing business.
Develop, manage, and refresh individual and customized Optical technology, architecture and commodity sourcing strategies for each actively managed technology while guiding team on technical or business issues.

Contractual Support:

Look at new supplier technologies and assure NDA's are in place for technical discussions
Negotiate and execute master supply contracts and other critical agreements including but not limited to licensing agreements, SOWs, MOU’s etc.
Ensure best in class purchase contract terms and conditions are established with vendor to minimize quality, cost, and agility exposure to Ciena. Will support business unit and Legal organizations with the negotiation of Legal Agreements to facilitate business requirements, including Supply, Development & Stocking Agreements.

Security/Continuity of Supply:

Innovates and champions change within the R&D and Operations teams where required while develops plans in concert with NPI and introduce new products and processes in a timely manner where agility programs are established on GA.
Must ensure security of supply and monitor the hot issues at both the macro and at the micro economic level within the supply base. Must be able to influence/negotiate suppliers for allocation, monitor supply stability all commodities levels, ensure no revenue impacting issues and be able to communicate any and all issues effectively and precisely to extended teams. Candidate must develop strategy for supply de-risking such as VMI, multi-sourcing, capacity commitment etc., and be able to work with various groups to determine optimal supply security strategy.

Cost Reduction:

Candidate will be held accountable for the overall cost reduction performance of the Photonics/Optical Commodity Group while ensuring cost targets are achieved. Key objective is to achieve corporate level cost reduction targets as well as product or margin level cost targets.
Track market trend and conditions to ensure capitalization on improving trends as well as communicate where conditions may pose deterioration to the costs of the business unit and take appropriate measure if required.
Identification of more creative methods to save cost, through re-design, supplier transfers, or other supply chain adjustments to improve overall total cost

 Supplier Relationships:

Be accountable for driving key technology sessions with suppliers and their executives throughout the year and interface on a weekly basis usually
Candidate must foster strong working relationship with suppliers within his/her portfolio in order to maintain best in class overall support and supply to Ciena.
Candidate must enable frequent communication mechanisms with suppliers through business reviews to ensure constant alignment of priorities between supplier and Ciena while addressing any and all concerns from a support, quality and service level.

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE/SKILLS

Candidate must demonstrate the following skill sets:

15+ years Technical Engineering within the Optical commodities and familiar with Photonics, WSS, ROADM and Amplifier technologies.
Understands Procurement and Strategic Supplier Relationship Management experience in Optics area
Highly collaborative, with ability to partner with diverse teams with potentially conflicting agendas while displays emotional intelligence, including strong listening capabilities
Clear sense of accountability, personally feels committed to customer & stakeholder satisfaction
Technical understanding of telecommunication products and manufacturing processes with strong analytical abilities to make decisions based on technical data
Strong communications skills, with ability to articulate business cases and present to an executive audience
Excellent negotiation skills, and foster strong supplier working relationships in order to ensure best in class overall support
Must be able to influence and support several cross functional groups such as R&D, Material Management, Component Engineering, Product Line Management and the NPI Program Office, Supply Chain and EMS partners
Strong communication skills both orally and written

job_title: Senior Manager, Hardware Characterization and Product Integrity
job_description:
Ciena is committed to our people-first philosophy. Our teams enjoy a culture focused on prioritizing a personalized and flexible work environment that empowers an individual’s passions, growth, wellbeing and belonging. We’re a technology company that leads with our humanity—driving our business priorities alongside meaningful social, community, and societal impact.

What will you do at Ciena?

The Converged Packet Optical (CPO) organization is seeking a motivated, talented, and experienced leader to manage hardware characterization and product integrity. Both these areas are foundational in ensuring that products delivered to the market are robust and comply with interface and regulatory standards.

The Hardware Characterization (HWC) function validates new products in development to industry optical/electrical standards and performs additional testing to ensure product robustness. The Product Integrity (PI) function executes formal regulatory/commercial compliance testing on new products and supports global homologation activities. In addition, the PI team provides engineering guidance on safety/EMC design and assists with resolving technical compliance issues. Both functional areas support the complete CPO portfolio of products, these include platforms such as 6500, Waveserver, RLS, ELS and WaveRouter.

Responsibilities

Manage and lead a team to execute Hardware Characterization (HWC) and Product Integrity (PI) testing on New Product Introductions, LCM projects, and sustaining activities
Manage test programs through engaging design/release management teams to understand project requirements/timelines; perform test planning, scheduling, resourcing, reporting, work effort estimation/prioritization, product release recommendations, and escalations as required
Participate and contribute to HWC test plan development and reviews
Identify and drive HWC initiatives to improve team efficiency and effectiveness, example areas include test automation, test cases and methods, documentation, project tracking
Identify and drive PI initiatives to improve team efficiency and effectiveness, example areas include emerging compliance requirements, homologation tracking, project tracking/reporting
Manage test equipment needs – resolving gaps, planning/forecasting requirements, and assessing new products
Team management – performance, career development, feedback, mentoring, hiring (students, contractors, RFTs)

Collaboration with stakeholders

Design teams – hardware, software, systems, thermal, mechanical
Suppliers – test equipment, test labs
Customers – Account/Sales, Quality, System Engineering, PLM

Experience

Excellent communication, interpersonal, teamwork, and leadership skills
Highly motivated, organized, thorough, and detailed oriented
Strong project management skills
Experience with hardware development and verification
Exposure to hardware defect/issue analysis and resolution
Exposure to Telecom/Network standards for optical/electrical interfaces
Exposure to hardware regulatory/commercial compliance process and requirements e.g. product safety, EMC, NEBS/ETSI
Experience with hardware test equipment
Proven ability to work with multi-disciplinary teams
Knowledge and experience with communication system protocols and standards
Management or team leader experience
Engineering degree or equivalent with 10+ years’ experience

Job Description

The 6500 system is the flagship product of Ciena's Packet Optical Transport Portfolio. Optical networks continue to aggressively move towards Layer 0/1/2 converged infrastructures. Spend a coop term with the 6500 team delivering these Optical Ethernet Network solutions:

Next Generation optical transport solutions
Hybrid Layer 0/1/2 switching (OTN/Packet)

Develop and support tools to help the design teams deliver product solutions to the market,

Configure and connect nodes and test sets in the lab,
Write and execute test scripts

REQUIRED SKILLS AND HELPFUL EXPERIENCE

We are looking for enthusiastic and innovative computer technologist students to join our team for an 8 month coop term. As a member of this team, you need to be a self-motivated problem solver who likes to multitask. You also need to be a good communicator and a team player that revels in the challenge of solving technical issues. You must be happy and comfortable in the lab and love to make things go!
Experience using Linux based workstations
Experience writing scripts - experience with Python, Perl, TCL and/or Expect is an asset

C/C++ coding experience is an asset

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE

Enrolled in a diploma program for Computer Engineering, Computer Systems or equivalent.

The Opportunity:

4 month work term: May – August 2023

How You Will Contribute:

Ciena Corporation is a global networking leader holding the #1 market position in our field. The R&D headquarters in Ottawa is home to our world leading Digital Signal Processing (DSP) WaveLogic ASIC chipsets, forming the core of Ciena’s Optical Communications Systems.

We are looking for a passionate and enthusiastic student to help develop and evolve the automation infrastructure used for our next generation ASIC devices. As a member of the team, you will contribute to the infrastructure, design and integration of Ciena’s intellectual property into our next generation of ASICs. YouTube

RadioPublic

Creative discussions
Script support
Storyboard development

The assignment or management of a site director/producer

Compilation, editorial
Production of required animation and subsequent overlaying on green screen productions
Provide draft & final footage via various secure facilities. Nothing in production is ever to be available publicly
Final edits, picture lock
Color correction
Audio mixing, finishing
Final video delivery specifications according to our brand guidelines
Post-production editing to be performed with the Adobe Premier Pro suite.
Complete the post-production close out process, including posting the UHD and 1080P versions of the video into Kapost, our online video library and archival of all related video project files into our AWS S3 storage bucket. Also post the final video to the various approved delivery platforms

Overall management of the raw and final video footage in our AWS S3 storage cloud.

Knowledge of all aspects of credential management with excellent knowledge of PKIs and credential management services.

Experience with developing tools to support secure boot and hardware root of trust.

Experience with analysis tools such as SCA, DAST, SAST.
Practices & Frameworks: Threat Modelling, Agile, DevOps, OWASP.
Experience with translating security publications such as ISO 2700X:2022, NIST 800-XXX into actionable strategy.

L’équipe d’introduction de nouveaux produits est à la recherche d’un candidat dynamique pour le groupe responsable du développement et de l’amélioration des tests des produits photoniques. Valider des stations de tests de la nouvelle génération de produits photoniques.
Développer des tests automatisés en laboratoire sur des cartes photoniques.
Communiquer à l’équipe les résultats obtenus.
Développer des techniques de déverminage pour les problèmes identifiés.
Créer des guides de déverminage selon les informations recueillies.

FORMATION ET EXPERIENCE:

Inscrit dans un baccalauréat en génie électrique

PROFILE DU CANDIDAT:

Expérience en développement de code pour logiciel de test
Expérience dans la compréhension de schémas électriques
Expérience dans la prise de mesures optiques serait un atout
Base en télécommunication ou électronique et désir d’apprendre dans ce domaine.
Aptitude pour le déverminage et l’analyse de problèmes
Bonne communication orale, entregent, travail d’équipe
Bilingue (français, anglais)
Discipline de travail, doit être un joueur d’équipe

LIEU DE TRAVAIL: St-Laurent (Quebec)

The Vice President of Global Product Marketing leads the team responsible for developing the value propositions, messages and campaigns that sit at the core of Ciena’s broader marketing and sales enablement, and serves as a key advisor to Ciena’s executive team in areas of market strategy and insights. S/he has four main areas of leadership: Product and Solutions Marketing, Services Marketing, Market & Competitive Intelligence, and Global Programs. Integrating the efforts of these four areas, the successful candidate will provide outbound thought leadership and compelling content around Ciena solutions; and also provide inbound insights to multiple Ciena functions from a wide variety of listening posts.

This executive creates value propositions and messages based on a deep understanding of both external market interest and solution reality. This person is not a “hype generator,” nor one who simply parrots the latest buzzwords. Rather, this exec must be capable of understanding Ciena capabilities and market needs, and must translate complex technical capabilities into messaging and marketing campaigns that are easy for diverse audiences to understand and value.

Leadership style and capability is a critical aspect of the role. The successful candidate will be a consummate product and programs marketing leader who can demonstrate past success driving demand and creating dominant market positions for new and existing business-to-business technology products. This person will be adept at leading a team whose passion is translating technical features into clear and concise benefits that matter. The candidate must have a demonstrated ability to distill and edit the “interesting” to leave behind the “invaluable”.

The Vice President interacts with a broad set of players. S/he must be able to act as a credible spokesperson with customers, partners, analysts, press, investors, and employees. S/he must be capable of influencing without formal organizational responsibility. And s/he must be capable of developing respect from and rapport with variety of executives inside and outside the company including those with technical backgrounds (ie Product Line Management, R&D, Sales Engineering) and business backgrounds (ie Sales,). Collaborating with the Marketing Leadership Team to deliver a full and complete approach to marketing is critical to success in this role.

Duties and Responsibilities

Establishes a product roadmap-based portfolio marketing strategy which integrates into the broader marketing plan. Is considered the product plan of record ‘expert’ in the leadership team and works with other leaders to integrate the product roadmap into their marketing plans.
Leads a team responsible for developing crisp value propositions and superior competitive positioning across the product and services portfolios. Serve as the ultimate authority on the competitive set and maintains a comprehensive assessment of competitors’ existing products and anticipated strategies to help drive product development and marketing strategy.
Working with key hardware and software business stakeholders, to reflect their business plans into the overall portfolio marketing strategy.
Lead a team responsible for the development and execution of Ciena’s global thought leadership programs and campaigns. With experience in highly effective marketing strategies across the buyer journey to effectively break through the market noise and drive Ciena awareness and deeper customer engagements.
Lead the development and delivery of market/competitive insights to sales teams and Ciena executive team. Develop the cadence and mechanism by which insights are provided and ensure the team is distilling these insights into recommendations rather than “data dumps.”
Deliver sales enablement content to the sales team which is widely valued and consumed such that sales cycles are reduced, win rates increased, and customer satisfaction is improved.
Partner with the Product and Sales teams to develop an intimate knowledge of internal strengths and weaknesses and external threats and opportunities and build marketing plans accordingly.
Act as a public representative and evangelist for products at company events, industry events and client/partner/analyst/press/investor meetings and help position the company as a “first choice” provider in the industry.
Build and lead an exceptional, global Portfolio Marketing team; providing coaching and mentoring to a highly capable group of professionals.

Qualifications and Essential Skills

Proven track record in developing highly effective sales materials and marketing materials
BA/BS required; MBA is a plus
At least 10 years of product marketing experience in telecom/software/hardware technology industries
Understanding of key market trends and customer dynamics
Ability to excel at creating marketing strategy and vision and seeing it through to successful execution
Ability to easily distill highly technical concepts into marketing messaging, vehicles and campaigns that are accessible, easily understood and creative
Demonstrated ability to drive revenue through highly effective marketing
Exceptional leadership skills and proven ability to attract, develop and coach superior talent
Excellent oral and written communication skills (internal and external) and strong public speaking skills. Good listener capable of drawing on best ideas from a diverse group.
Demonstrated ability to build strong working relationships across multiple departments, matrix manage, and manage across geographies

Personal Attributes

Strategic and tactical, creative and disciplined, ability to roll up sleeves when needed, and strong ability to sift through details to arrive at important insights or points. Ability to be analytical when needed and then distill data into stories or insights.
Strong leadership skills with a highly collaborative and decisive approach. Ability to work in the reality of firm deadlines coupled with market ambiguity.
Driven, high-energy, self-starter; comfortable working in a fast-paced, dynamic, and high-growth environment
Understands and embraces importance of both internal and external personal relationships; able to build strong relationships with clients and partners and across all functions and levels internally. Executive presence to build credibility with executive audiences.
Simultaneously creative and grounded in reality. Demonstrated judgment about how key ideas or insights will be received by different audiences.
Impeccable work ethic, humble but confident
Excited by the opportunity to boldly do things differently than they’ve always been done before.

You will build solutions that provide Ciena engineers robust data pathways that allow for cross-regional communication and the infrastructure to support these pathways. You will own and drive entire solutions which include service network scalability, reliability, and troubleshooting. In this role you will work directly with Product Engineering, Product Management, Sales Engineering, Customer account teams, and Product support in bringing our next generation packet solutions to market. You will be responsible to define and develop Product and Solutions Engineering and Performance guidelines, support Customer Proof of Concept and Certification trials, develop and test Product Interoperability scenarios, and support our field engineers as a subject matter expert on bids and field issues.

What will you do at Ciena?
Deliver Product and Solutions Systems Engineering items as part of new product hardware and software releases. This typically includes development of items such as Product and Solutions Engineering Guidelines, Sales Engineering and Customer Introduction packages, Test Plans and Test Execution of Key Customer configurations, Definition of Performance metrics, development of Solutions blue-prints and other key items required by our Field Engineers.
Technical prime to drive key Packet Networking customer engagements which include trials or certifications for Ciena product. Complete test execution either in Customer labs, in the field, or at local premise. Capture any customer requests for incremental capabilities that could potentially be rolled into upcoming releases.
Develop and Test Packet networking solutions and applications in the lab to assess product performance, scalability and security. Applications may include Mobile backhaul, Ethernet business solutions, or Smart Grid applications.
Support the Global account/sales engineering community with pre-sales and post-sales activities that include customer bid (RFP/RFI) technical support, market readiness (new product introduction) support, technical consultation, solution evaluation and architecture design, and other engineering network design consulting.
Embrace the ‘feedback loop’ by engaging with various engineering teams to transform concepts, requirements and telemetry into services and tools
Be passionate about learning and adopting new technologies that will ease your day-to-day job.

Requirements:
Good IP routing knowledge both standards-based theory and configuration\provisioning (OSPF, BGP, ISIS, MPLS based IP VPN’s). 2-5 years of experience engineering packet transport solutions in the context of large carrier and enterprise networks is essential.
Hands-on experience engineering, testing, troubleshooting or deploying networks on Carrier Ethernet or IP based platforms with (Ciena, Alcatel-Lucent, Cisco, Juniper, Adva )
Hands-on experience and working knowledge of provisioning of packet networking related technologies (IP/MPLS, QinQ, 1588V2 , Synch E services, TDM etc. )
Ability to demonstrate knowledge in a technology or solution area such as Optical Transport Network (OTN), SONET/SDH, PON/FTTH, VoIP, IPTV, mobile backhaul, 2G/3G/4G/LTE/5G, etc.
Experience with Scripting (Python, RESTful, TCL, Expect, bash, Perl, JavaScript etc.) an asset.
Familiarity with security concepts and the handling of protected customer data
Highly self-motivated team player with ability to collaborate and interact with cross-functional organizations both within Ciena, our customers and with our partners in the face of significant challenge or ambiguity
Excellent presentation / communication skills.
Ability to work with customers and account teams to understand requirements and priorities
Successful practical problem solving, excellent written and interpersonal communication, and documentation skills
Ability for frequent Domestic and International travel at short notice.

Job description:

Ciena’s Supply chain procurement organization is looking for an experienced Director responsible to lead the activities of the component engineering team. The successful candidate will set and be responsible for the quality, the reliability specifications and the requirements for all procured components and OEM products within Ciena by working proactively the research and development team as well as with Ciena suppliers. The candidate will also work with the Global Commodity Managers (GCM) and Design teams to provide guidance into the selection of reliable technologies for all components for new designs, life cycle management activities, end of life transitions or to perform cost reduction initiatives as well as to participate in the development of commodity strategies.

The candidate will also be responsible to execute and report on the process performed by the component engineering team which includes the manufacturers and components onboarding process, manufacturer audits, reliability impact assessment of product change notifications (PCNs) the component life cycles, the component end of life (EOL), component failure root cause analysis, components environmental compliancy, the evaluation of products BOM as well as security of supply activities.

The component scope covers all direct commodities (printed circuits boards, interconnect, mechanical, optical, semiconductors and OEMs products) that are procured from Ciena supplier base represent $3B spend, +25,000 manufacturer part numbers, +600 suppliers.

Key responsibilities:

The Director for the component engineering team will be responsible for the following tasks in a timely & professional manner.

Manage the component engineer team (objectives, budget, strategies, tactical) – 16 employees
Co-Develop with the Global Commodity Managers the commodity strategies based on the component engineering commodities expertise
Support R&D team with manufacturer and component selection during New Product Introduction and Life Cycle Management programs
Collaborate with component manufacturers on all required technical aspects – technology roadmaps, component selection, component specification, reliability, alternate components, compliance, manufacturing process, quality, failure analysis and root cause analysis, manufacturing capacity, quarterly business review, factory audits, etc…
Lead a team of component engineers to document Component and OEM products life cycle and associated component information in Ciena Agile PLM system
Manage the reliability qualification of new component and new OEM products to relevant telecom standards
Document and manage the activities related to the supply base product change notice and end of life notifications
Reduce component supply risks through multi-sourcing, alternate sourcing that address manufacturer capacity, geopolitical risk, and technology obsolescence
Ensure compliancy of order book for REACH, RoHS, TSCA, Asbestos and other regulations
Ensure compliancy of order book for product safety requirements
Contribute to the overall supply chain and procurement digitalization process
Manage the quality policies and procedures related to the component engineering team and ensure they are up to date and executed upon within Ciena process
Collaborate with Ciena suppliers and 3rd party partners to acquire manufacturers and component related information
Support Customer Request for Information (RFI), Request for Proposal (RFP) and other compliance requests
Generate Key Performance Indicator (KPI) metrics related to component engineering team, quality scorecards
Overall process improvements

Qualifications and Experience required:

M.S Degree in electrical engineering or physics with at least 15 years of relevant experience
5 years minimum of people management experience
Strong communication skills, with ability to articulate success, challenges, and issues
Strong leadership skills to influence and drive process improvements as required
Ability to work collaboratively with cross functional teams (internal / external)
Clear sense of accountability, attention to details, organized and motivated to excel
Demonstrate experience/knowledge/understanding of telecom component commodities and their associated fabrication process
Demonstrate experience/knowledge/understanding of telecom manufacturers landscape
Knowledge relevant Telecommunication industry standards, Telcordia, IPC,JEDEC, etc.
Knowledge of environmental/regulatory compliance affecting telecom products and associated components
Proven track record and established subject matter expertise on component reliability, quality and failure mechanisms for telecommunication components and assemblies
Availability to travel 20% of his time

POSITION SUMMARY:

Continuous product cost reduction is an integral part of Ciena’s bottom-line margin contribution. The Product Cost Reduction Plan Leader’s role is to formulate & communicate the Procurement team’s product cost reduction plan as well as managing its execution throughout the year in line with Ciena’s financial cycle.

In conjunction with various Procurement and Supply Chain contributors and the Ciena Finance team, the Product Cost Reduction Plan Leader is responsible for defining Procurement’s in-year product cost reduction plan and Procurement’s portion of the OCNIS PPV budget. The Product Cost Reduction Plan Leader then works with key partners to ensure compliance to this plan throughout the year, assesses any variances as actuals materialize and as forecasts evolve and adjusts contingencies as required. Moreover, the Product Cost Reduction Plan Leader proposes any mitigation actions that may be required to remain on target.

Lastly, the Product Cost Reduction Plan Leader acts as an advisor and subject matter expert to Product Cost Management team members, other Procurement groups as well as the Director of the Product Cost Management team. In this latter capacity, the Product Cost Reduction Plan Leader will be called upon to actively contribute to preparation of data and presentation material for various internal reviews and ad hoc analysis requests.

Key collaborators include, but are not limited to, other Procurement groups, Supply Chain and Finance.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

In-Year Product Cost Reduction Plan

Works with various Procurement groups, Supply Chain Operations and Ciena Finance to compute in-year cost reduction contribution.

Establishes contingencies (underlays, overlays) required to de-risk the plan and/or align to target expectations.

Communicates the plan and its drivers to key Procurement stakeholders, coordinates with Ciena Finance prime to provide periodic status read-outs to Ciena leadership.

Monitors evolution of plan throughout the year, work with Procurement teams to identify mitigation actions required to remain on track to target..

Procurement OCNIS PPV Plan

Establishes the Procurement OCNIS PPV plan, monitors progress and ensures timely settlements of amounts due and collected.

Coordinates with Ciena Finance prime to provide periodic status read-outs to Ciena leadership.

Finance Quarterly Standard Cost Roll

Collaborates with Ciena Finance Cost Control team and provide cost recommendations during quarterly standard cost cycles (activity led by Ciena Finance)

Ad-hoc Analysis & Reporting Support, Subject-Matter Expertise

Assists Procurement Leadership team in conducting ad-hoc studies and with preparation of associated presentation materials.

Supports Procurement and Supply Chain teams by providing guidance and subject-matter expertise on product cost & product cost reduction related topics.

Candidate Profile:

Relationship builder at all levels of the organization with an exemplary track record.

Exceptional data analysis abilities
