Reporting to the Chief People Officer (CPO), as the Senior Director, People & Culture Business Operations and Employee Experience, you will play a critical role in Ciena’s continued transition from traditional talent practices to new ways of working which create resiliency for the organization and flexibility for the employee. This role will lead global business operations and strategy for Ciena’s People & Culture (P&C) function, and spearhead efforts to ensure employees have a positive experience to support the continued attraction and retention of exceptional talent.

Global Business Operations Strategy & Planning

You will partner with the P&C Leadership Team (PCLT) relative to the development and implementation of the People Promise strategy.
You will be accountable for driving the integrated planning, reporting, and review across the P&C function.
You will be responsible for strategy, delivery & management of the P&C technology roadmap, including technology requirements for all P&C sub-functions.

Employee Experience – transformation to a Target Interaction Model (TIM)

You will play a key role in determining the vision related to the future of work, driving the execution of business and people strategies to achieve overall objectives.
You will undertake an appraisal of the current state of P&C from service, maturity, governance, automation, business impact and employee experience perspectives and then establish a recommended baseline user experience for different customer groups, evaluating the P&C experience from their perspective.
You will deliver the Target Interaction Model (TIM) across Ciena, with a focus on P&C processes, systems, content, and organization, using utilization and employee satisfaction metrics to determine TIM effectiveness.
You will evaluate and implement technology and infrastructure to enhance the performance of the P&C team, and deliver an integrated and seamless technology experience, ensuring touch points are intuitive & available, partnering with key collaborators to ensure work flows seamlessly across functions.
You will partner with IT & Head of Rewards to build out the digitization & data strategy for the team.

Operations

You will manage day-to-day business operations and communications and work with the Chief People Officer (CPO) & PCLT to develop communications/updates to the executive.
You will drive the overall direction and coordination of the P&C budget in conjunction finance.
You will work with P&C Learning Business Partner and the Head of Rewards to ensure develop and implement appropriate strategies for Ciena.
You will be responsible for the operational delivery of employee surveys as well as the management of third-party partnerships with Garner and CRF.

You will be responsible for developing & optimizing systems and processes to measure the effectiveness of people programs worldwide and the strategic impact of these programs on Ciena’s business.
You will lead and manage P&C ‘s business continuity planning, data privacy policy and approach, and 3rd party vendor compliance.
You will lead and manage internal and external audit activities for P&C.

The flexibility to work independently and as part of a broader team – you thrive in a highly dynamic and collaborative team environment, but are comfortable working independently as required.

Communication expertise – you can effectively tailor a message/articulate a point of view to an audience to enable engagement and understanding at all levels of an organization.

Business operations experience

Experience in analytics & reporting

What will you do at Ciena as a New Grad Analog Design Engineer?

The Wavelogic family of products are widely used in Ciena's optical fiber transmission solutions and are one of the main contributors to Ciena's success in the telecommunications industry. Successful candidates will be joining a vibrant team with a proven track-record of success over 30-years of evolution and revolution in the advancement of high-speed circuits used in broadband fiber-optic modems. This team pioneered the introduction of the world’s first high-speed DAC and ADC analog macros that ushered in the era of coherent fiber-optic product solutions.

To further strengthen our team, we are looking for a hardworking analog design engineer who will be involved leading design of advanced high-speed analog circuits in the latest deep-submicron CMOS and/or BiCMOS technologies. Your role as a analog designer will be to deliver advanced high-speed circuits within a larger team who are responsible for a full mixed signal IP block solution that will be integrated into the Wavelogic family of products. These analog macros include design and delivery of electrical interface-facing DAC and ADC based SERDES solutions for 112G and 224G, optical-line-facing high-speed DAC and ADC circuits interfacing with optical modulators and detectors, transimpedance amplifiers, modulator driver circuits, and critical precision analog circuits for control and monitoring functions, etc.

In this role:

You will be responsible to perform feasibility work with various circuit topologies to recommend the best solution to carry through implementation by weighing tradeoffs and discussing these with other members of the team to guide formation of a circuit requirement specification.
You will be responsible for the complete and detailed design of the analog blocks assigned to you including close collaboration with analog layout team members and other members of the design team as applicable who may assist with some aspects of the overall implementation through to full GDSII delivery to Ciena’s integration partner.
Reporting on status updates on a regular basis, participation in team meetings and sharing of experience with the rest of the group.
Characterization in Ciena’s state-of-the art lab of the analog circuits from test-chips through to full product implementation working with members of our Analog Macro Integration team.

What technical experience and personal skills are required for this role?

Electrical or computer engineering, computer science or other applicable scientific degree at the BEng/BSc, MEng/MSc, or Ph.D level.
Experience in designing and testing microwave structures.
A highly motivated self-starter, able to work independently, while being a great teammate
Excellent organization, written and oral (English) interpersonal skills
Proficiency with use of applicable design tools required for microwave simulations.

What additional assets can help me in this role?

Experience with 2.5D or 3D E-M tools such as HFSS or EMX

The above lists are intended to describe the general nature and level of work, and they are not intended to be a comprehensive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required to be qualified and to be performed by the selected candidate. You will have an opportunity to better understand the role through the interview experience.

job_description:
Ciena is committed to our people-first philosophy. Our teams enjoy a culture focused on prioritizing a personalized and flexible work environment that empowers an individual’s passions, growth, wellbeing and belonging. We’re a technology company that leads with our humanity—driving our business priorities alongside meaningful social, community, and societal impact.

Do you really enjoy paid time off?
Find out about our FLEX PTO and company shutdowns so you can rejuvenate and reenergize.

Are you looking to earn extra income to work with your friends?

Bring your friends with you on this new career opportunity and get rewarded for referring great talent! The openings are limitless and YOU earn cash for every eligible referral we hire.

Then Unlock your potential at Ciena!

What will you do at Ciena?

We are looking for a highly motivated and knowledgeable Telecommunication systems engineer to be a member of the Solutions Engineering & Introduction team, passionate about Ciena’s Converged Packet Optical portfolio. As this role has a high level of lab work, you must be in Ottawa, Ontario, to be able to have access to the state-of-the-art labs.

In this technical customer-facing role, you will be responsible for product testing, customer lab and field trials, solution integration, lab certification testing, and support product interoperability scenarios. You will also act as an optical communications domain specialist for our customers.

You will partner closely with Product Engineering, Product Management, Sales Engineering and Customer Account teams in bringing our Converged Packet Optical solutions to market globally, specifically focusing on the Global Cloud Networking segment. Occasional travel to customer sites is a requirement!

Responsibilities and Activities:

Support the Global Cloud Networking (GCN) account and sales engineering teams with pre-and post-sales engineering activities such as lab certification, leading customer trials, providing technical presentations, or sharing knowledge via training delivery.
Close engagement with GCN customers and act as the technical prime for product and technical consultation, solution and application evaluation, feature improvements and other pre-sales engineering activities.
Develop, automate, and execute functional test plans to verify product capabilities in Ciena and customer labs with detailed documentation of results.
Lead troubleshooting and resolution by working with the Product Engineering team in addressing product issues during customer trials or certification.
Gather customer requests for incremental capabilities that could be rolled into upcoming product releases. Bring observations and requirements to the Product Engineering team for product improvement.
Support the development and delivery of customer technical presentations, acceptance test plans and engineering guidelines. Develop other vital technical documents to facilitate understanding and introduce new technology, product, or solution into customer networks.
Be passionate about learning and embracing new technologies and ideas that improve the day-to-day work of the team and the customer experience.

What technical experience and personal skills are required for this role?

Technical skills:

Knowledge in optical fibre communications systems, optical network engineering concepts and technologies (high-capacity coherent modems, fixed and flexible grid optical networks), instrumentation and test methodologies in the context of the data center, cloud networking, service provider and enterprise networks is essential.
Hands-on experience in engineering, testing, and deploying DWDM and Packet Optical with Ciena’s Converged Packet Optical products is highly desired.
Hands-on experience with API (REST, NETCONF, gRPC), streaming telemetry and YANG data models (Ciena, OpenConfig) is essential.
Hands-on experience developing automation tools using Python, JAVA and Shell-based scripting tools is essential.
Understanding of Docker, microservices, open switch, Kubernetes and other cloud-based technologies is an asset.
Hands-on experience debugging and troubleshooting optical fibre communications systems is desirable
Bachelor or Master of Engineering degree in Electrical/electronic/telecommunication, or equivalent degree with one to three years of field experience

Interpersonal skills:

Standout colleague with the ability to collaborate and be compatible with cross-functional organizations within Ciena, our customers and our partners in the face of significant challenges or ambiguity
Ability to work as an individual contributor as well as supply as part of a team.
Work proactively with customers and account teams to understand requirements, and priorities and execute the project plan.
Ability to multitask and adapt to changing projects, priorities, and business drivers.
Work calmly and efficiently in high-pressure situations during lab activities, technical issue resolution, and under tight schedules.
Availability for occasional domestic and international travel to customer sites or other Ciena locations.

Communications skills:

Strong written and interpersonal communication, documentation, and presentation skills.
Experience in the development and presentation of informative materials.
Meticulous execution of test plans or method of the procedure while thoroughly documenting results in a comprehensive matter.

We are big proponents of life-work integration and provide the flexibility and tools to make it a reality with remote work and hybrid work environments.
We believe in an inclusive, diverse, and barrier-free work environment which makes for empowered and committed employees.

How You Will Contribute:

As a Network Systems Engineer, you will support Cena’s Packet-Optical Platform and Cloud Applications portfolios. You will be a key technical contributor to the Solutions Engineering and Introduction which is a customer-facing team and will work directly with Product Engineering, Product Management, Sales Engineering and Solutions and Services organizations in bringing our cutting-edge solutions to market. You will work directly with Ciena customers, helping them to solve their networking challenges and advance their business objectives with Ciena solutions.

As technical prime, you will drive customer engagements which include product and solution proof of concepts, in-lab, and in-field trials. In the process, you will capture product issues and customer requests for enhancements that could be embedded into upcoming releases.
You will define, create, and validate customer technical presentations, networking and solutions test plans, and engineering guides - all vital technical documents to facilitate the understanding and introduction of new technology and/or products /solutions into customer networks.

Initiative – You’re a self-starter who works with limited direction and is committed to delivering against aggressive project deadlines from inception through to deployment.

Agility – you thrive in high-pressure situations during lab activities and technical issue resolution. You multitask and readily adapt to changing environments, projects, priorities, and business drivers.
A sense of urgency – what’s important to the customer is equally important to you. You make getting things done a priority.
Communication – the ability to work with customers and account teams to understand requirements and priorities, use your technical expertise to develop the optimal solution, and tailor your message, ideas and presentations to the audience to ensure understanding and agreement.
The flexibility to work independently and as part of a broader team – you thrive in a multi-disciplinary team environment, but are comfortable working independently as required.
Relationship builder – with a proven ability to influence and work with others.
A commitment to learning – you keep abreast of network security industry developments, constantly seeking new ways to bring value to your work.

The Must Haves:

Bachelor of Science in Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent is desired.
Strong understanding of optical fibre communications systems, optical network engineering concepts and technologies. Instrumentation and test methodologies in the context of the data center, cloud networking, service provider and enterprise networks are essential
Familiarity with YANG data model structures and NBIs such as CLI, NETCONF, GRPC and REST.
Experience with scripting & coding (Python, RESTful, Perl, JavaScript,) is Must.
Willing to travel from a few days to a few weeks at a time to other Ciena facilities or Customer sites.
Familiarity with various test instrumentation and/or test methodologies in a lab environment is an asset
Experience on optical platforms such as Ciena, Cisco, and Nokia, is desirable.

Assets:

Strong coding experience with Python and C, C+ is an asset.

Dans ce rôle, vous devrez interagir étroitement avec les autres membres du groupe HSPC ainsi que d'autres groupes R&D internes. Cet environnement à la fine pointe de la technologie et œuvrant à concevoir les produits optiques les plus performants au monde saura vous motiver et vous garder à l’avant plan.

Ciena is committed to our people-first philosophy. Our teams enjoy a culture focused on prioritizing a personalized and flexible work environment that empowers an individual’s passions, growth, wellbeing and belonging. We’re a technology company that leads with our humanity—driving our business priorities alongside meaningful social, community, and societal impact.

What will you do at Ciena as a High-Speed Analog Test Engineer?

The Wavelogic family of products are widely used in Ciena's optical fiber transmission solutions and are one of the main contributors to Ciena's success in the telecommunications industry. Successful candidates will be joining a vibrant R&D team with a proven track-record of success over 30-years of evolution and revolution in the advancement of high-speed circuits used in broadband fiber-optic modems. This team pioneered the introduction of the world’s first high-speed DAC and ADC analog macros that ushered in the era of coherent fiber-optic product solutions.

To further strengthen our team, we are looking for a hardworking high-speed analog test engineer who will participate in the development of methodologies and techniques to enable production test of custom circuits in the latest deep-submicron CMOS and/or BiCMOS technologies. You will be under the oversight of a senior analog architect within a larger team who are responsible to deliver a full mixed signal IP block solution integrated into the Wavelogic family of products.

Types of custom analog circuits delivered by the team include electrical interface DAC and ADC based SERDES solutions for 112G and 224G and optical-line high-speed DAC and ADC circuits connecting to optical modulators and detectors. The team also develops broadband circuits such as transimpedance amplifiers, modulator drivers, and critical precision analog circuits for control and monitoring functions, etc..

In this role:

· You will be responsible to assess new and emerging high-speed test equipment, fixtures and probe-technology for high-speed analog circuits operating up to 100GHz bandwidth.

· Developing testing techniques to screen parts for both functional and parametric defectivity working closely with the circuit designers and 3rd party test implementation facilities

· Reporting on status updates on a regular basis, participation in team meetings and sharing of experience with the rest of the group.

· Participate in high-speed modelling and characterization of the test hardware itself, which needs to operate at very high speeds.

· Participate in the design of custom analog circuits which can be implemented on the target ASIC itself as a ‘built in test function’ or reside external to the ASIC as a stand-alone circuit forming part of the test hardware to perform a custom high-speed test function.

What technical experience and personal skills are required for this role?

· Electrical or computer engineering, computer science or other applicable scientific degree at the BEng/BSc. level.

· Academic or work-term experience with ASIC design

· A highly motivated self-starter, able to work collaboratively with other team members

· Ability to methodically address technical problems

· Excellent organization, written and oral (English) interpersonal skills

· Experience with circuit test equipment such as high-speed oscilloscopes, vector network analyzers and spectrum analyzers.

· Experience with analog design tools from Cadence, Mentor and Synopsis

What additional assets can help me in this role?

· Experience with 2.5D or 3D E-M tools such as HFSS or EMX for modelling of high-speed fixtures

· Experience with mixed-signal design validation using state-of the art probing and test equipment

Our teams enjoy a culture focused on prioritizing a personalized and flexible work environment that empowers an individual’s passions, growth, wellbeing and belonging. We’re a technology company that leads with our humanity—driving our business priorities alongside meaningful social, community, and societal impact.

Job Description

Ciena is a telecommunication world leader for high-speed optical fiber data transmission. Our organization count more than 7,500 employees located in 28 countries, including 100+ in our Quebec City site. The products we develop are intended to be installed on the modem card and our clients are biggest data transfer provider in the world.

The Quebec City office oversees the researched and development, prototyping and encapsulation of integrated optical components. Afterwards, we participate in the production transfer to high volume manufacturer in Asia.

Our laboratories, with an area of 715 m2, are the cutting edge of technology. They include a class ISO 7 clean room, a test & measurements, a reliability laboratory and a mechanical workshop.

The tasks and activities supported by our multidisciplinary team of engineers and physical engineering technologists are diverse and focused on the development of processes surrounding the micro-encapsulation of electro-optical elements. These tasks include processes for active alignment of optical micro-components, electro-optical characterization of various parts, automated installation of discrete parts (die bonding), wire bonding, automated inspection and more.

An internship with us could lead to an exciting career at the end of your studies!

Roles and Responsibilities

Support elements of the assembly process flow of the product:
Passive optical and mechanical assembly sequences
Part placement, adhesive dispense, metrology, automatic visual inspection
Active optical alignment processes
Alignment routine, optical fiber bonding and lenses attach
Develop, improve and optimize current processes (Clean room work required);
Analyze, track and provide improvement ideas on prototype assemblies coming from our Contract Manufacturing partner and our internal assembly line.

Required Qualifications / Profile

You are studying in one of the relevant fields: Electronics, Optics, Physics, Mechanics.
Excellent ability to solve technical, scientific and experimental problems;
Excellent team work and communication skills;
You must be fluent in English and French;

Location

Québec, Québec, Canada

Position Type

Winter/spring 2023 (full time - 40h/week)

Étudiant, Procédé d’Assemblage de Composants Photoniques

Description de l’emploi

Ciena est un leaders mondial dans le domaine des télécommunications par fibre optique à haut débit. Nous comptons plus de 7500 employés répartis dans 28 pays, dont une centaine dans nos installations de Québec. Les produits que nous développons sont destinés à être installés sur les cartes modem vendues aux plus grandes compagnies de transfert de données dans le monde.

Le bureau de Québec est en charge de la R&D, du prototypage ainsi que l’encapsulation des futures générations de composants d’optique intégrés. Par la suite nous participons au transfert en production à grande échelle en Asie.

Nos laboratoires, d’une superficie de 715 m2, sont à la fine pointe de la technologie. Ils sont constitués de salles blanches de classe ISO 7, d’un secteur dédié aux tests et mesures et à la fiabilité, ainsi qu’un atelier mécanique.

Les tâches et activités prises en charge par notre équipe multidisciplinaire d’ingénieurs et de technologues en génie physique sont très variées et axées sur le développement de procédé entourant la micro-encapsulation d’éléments électro-optiques. Ces tâches comportent des procédés d’alignement actif de microcomposants optiques, de caractérisation électro-optique de diverses pièces, d’installation automatisée de pièces discrètes (die bonding), de microcâblage par fil d’or (wire bonding), d’inspection automatisé, etc.

Un stage chez nous pourrait déboucher vers une carrière passionnante à la fin de tes études!

Rôles et Responsabilités
Supporter certains éléments du procédé d’assemblages.
Développer les séquences d’assemblages des composants passifs
Positionnement des pièces, dispense des adhésifs et métrologie
Établir les procédés d’alignement actifs.
Positionnement, routine d’alignement et collage des fibres
Développer, améliorer et optimiser les procédés actuels (du travail de laboratoire sera requis)
Analyser, suivre et proposer des idées d’amélioration surs assemblages à l’interne.

Profil et Qualifications Requises
Vous étudiez dans l’un des domaines suivants: Électronique, optique, physique ou mécanique.
Excellente habileté à résoudre des problèmes techniques, scientifiques et expérimentaux;
Excellente aptitude au travail d’équipe et à la communication;
Maitrise des langues française et anglaise à l’écrit et à l’oral;

Localisation

Québec, Québec, Canada

Type de Position

Hiver / Printemps 2023 Temps complet/régulier (40hrs/semaine)

.

job_description:
Ciena is committed to our people-first philosophy. Our teams enjoy a culture focused on prioritizing a personalized and flexible work environment that empowers an individual’s passions, growth, wellbeing and belonging. We’re a technology company that leads with our humanity—driving our business priorities alongside meaningful social, community, and societal impact.

Why Ciena:

We are big proponents of life-work integration and provide the flexibility and tools to make it a reality with remote work and potentially, part-time work.
We believe an inclusive, diverse and barrier-free work environment makes for empowered and committed employees.
We recognize the importance of well-being and offer programs and benefits to support and sustain the mental and physical health of our employees and their families and also offer a variety of paid family leave programs.
We are committed to employee development, offering tuition reimbursement and a variety of in-house learning and mentorship opportunities.
We know that financial security is important. We offer competitive salaries and incentive programs, RSU’s (job level specific) and an employee share option purchase program.
We realize time away to recharge is invaluable. We offer flexible paid time off!
Great work deserves recognition. We have a robust recognition program, with ongoing and enhanced awards for exemplary performance.

How You Will Contribute:

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Optical Engineering, as a Senior Product Engineer, you will be capturing and understanding the basic physics and design intent of the product design with a view to both maintaining and improving the product performance over time. In addition, this position will include working with the wider team to influence and ensure the development of a reliable product, transferred successfully to our CM partner and manufactured successfully at or better than cost objectives. This position requires a candidate with a strong, demonstrated record in the development and manufacture of advanced optoelectronic modules and devices in a Telecom or Datacom environment.

Working closely with our Design team and manufacturing partners, who have responsibility for developing and maintaining manufacturing equipment and capability, the Product Engineer shall act as the lead for pulling new products from R&D and work with the various parties to plan and action the transfer to our contract manufacturer (CM) and then maintain them in production.

You will be the design authority for products in manufacture and act as support for failure. analysis and develop for local Ciena and CM engineers.
You will work with R&D and the Operations team to:
define production requirements and specifications in terms of process and test
develop and deliver training programs for CM operators and engineers
develop and maintain process and assembly tools in manufacture
You will manage and track product yield and develop detail product cost reduction plan according to targets, and track performance to plan through BOM management of the products in mass production.
You will work with Test Engineering to create and manage automated analysis tools and key performance indicators (KPIs)
You will be responsible for the development of the packaging materials for products and associated recycling programs

What Does Ciena Expect of You?

Initiative – you’re a self-starter who works with limited direction and is committed to delivering against deadlines.
Agility – you are readily able to make key decisions and manage competing and ever-changing priorities.
Communication expertise – you possess the ability to influence and tailor your message and ideas to ensure understanding and agreement.
The flexibility to work independently and as part of a broader team – you thrive in a multi-disciplinary team environment, but are comfortable working independently as required.
Relationship builder – with an ability to influence, you’re able to get work done through others.
Problem solver – you possess the ability to identify solutions to complex problems.
A commitment to learning – you keep abreast of technology and product developments in the photonics space and apply that knowledge in the best interests of Ciena.

The Must Haves:

A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in a relevant discipline and 5+ years product experience in the design, manufacture or test of optoelectronic products. Therefore a solid understanding of the principles and theory of optical devices such as lasers, modulators, detectors, optical sub-assemblies and transceivers is required.
Knowledge and experience of the production processes related to the manufacture of optoelectronic devices.
Understanding of Product Lifecycle Management coupled with a demonstrated track record of launching complex optoelectronic module products to market.
Problem solving and the ability to solve technical issues in a high-pressure environment and resolve issues locally and remotely.
Experience working in a global marketplace interacting with multi-functional, multi-locational teams. Therefore, good written and oral communication skills are required.
Strong computer and analytical skills, including database management and data analysis tools.
Willingness and ability to travel as this position will involve a higher than average level of travel (estimated at around 20%) to support the products during transfer to the CM and maintain the product in manufacturing. Travel will initially be largely within North America but will involve some Asian travel as the product transfers to manufacture.

We are looking for analog and mixed-signal design engineers to contribute to the development of high-speed serial and parallel I/O, and clock generation / distribution for SoC ICs. Strong fundamentals in circuit theory, design, and layout

Creative design ability to solve problems demanding the highest levels of speed and power performance
Experienced in Cadence design flow
Strong communication and presentation skills
Ability to work independently as well as in teams
Ability to work across functions and levels

High-speed and analog circuit design experience including one or more of the following: PLLs, DLLs, High-speed custom and I/O, SerDes, Clock and Data Recovery, line drivers, equalizers, regulators.
Deep sub-micron process design experience (Finfet experience desirable)
A track record of developing high telecommunication ASICs
Working knowledge of industry best practices
0-2 years work experience

How You Will Contribute:

As a Network Management Technology Introduction Engineer, you’ll be part of the Solutions Engineering & Introduction team within the Product Line Management organization. You will support Ciena’s Network Management Applications, SDN and Network Design Tools and play a key role relative to our domain controller: MCP (Manage, Control and Plan). MCP provides end-to-end lifecycle operations that unify network and service management and online network planning through software-defined control.

As a key technical player on this team, you will ensure engineering readiness for the deployment of our solutions in the field. You will develop and present a series of technical deliverables that enable the introduction of new product features and solution functionality. As a customer-facing engineer, you will be involved throughout the development cycle and drive consulting discussions, trials and demonstrations with our customers and partners. You will be involved in architecture decisions and participate in product evolution reviews.

You will have the opportunity to interface with some of Ciena’s largest customers globally and will be at the forefront as we position our next generation solutions. You will directly contribute to winning new strategic business opportunities by demonstrating our leadership in the industry.

As a technical prime, you will lead lab engineering activities such as installing, configuring, integrating, and testing MCP with Advanced Applications / Planning tools to assess / characterize functionality, performance, security, etc.
You will drive customer engagements which include product and solution proof of concepts, demos, lab / field trials. In the process, you will capture product issues and customer requests for enhancements that could be embedded into upcoming releases.
You will produce videos and develop technical documents, test plans, knowledge transfer charts that explain product architecture, features, and capabilities.
You will support global account teams with pre- and post-sales engineering activities that include customer bids, technical consultation, solution/application evaluation and design, and other engineering Q&A support.
You will engage with target customers, assess their needs / requirements.
You will be a key contributor in defining/influencing roadmaps in collaboration with the Ciena Product Management team.

What Does Ciena Expect of You?

Initiative – You’re a self-starter who works with limited direction and is committed to delivering against aggressive project deadlines from inception through to deployment.
Communication – the ability to work with customers and account teams to understand requirements and priorities, use your technical expertise to develop the optimal solution, and tailor your message to the audience to ensure understanding and agreement.
Agility – you thrive in high-pressure situations during lab activities, troubleshooting and technical issue resolution. You multitask and adapt to changing priorities and business drivers.
Attention to detail – able to meticulously execute software installation, and server administration procedures.
The flexibility to work independently and as part of a broader team – you thrive in a multi-disciplinary team environment, but are comfortable working independently as required.
Relationship builder – with a proven ability to influence and work with others.

The Must Haves:

Bachelor of Engineering, Computer Science, or related discipline
Hands-on knowledge of Linux Operating Systems
Hands-on knowledge of virtualized and cloud environments (VMware ESXi, OpenStack, AWS, GCP) and cloud-based application deployment techniques
Understanding of container technologies and microservice architectures
Understanding of SDN and Network Management / Automation concepts
Knowledge of REST API interfaces and tools (Swagger, Postman)
Knowledge of networking technologies and concepts (L0 to L3)
Ability to travel varying from a few days to a few weeks at a time to other Ciena facilities or Customer sites.

Assets:

Understanding of PON concepts
Understanding of SaaS concepts
Experience in Security, Radius authentication, LDAP, TACACs, etc.
Familiarity with YANG data model structures

Your Role

As part of an R&D organization, you will be responsible for the configuration and management of network elements, both real and simulated, that will be used by product verification and design teams.

Your Responsibilities

Prime technical design, implementation, and support of L0/L1/L2/L3 Multi-platform lab

What will you do at Ciena as a Senior Analog Design Engineer?

The Wavelogic family of products are widely used in Ciena's optical fiber transmission solutions and are one of the main contributors to Ciena's success in the telecommunications industry.

You will be joining a vibrant team with a proven track-record of success over 30-years of evolution and revolution in the advancement of high-speed circuits used in broadband fiber-optic modems. This team pioneered the introduction of the world’s first high-speed DAC and ADC analog macros that ushered in the era of coherent fiber-optic product solutions.

To further strengthen our team, we are looking for a hardworking senior analog design engineer who will be involved leading design of advanced high-speed analog circuits in the latest deep-submicron CMOS and/or BiCMOS technologies. Your role as a senior analog designer will be to architect and deliver advanced high-speed circuits within a larger team who are responsible for a full mixed signal IP block solution that will be integrated into the Wavelogic family of products. These analog macros include design and delivery of electrical interface-facing DAC and ADC based SERDES solutions for 112G and 224G, optical-line-facing high-speed DAC and ADC circuits interfacing with optical modulators and detectors, transimpedance amplifiers, modulator driver circuits, and critical precision analog circuits for control and monitoring functions, etc..

In this role:

You will be responsible to perform feasibility work with various circuit topologies to recommend the best solution to carry through implementation by weighing tradeoffs and discussing these with other members of the team including system groups to guide formation of a circuit requirement specification.
You will be responsible for the complete and detailed design of the analog blocks assigned to you including close collaboration with analog layout team members and more junior members of the design team as applicable who may assist with some aspects of the overall implementation through to full GDSII delivery to Ciena’s integration partner.
Reporting on status updates on a regular basis, participation in team meetings and sharing of experience with the rest of the group.
Characterization in Ciena’s state-of-the art lab of the analog circuits from test-chips through to full product implementation working with members of our Analog Macro Integration team.

What technical experience and personal skills are required for this role?

Electrical or computer engineering, computer science or other applicable scientific degree at the BEng/BSc, MEng/MSc, or Ph.D level.
Experience leading designs in advanced BiCMOS and/or CMOS technology with a minimum of 7-years industrial experience.
A highly motivated self-starter, able to work independently, while being a great teammate
Ability to methodically address sophisticated technical problems
Excellent organization, written and oral (English) interpersonal skills
Proficiency above the intermediate level with use of applicable design tools from Cadence, Mentor and Synopsys for analog design (eg Virtuoso, Calibre, STAR-RC, MMSIM).
A history of successful analog circuit product deliveries.

What additional assets can help in this role?

Experience with 2.5D or 3D E-M tools such as HFSS or EMX
Experience with team-leadership within an analog macro design group
Architect or System Design experience for complex analog macro IP solutions using tools such as MatLab and/or C++
Experience with mixed-signal design validation using state-of the art probing and test equipment

The above lists are intended to describe the general nature and level of work, and they are not intended to be a comprehensive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required to be qualified and to be performed by the selected candidate. Job description:

Ciena’s Supply chain procurement organization is looking for an experience Senior Manager responsible to lead the activities of the component engineering team. The successful candidate will set and be responsible for the quality, the reliability specifications and the requirements for all procured components and OEM products within Ciena by working proactively the research and development team as well as with Ciena suppliers. The candidate will also work with the Global Commodity Managers (GCM) and Design teams to provide guidance into the selection of reliable technologies for all components for new designs, life cycle management activities, end of life transitions or to perform cost reduction initiatives as well as to participate in the development of commodity strategies.

The candidate will also be responsible to execute and report on the process performed by the component engineering team which includes the manufacturers and components onboarding process, manufacturer audits, reliability impact assessment of product change notifications (PCNs) the component life cycles, the component end of life (EOL), component failure root cause analysis, components environmental compliancy, the evaluation of products BOM as well as security of supply activities.

The component scope covers all direct commodities (printed circuits boards, interconnect, mechanical, optical, semiconductors and OEMs products) that are procured from Ciena supplier base represent $3B spend, +25,000 manufacturer part numbers, +600 suppliers.

Key responsibilities:

The senior manager for the component engineering team will be responsible for the following tasks in a timely & professional manner.

Manage the component engineer team (objectives, budget, strategies, tactical) – 16 employees
Co-Develop with the Global Commodity Managers the commodity strategies based on the component engineering commodities expertise
Support R&D team with manufacturer and component selection during New Product Introduction and Life Cycle Management programs
Collaborate with component manufacturers on all required technical aspects – technology roadmaps, component selection, component specification, reliability, alternate components, compliance, manufacturing process, quality, failure analysis and root cause analysis, manufacturing capacity, quarterly business review, factory audits, etc…
Lead a team of component engineers to document Component and OEM products life cycle and associated component information in Ciena Agile PLM system
Manage the reliability qualification of new component and new OEM products to relevant telecom standards
Document and manage the activities related to the supply base product change notice and end of life notifications
Reduce component supply risks through multi-sourcing, alternate sourcing that address manufacturer capacity, geopolitical risk, and technology obsolescence
Ensure compliancy of order book for REACH, RoHS, TSCA, Asbestos and other regulations
Ensure compliancy of order book for product safety requirements
Contribute to the overall supply chain and procurement digitalization process
Manage the quality policies and procedures related to the component engineering team and ensure they are up to date and executed upon within Ciena process
Collaborate with Ciena suppliers and 3rd party partners to acquire manufacturers and component related information
Support Customer Request for Information (RFI), Request for Proposal (RFP) and other compliance requests
Generate Key Performance Indicator (KPI) metrics related to component engineering team, quality scorecards
Overall process improvements

Qualifications and Experience required:

M.S Degree in electrical engineering or physics with at least 15 years of relevant experience
5 years minimum of people management experience
Strong communication skills, with ability to articulate success, challenges, and issues
Strong leadership skills to influence and drive process improvements as required
Ability to work collaboratively with cross functional teams (internal / external)
Clear sense of accountability, attention to details, organized and motivated to excel
Demonstrate experience/knowledge/understanding of telecom component commodities and their associated fabrication process
Demonstrate experience/knowledge/understanding of telecom manufacturers landscape
Knowledge relevant Telecommunication industry standards, Telcordia, IPC,JEDEC, etc.
Knowledge of environmental/regulatory compliance affecting telecom products and associated components
Proven track record and established subject matter expertise on component reliability, quality and failure mechanisms for telecommunication components and assemblies
Availability to travel 20% of his time

Communication expertise – you possess the ability to tailor your message and ideas to the audience to ensure understanding and agreement.

An ability to go ‘up and down the ladder’ – capable of seeing the big picture, but also understanding the importance of the details and analysis with a focus on streamlining and improvement.

A commitment to learning – you keep a finger on the pulse of Cloud trends and issues and apply that knowledge to Ciena’s advantage.

The Must Haves:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field coupled with proven experience in large-scale, cloud-based infrastructure (AWS, Asure or Google preferred).

Demonstrated knowledge of either Python or Java.

Well-versed in deployment and maintenance of AWS services (EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, VPC, Cloudtrail, Load Balancer).

Experience in DevOPS tools for Infrastructure deployment and configuration management experience on Windows and Linux (Packer, Terraform,Ansible/Puppet/Chef).

Knowledge of automation and CI/CD pipelines including git as the VCS and Cloud native application architecture and development.

Assets:

Knowledge of Cloud Security Services.

Experience in REST API usage and design including micro service architecture.

Well versed in DNS, Load Balancing, SSL, TCP/IP and networking.

Working knowledge in in atl east one monitoring and logging tool – ELK or Splunk or Datadog.

Ability to manage long term, project/milestone-based work with multiple teams.

Design:

- Execute test sequences on initial prototypes to understand correct operation of prototypes
- Aid in the design and development of test hardware solutions, including helping in PCB design

- Document test procedures for internal and external use

Analysis:
- Use internal Data and Analytics tools to understand test parameters and test limits
- Provide feedback regarding circuit operation and target specifications
- Make automated test adjustments based on all analysis

Support:
- Provide test coverage for initial products developed by and deployed to the Ciena R&D community

Software Skills:

- Scripting with various command-line interpreters (Linux and Windows based)

Posting Title: Optical Measurements Engineer

What will you do at Ciena?

Ciena is recognized as a leading supplier of state-of-the-art fiber optic transmission technology, and an important aspect of this development is lab work. Join the WaveLogic Science team and leverage our advanced research lab capabilities to experimentally verify new digital signal processing (DSP) algorithms and hardware designs for next generation high-speed optical systems.

Responsibilities

Design and run experiments to evaluate DSP algorithms and hardware for next-generation high-speed optical communication systems.
Analyze, document, communicate, and present the results from complex experiments and large data sets.
Support other Ciena teams through automation and analysis of optical experiments.

General Activities

Create innovative solutions for experimental issues.
Automate, analyze, and visualize experimental data in MATLAB.
Create and perform simulations of experiments then validate predictions via measurement.
Analyze problems in your specific areas of knowledge, which would be a subset of: optical physics, communications theory, probability, and high-speed/RF electronics.
Independently plan and schedule work.
Test at 800 Gb/s and beyond in the lab.
Advanced technology demonstrations for customers.

Collaboration with stakeholders

Interface and collaborate on technical designs with DSP, hardware, firmware, electro-optic, and systems teams.
Share expertise and best practices with lab teams.

Areas of impact

Key technologies to enable state-of-the-art DWDM optical transport development.

Experience

Post-graduate degree in Math, Physics, or Engineering with focus on optical physics, DSP, or communications.
Must have experience working in a lab environment with optical and/or RF technologies.
Must have MATLAB experience.
Python experience is an asset.
